4148281023.title: Data Analyst
4148281023.description:
About the job
En AXPE Consulting estamos transformando el mundo de la Tecnología. Por ello, te invitamos a vivir una experiencia única desarrollando tu carrera en una Compañía multinacional que mira hacia el futuro. Nuestros valores definen nuestra identidad, son la palanca que nos ayuda a hacer realidad nuestro propósito y guían todas nuestras acciones y decisiones: apostamos por el TALENTO.
Desde el departamento de IT, buscamos un perfil de Data Analyst con al menos 2 años de experiencia para participar en un proyecto retador y tecnológicamente innovador 👩‍🚀🚀

¿Qué buscamos de ti?

NECESARIO:
Grado en Ciencias de Datos, Informática, Sistemas de Información o áreas relacionadas.
Más de 2 años de experiencia trabajando con Power BI, Report Builder y Snowflake.
Experiencia práctica con servicios de Azure.
Conocimientos sólidos de SQL para manipulación y consulta de datos.
Dominio de Power Automate para automatizar flujos de trabajo y procesos de informes.

DESEABLE:
Experiencia con DAX y funciones avanzadas de Power BI
Valorable experiencia en empresa sector e-commerce
Conocimientos de Python o R para análisis de datos avanzado
Familiaridad con las mejores prácticas de gobernanza y seguridad de datos

¿Qué te ofrecemos?
📈 Oportunidad de desarrollar tu carrera en contexto global.
👨‍💻 Contrato indefinido.
🌍 Modalidad Híbrida, 3 días presenciales y 2 en teletrabajo.
⚕ Seguro médico a precio reducido (para ti y familiares directos).
📚 Formaciones y certificaciones a nuestro cargo, que te permitan crecer profesionalmente junto a nosotros.
💸 Salario competitivo.
🚀 Formar parte de una compañía donde se fomentan las comunidades tecnológicas, el intercambio de conocimiento y la excelencia técnica.
En AXPE estamos orgullosos de ser una empresa experta en tecnología que apuesta fuerte por el talento. La responsabilidad corporativa es inherente a nuestro modelo de negocio, impulsamos la educación tecnológica tanto a nivel formativo como laboral.
📢 📢 Formar parte de AXPE es liderar la transformación del sector tecnológico.

4152267576.title: Power BI & Data Specialist
4152267576.description:
About the job
excelia es una firma multinacional de Consultoría, Tecnología y Servicios profesionales con más de 25 años de experiencia. Prestamos servicio en más de 50 países de Europa, América Latina y Estados Unidos desde nuestras 10 oficinas propias.

📢 Buscamos un Power BI & Data Specialist

Si tienes experiencia en Power BI, bases de datos y entornos Azure, y buscas un reto donde puedas aportar autonomía e independencia, ¡esta oportunidad es para ti!

🔍 ¿Qué buscamos?
✅ +3 años de experiencia en Power BI y bases de datos.

Buen conocimiento de los conceptos empresariales de servicios financieros y de las métricas clave.

Identifica investigaciones e informes sobre oportunidades beneficiosas de uso de datos en diferentes departamentos o entornos.

4117113446.title: Data Analyst
4117113446.description:
About the job
Company Description

THE WORLD OF UBISOFT

Ubisoft’s 19,000 team members, working across more than 30 countries around the world, are bound by a common mission to enrich players’ lives with original and memorable gaming experiences. Their commitment and talent have brought to life many acclaimed franchises such as Assassin’s Creed, Far Cry, Watch Dogs, Just Dance, Rainbow Six, and many more to come. Ubisoft is an equal opportunity employer that believes diverse backgrounds and perspectives are key to creating worlds where both players and teams can thrive and express themselves. If you are excited about solving game-changing challenges, cutting edge technologies and pushing the boundaries of entertainment, we invite you to join our journey and help us create the unknown.

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile brings together dedicated and experienced professionals that are focused on crafting high-quality F2P games for mobile. We strongly believe in the core values at the centre of our Ubilife, which encourage us to take ownership of our work, continually striving for excellence while promoting the sharing of knowledge across individuals and teams, without losing our sense of enjoyment and fun, while taking care for one another. We strive for a safe and respectful workplace for all team members and we’re transparent about the measures we are taking to do so. For this reason, Ubisoft’s Code of Conduct has been released publicly on our corporate website for all current and future team members.

Do you want to join us in the world of mobile gaming? If so, read on!

Job Description

YOUR DAILY ADVENTURE

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile is currently seeking a Data Analyst to help our team on their next adventure. The Data Analyst will support insight initiatives for our BI team. This person will report to the Live Producer. Your daily adventure:


Turning data into actionable insights, by performing hands-on research, data exploration and analysis, to drive decisions and strategies for user acquisition, retention, and monetization. 
Work with the game teams to provide insights into user behaviour, answer key business questions and support in AB test design and analysis. 
Carry out projects on machine learning for behavioural segmentation and monetization. 
Debugging and problem-solving issues to ensure the delivery of accurate and clear analysis, reports and tools. 
Effectively communicate results and insights to senior stakeholders throughout the organization. 
Coordinate, challenge and share the best analytical practices and methods within the organization. 
Stay up to date with the latest developments in Machine Learning technologies and Data Science trends. 
Contribute to the knowledge base and culture of the team. 


Qualifications

YOUR SKILLS

Are you serious about fun? Do you consistently seek out learning opportunities and aim to beat your high score? Are you open to new ideas, perspectives and cultures and believe that it takes a world to build a world? At Ubisoft, you’ll work alongside passionate and talented teams who are imagining the future of entertainment.


Master's degree in a quantitative field (i.e. Physics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science...). PhD in any of these disciplines is a plus. 
5+ years relevant work experience in similar positions, ideally in mobile gaming industry. 
Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python for data exploratory analysis 
Experience with cloud-based big data solutions such as Redshift, BigQuery.
Solid knowledge of data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, Microstrategy, etc. 
Robust understanding of advanced statistics suitable for analysis of skewed populations. 
Experience designing effective ways of communicating, visualising and reporting results/analysis. 
Experience in predictive analytics and segmentation. 
Excellent problem-solving capabilities with strong attention to details. 
Work permit for Spain obtained prior to applying for the position is a must. 


What can make you stand out:


Experience with Agile philosophies (e.g.: Scrum, Kanban, XP) and project management tools (e.g.: JIRA)
Software engineering skills, including best practices like CI/CD and Git. 
Self-motivation, organization skills, team spirit, proactivity. 
Passion for games. Interest in mobile F2P games. 


Additional Information

YOUR LIFE AT UBISOFT BARCELONA MOBILE (and PERKS)


Hybrid Work from Home Policy and WFH Parent Policy: Possibility for new parents to work from home 80% of the time. 
Flex working schedule: 40hrs per week with start time between 8 AM – 10 AM and leave from 5 PM (Friday from 2 PM). 
Reduced schedule (35 hrs per week) in July and August, Easter, Christmas holidays, and special days like Sant Jordi and Revetlla de Sant Joan. 
Personal Matters Hours: 24 hours paid for by Ubisoft that you can use for personal matters. 
Holidays: 25 days per year + 1 day in your Ubi-Birthday. 
5 extra holiday days on the year you celebrate your 5th/10th/15th/20th year with us. 
Ticket Restaurant: 200€ per month, and Flexible compensation plan (Ticket Transport & Ticket Nursery). 
Health insurance with Cigna, including Physiotherapist & Psychology sessions with a reduced price. 
Life Insurance with AXA. 
Mobile Device Grant of 400 EUR starting on your 1st year in the company. 
Language trainings in English, Spanish, and French. 
Professional development training & programs, based upon request. 
Ubisoft games with discount and Uplay PC for free. 
Locally roasted craft coffee by INCAPTO (it’s very, very good).

4026014580.title: Data Analyst (Product)
4026014580.description:
About the job
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products — including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more — help our 50+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‌ 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work™. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren’t kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They’re some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions 🤘

We’re looking for a superstar Data Analyst who does not believe there is a data task that can be too hard 🦬 From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills and delivering value.

Up for the challenge? Get in touch 👇

What You’ll Be Doing

Understanding our business and its processes through our data
Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and service teams
Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business
Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying
Maintaining and creating new dashboards to track metrics and visualise insights
Promoting data literacy across the company, organising and holding workshops

What You'll Need

Previous experience in an analytical role, creating impactful solutions
A strong background/education in a quantitative discipline
5+ years of experience with SQL
Great skills with Python or other programming languages
Evidence of strong mathematical and statistics knowledge

Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Important notice for candidates:

Job scams are on the rise. Please keep these guidelines in mind when applying for any open roles.

 Only apply through official Revolut channels. We don’t use any third-party services or platforms for our recruitment.
 Always double-check the emails you receive. Make sure all communications are being done through official Revolut emails, with an @revolut.com domain.

We won't ask for payment or personal financial information during the hiring process. If anyone does ask you for this, it’s a scam. Report it immediately.

By submitting this application, I confirm that all the information given by me in this application for employment and any additional documents attached hereto are true to the best of my knowledge and that I have not wilfully suppressed any material fact. I confirm I have disclosed if applicable any previous employment with Revolut. I accept that if any of the information given by me in this application is in any way false or incorrect, my application may be rejected, any offer of employment may be withdrawn or my employment with Revolut may be terminated summarily or I may be dismissed. By submitting this application, I agree that my personal data will be processed in accordance with Revolut's <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Candidate Privacy Notice

4160778066.title: Senior Business Data Analyst

4167265856.title: Data Analyst
4167265856.description:
About the job
Position Summary

The Business Unit Printing & Converting (BUPC) is looking for a Data Analyst.

Your main mission will be to translate data into valuable information and actionable recommendations for the business. This global position will be a key enabler for the BU in the achievement of our 2025 profitability.

You will be a key member of the BUPC Finance team with the role to manage and enhance our reporting capabilities while working closely with the Data Engineering team. This role involves gathering business requirements, developing insightful reports, and ensuring data accuracy and consistency across various dashboards. The ideal candidate will be proficient in analytics tools and have a deep understanding of business needs.

The BU Printing & Converting includes 11 Manufacturing sites in a context of a new ERP harmonization across all entities, and covers the following main streams Finance & Controlling, Operations, Sales & Marketing, R&D.

Main Responsibilities

Report Development:

Design, develop, reports and dashboards
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and reliability
Translate complex data into actionable insights for business stakeholders.
Work closely with business teams to understand reporting requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
Plan data source acquisition ahead with data engineers to deliver reports in a timely manner
Propose and maintain UX / UI best practices

Continuous Improvement & Documentation:

Document reporting processes, methodologies, and data definitions.
Recommend improvements to reporting tools and workflows to enhance efficiency.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in analytics and visualization.

Data Quality & Validation:

Identify and escalate data inconsistencies or anomalies to the data engineering team.

Support the Finance team’s evolution from basic reporting to new state of the art business intelligence tools

Accompany users to change

Process changes and corrective maintenance

Support IT Data & Analytics operating model

Create Data Analytics key users’ community within the BU

Professional Experience

You have a Bachelor Data Analytics, Business Intelligence, or a related field.

3+ years of experience in data analysis, reporting, and visualization.

Proficiency in BI tools such as Tableau® (certification), Power BI, and Excel.

Knowledge of SAP HANA, Anaplan / OneStream is a plus

Experience working with large datasets and data warehouses.

Personal Attributes

Innovative spirit and interest in company processes

Solution oriented mindset

Drive to continuously improve your area

High sense of responsibility and independent working practice, showing initiative and high level of reliability

Great data visualization skills by presenting analytical findings in a clear and concise manner

Adaptable to work to both technical and non-technical audiences

Team player with good communication skills

Excellent level in English (French is a plus)

For more than 130 years, and over 50 countries, BOBST has always been at the forefront of innovation and we want to accelerate connectivity, digitalization, automation and sustainability to make packaging better than ever.

BOBST is one of the world’s leading suppliers of equipment and services to packaging and label manufacturers in the folding carton, corrugated board and flexible materials industries. Join our highly qualified staff and together, let’s shape the future of the packaging world.

4145961916.title: Global Data Analyst
4145961916.description:
About the job
As a key member of the Global Product team, you will lead the development and management of media planning and budget optimization data products for our Converged platform. Your role will involve driving the creation, evolution, and adoption of these global products.

You will support various Product Owners and market champions by designing and developing media planning and budget optimization models and solutions, including reach and cost modelling. Your efforts will ensure these solutions align with organizational goals and maximize user adoption across the global network.

Mission & Responsibilities

General Experience: 6+ years of professional experience within the Media industry, ideally within Data Analysis or Product Development around budget optimisation and/or media planning. 
Media Knowledge: A deep and comprehensive understanding of the media landscape. This knowledge is essential for navigating the complex media ecosystems, understanding key players, and applying strategies effectively across various media channels. A strong understanding of media planning, touchpoints, and industry trends is critical to success in this role. 
Analytical & Technical Skills: A strong analytical mindset with a solid understanding of mathematics and probability. Experience applying these skills to media-specific models such as reach curves and budget optimization is fundamental. 
Programming Knowledge: A strong understanding of programming, particularly in Python and/or R (or another programming language such as SAS, Matlab, etc.), to support data analysis and modelling. Proficiency is not required, but he/she should be comfortable working with these tools for handling and processing data. 
Insights Background:  Experience in extracting actionable insights from data is highly valuable. The ability to analyse and interpret data to provide meaningful, data-driven recommendations is key for influencing decisions and strategies. 
Cloud Platform Knowledge: A good understanding of cloud platforms, with an emphasis on Google Cloud Platform (GCP), as the ecosystem increasingly points toward cloud-based solutions for data management and scalability. 
Personal Skills:  A proactive, resourceful individual who seeks solutions and embraces innovative approaches. Must be able to stay focused, effectively land ideas, and break down complex problems into actionable steps. Comfortable investigating new possibilities and finding creative solutions to challenges that may not have predefined answers. 

Previous Experience & Industry Background

6+ years’ experience in supporting media, data and/or digital transformation projects. 
Proven success in leading large-scale, technology-driven change initiatives. 
Experience within the media industry. 

Soft Skills & Competencies 

Languages: English (Fluent). 
Ability to lead complex initiatives/projects and perform tasks in an efficient and self-sufficient manner. 
Strong written and verbal communication skills to interact and engage with stakeholders at all levels of the organization (global, local, regional, business unit etc.). 
Team/line management. 
Ability to work in a multicultural and multinational environment, with sensitivity to cultural communication styles. 
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to anticipate and address change-related challenges. 
Perfect knowledge of MS office tools. 
Strong interpersonal skills such as creativity and curiosity. 
Familiar with digital marketing channels & planning strategies.

Media Knowledge: A deep and comprehensive understanding of the media landscape. This knowledge is essential for navigating the complex media ecosystems, understanding key players, and applying strategies effectively across various media channels. A strong understanding of media planning, touchpoints, and industry trends is critical to success in this role. 
Analytical & Technical Skills: A strong analytical mindset with a solid understanding of mathematics and probability. Experience applying these skills to media-specific models such as reach curves and budget optimization is fundamental. 
Programming Knowledge: A strong understanding of programming, particularly in Python and/or R (or another programming language such as SAS, Matlab, etc.), to support data analysis and modelling. Proficiency is not required, but he/she should be comfortable working with these tools for handling and processing data.

4173153201.title: Data Associate
4173153201.description:
About the job
Wood Mackenzie is the global data and analytics business for the renewables, energy, and natural resources industries. Enhanced by technology. Enriched by human intelligence. In an ever-changing world, companies and governments need reliable and actionable insight to lead the transition to a sustainable future. That’s why we cover the entire supply chain with unparalleled breadth and depth, backed by over 50 years’ experience. Our team of over 2,400 experts, operating across 30 global locations, are enabling customers’ decisions through real-time analytics, consultancy, events and thought leadership. Together, we deliver the insight they need to separate risk from opportunity and make confident decisions when it matters most.

WoodMac.com

Wood Mackenzie Brand Video

Wood Mackenzie Values

Inclusive – we succeed together
Trusting – we choose to trust each other
Customer committed – we put customers at the heart of our decisions
Future Focused – we accelerate change
Curious – we turn knowledge into action

Job Description

We are looking for a Data Associate to join Wood Mackenzie’s Power and Renewables Project Tracking Data team.

This role will focus on data collection via research.

Associates are our front line for data collection and lay the groundwork for industry leading analysis.

The candidate will work closely across our Power and Renewables teams to support coverage of the global renewable industry.

Ideal candidates are thoughtful, intellectually curious, and creative. Attention to detail and dedication to continuous process improvement are critical in this data curation focused role.

Responsibilities

Create, monitor, and maintain data relating to power plants by conducting primary and secondary research. Examples of targeted data include: Renewable project lists, data centers, company financials, asset transactions, tender announcements, and policy developments.
Evaluate the alignment of our data published sources such as regulatory agencies, market operators, and developer disclosures.
Collaborate with colleagues across multiple time zones and disciplines to leverage best practices and deliver according to project timelines.
Perform established workflows to execute data collection and improve data quality.

About You

Proven analytical capabilities, both qualitative and quantitative.
Demonstrated interest in data management and in the renewable/energy industry.
Excellent problem solving, documentation, communication and organization skills, and attention to detail.
An engaging nature, capable of connecting with co-workers, clients and industry stakeholders in a wide range of professional settings including giving presentations.
A deep intellectual curiosity about what drives markets based on economic principles.
Passionate ownership of projects and excitement to share accomplishments with fellow Woodmackers
Strong listening and critical thinking skills.
Fluency in English. Additional European language skills, and/or Arabic are a plus.
Comfortable working with common Excel functions and query languages.
You are committed to contributing to a welcoming and inclusive environment, are sensitive to diverse perspectives, and are passionate about equity in the workplace.

Equal Opportunities

We are an equal opportunities employer. This means we are committed to recruiting the best people regardless of their race, colour, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. You can find out more about your rights under the law at www.eeoc.gov

If you are applying for a role and have a physical or mental disability, we will support you with your application or through the hiring process.
WoodMac.com
Wood Mackenzie Brand Video
Wood Mackenzie Values
Inclusive – we succeed together
Trusting – we choose to trust each other
Customer committed – we put customers at the heart of our decisions
Future Focused – we accelerate change
Curious – we turn knowledge into action

4124134361.title: Data Analysis and Reporting Specialist
4124134361.description:
About the job
We are building up the data governance process globally and expanding our Group Controlling Team.

The Data Analysis and Reporting Specialist will analyze Data in alignment with Business and Project Teams within the Global MDM Program and develop rule based data reports for Material-, Customer-, Supplier- and Operations Data and support the Development of Global Data Quality Management Process and Data Cleansing.

A job that matters: Your Tasks

Develop Data Quality-, Cleansing and Migration Reports with T-Sql programming and creation of complex stored procedures, triggers, views, and user defined function in SQL server to meet the functional requirements
Support the technical setup of Migration of data from multiple sources and different formats to relational data warehouse, staging databases using complex stored procedures, SQL scripts for extraction, transformation and in template of loading of data
Close alignment with Business and Project Teams to identify and specify the data requirements for Data Quality Management, Risk Minimization and Data Migration
Maintenance of authorization groups, management of access rights and management of report distribution
Automate the complete reporting process from data extraction to reporting, for example cleansing reports for business users / dependency reports to check cross object completeness
Implementation of data profiling, data harmonization, deduplication and data Cleansing based on business rules defined object wise

An experience that matters: Your Skills

University degree in Data Science, IT, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or similar
Minimum of 5 years of functional experience with Data Analysis and Reporting
Highly proficient in T-Sql programming and vast experience in creating complex stored procedures, triggers, views, and user defined function in SQL server to meet the functional requirements 
 SAP Table Knowledge is a must 
Experience in technical setup of Migration of data from multiple sources and different formats to relational data warehouse, staging databases using complex stored procedures, SQL scripts for extraction, transformation and in template of loading of data
A strong multi-tasker-capable of planning, organizing details while communicating effectively on all levels within the organization
Demonstrated ability to navigate and influence within a multi-matrix organizational structure, effectively collaborating with cross-functional teams and stakeholders to drive initiatives forward
Demonstrated ability to work in a challenging environment and provide open feedback
Business Proficiency in English

A workplace that matters: Our offering

Best opportunities in a globally operating company valuing diversity, inclusion, sustainability and mutual trust
Attractive remuneration package
Opportunity for flexibility with a hybrid working model
Home office allowance
25 days paid annual leave
Additional health insurance
200 BGN Food vouchers
Public transportation card
Optional parking space
Multisport card
Language training opportunity
Employee referral program
Brand new modern office premises in a class A business building
Fresh fruits in the office
Training and mentorship programs
Access to over 15,000 LinkedIn Learning courses to assist in your professional development

4172062891.title: Senior Data Analyst
4172062891.description:
About the job
The Story so far: Who we are
Founded in August 2020, Huspy started as a digital mortgage platform and quickly evolved into the largest proptech company in the EMEA region. Backed by leading investors such as Sequoia, Balderton, Founders Fund, and Olayan, we have experienced rapid growth with offices in Dubai, Abu Dhabi, Madrid, and Valencia. Our mission is to revolutionize the real estate industry by building an all-in-one super app designed to empower agents and mortgage brokers.

The Main Event: What you'll do 

Our Data team is at the heart of our decision-making, providing the insights and infrastructure to fuel growth and innovation. Join us to play a vital role in transforming data into actionable intelligence at Huspy!

You’ll join Huspy’s Data team as a Data Analyst with a focus on Business Intelligence, where you’ll support business units by delivering actionable insights and creating impactful reports. Your work will be crucial in helping teams make data-driven decisions, optimize performance, and align with Huspy’s business objectives. You will take ownership of BI tools and dashboards, ensuring data quality and reliability for stakeholders across the organization.

Responsibilities:


Develop and Maintain BI Dashboards: Design, build, and maintain dashboards and reports in Tableau (preferred) or similar BI tools, ensuring they provide clear and actionable insights for business stakeholders.

Data Extraction and Analysis: Use SQL and other data extraction tools to gather, clean, and analyze data from various sources, including Snowflake.

Collaborate with Stakeholders: Work closely with business, product, and engineering teams to understand their data needs, translating business questions into analytical requirements and solutions.

Optimize Reporting: Continuously enhance reporting systems for scalability and efficiency, ensuring reports are easy to access, interpret, and act upon.

Support Data-Driven Decisions: Provide insights and recommendations based on data analysis to support decision-making and performance optimization.

Ensure Data Quality: Implement quality checks and maintain data accuracy across BI systems, working with data engineering to resolve any data issues.

Document BI Processes: Create and maintain documentation for BI processes, data definitions, and dashboard usage guidelines to support consistency and transparency.


The Perfect Match: What you bring


Educational Background: Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., Statistics, Data Science, Business Analytics). A Master’s degree is a plus.

Experience: Minimum of 5 years of experience in a data analytics or BI-focused role.

BI and Visualization Expertise: Strong proficiency in BI tools such as Tableau (preferred), Power BI, or Looker, with the ability to create visually compelling and easy-to-navigate dashboards.

Technical Proficiency: Advanced SQL skills for data extraction and manipulation; familiarity with data platforms like Snowflake (preferred) is beneficial.

Data Analysis and Reporting Skills: Experience in conducting data analysis and generating insights to support business needs, including KPI tracking and performance reporting.

ETL Skills: Familiarity with ETL processes for data preparation, ensuring clean, accurate, and well-organized data for analysis.

Attention to Detail: Strong commitment to accuracy, with the ability to identify and correct data discrepancies.

Communication Skills: Ability to communicate complex findings clearly and effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Collaborative Spirit: Experience working cross-functionally, especially with product, engineering, and business teams to align data insights with business strategies.


What will set you apart


Experience with Our Tool Stack: Hands-on experience with Tableau, Snowflake, dbt, and Airflow is a strong plus.

Advanced Analytical Knowledge: Proficiency in Python or R for advanced data analysis and modeling.

Experience in Data-Driven Organizations: Previous experience in a fast-paced, data-centric environment where BI plays a strategic role in decision-making.

Business Acumen: Strong understanding of business processes, KPIs, and metrics relevant to the PropTech or startup sector.

 Sounds like you? Apply below!

4169598356.title: Product Data Analyst

4158337855.title: Business Intelligence Analyst
4158337855.description:
About the job
Your mission is to support the business to take data informed decisions through actionable insights and to develop the data culture aligned with Bobst vision

In this position you will be part of the Purchasing team and key for our digitalization journey. The position is based in Barcelona, Spain. The team’s mission is to support the business to take data informed decisions and to develop the data culture aligned with Bobst vision. You will be responsible for translating data into valuable information and actionable recommendations for the business directly reporting to the business intelligence. You will design, develop, and maintain decision-making systems, dashboards, performance measurement and reporting solutions

Main Responsibilities

Design and development of tools, KPI reports and dashboards for all business areas
Maintain accurate and reliable data, clearly defined KPI and single source of truth approach
Ability to develop data-driven solution by using machine learning model, Python/R
Support the Purchasing team to maintain new state of the art business intelligence tools
Create a great user experience through easy to use and visual appealing dashboards
Perform analysis of user needs, be a force of proposition during continuous improvement workshops
Drive collaboration with other departments and sharing knowledge to users
 Structure the document Library of the department and maintain the internal portal

Education 

B.Sc. or MSc in Computer Science, Data Analytics, Business Intelligence, or a related field

Experience Required

At least 3 years of professional experience in Business Analysis with Purchasing and/or supply Chain exposure

Specific knowledge 

Proven track record of leading and implementing change management projects for an international organization

IT / Computer knowledge 

Analytical approach with command of MS Office and BI Tools (esp. Tableau Desktop, Tableau prep or similar software)

Experience with SQL, Python/R and Machine leaning model

Good knowledge of ERP SAP ECC & SAP S4 Hana and Supplier Relationship Manager system (Jaggaer, Ariba, Coupa…)

Languages Capabilities

Fluent in English, other languages are beneficial

Personal Skills (behavior, Mindset)

Excellent communication, negotiation and problem-solving capabilities paired with ability to network and establish strong relationships.

As Business Analyst

You have an Business Intelligence background, together with sound purchasing or supply chain experience with preferably 3 years of proven track record in a similar function in an industrial environment (machines’ industry or similar)

You have successful experience in a similar position in industry in international environment.

You have the ability to cope in a matrix organization with different stakeholder in a multinational company.

You are self-confident and trustworthy personality with intercultural affinity.

You are a good communicator, and you strongly perform in teams

Show initiative, just do it attitude.

Ability to deal with ambiguity.

You have a structured and analytical mind-set enabling you to efficiently drive and implement various projects simultaneously

For more than 130 years, and over 50 countries, BOBST has always been at the forefront of innovation and we want to accelerate connectivity, digitalization, automation and sustainability to make packaging better than ever.

BOBST is one of the world’s leading suppliers of equipment and services to packaging and label manufacturers in the folding carton, corrugated board and flexible materials industries. Join our highly qualified staff and together, let’s shape the future of the packaging world.

4136878417.title: Data Analyst
4136878417.description:
About the job
About This Role

Gartner RESSO(Research Engagement Services Strategy and Operations) is looking for a Data Analytics who has a passion for analytical problem solving to be part of our growing team. This individual will solve a wide range of problems related to content analytics, and interaction analytics, demand sensing, staffing models, cost reporting, automation, standard reporting, and ad-hoc analytics. Individuals in this role will work closely with RESSO leadership to structure problems, identify data sources, perform analysis, and communicate findings. Strong performers will build skills to independently own project workstreams and interact with stakeholders. Projects will include a mix of team problem solving and independent problem solving. Some projects will also involve automation and collaboration with the Information Technology team.

What You’ll Do

Partner with RESSO colleagues to do analysis that surfaces actionable insight for the RES organization. Effectively communicate findings to drive adoption and implementation. 
Project ownership: Contribute to key projects like RES service level analytics, associate performance analytics, etc. 
Leads the development of custom Power BI dashboards, interactive deliverables, and innovative prototypes to enhance asset team and delivery consultant productivity gains. 
Develop and maintain custom build SQL queries as the Power BI report data source and address ad-hoc analytics requests. 
Domain expertise: Become a deep subject-matter expert on Gartner’s data, analytic tools, reports & data infrastructure. Take responsibility for problem solving, root cause analysis, and devising testing methodologies for validation and articulately explaining data sources to senior audiences. 
Continuous improvement: Support and enable improvement initiatives related both to RESSO deliverables (e.g. new data products, innovative data sources, analytic insights, tools) as well as operational process improvement (e.g. improving RESSO processes and communications). 

What You’ll Need

Experience: 3-4 years of experience involving analysis of large volumes of data with strong hands-on experience with analytical tools. Ability to gather, analyze, restructure, identify and articulate insights from qualitative and quantitative data Ability to creatively design the user experience of data visualizations, dashboards, and reports leveraging Power BI
Education: Bachelor’s Degree, preferably with a quantitative concentration (e.g., statistics, data science, mathematics, engineering, operational research, computer science, or economics)
Exceptional problem solving: Proven track record of solving complex problems, thinking creatively, and using data to tell a story. 
Communication: excellent written and verbal communication skills with the desire to share technical knowledge and information with others. 
Technical competency: Strong expertise in SQL for data access and transformation. implementing Reporting, BI, Visualization and Analytics tools in Power BI
Strong organizational skills within a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment
A curious and inquisitive mind, with an openness to new experiences and learning

Who are we?

At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.

Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective insight, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.

Since our founding in 1979, we’ve grown to more than 20,000 associates globally who support ~15,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That’s why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.

What makes Gartner a great place to work?

Our sustained success creates limitless opportunities for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. We have a vast, virtually untapped market potential ahead of us, providing you with an exciting trajectory long into the future. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.

We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.

Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.

We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work.

What do we offer?

Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.

In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive — working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.

Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.

The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.

Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company’s career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.

Job Requisition ID:97388

By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.

Gartner Applicant Privacy Link: https://jobs.gartner.com/applicant-privacy-policy

4161527256.title: Data Analyst Senior
4161527256.description:
About the job
As a Data Analyst Senior, you are in charge of building SQL, Qlik and PowerBI data models to support key business decisions. You will collaborate with our product owners, guide your team members and work closely with our clients on their challenges requiring Data Foundations, Data Analytics, and Data Science.
As a Data Analyst Senior, you work closely with data engineers, bi analysts and product owners to create fast, efficient, and scalable data intelligence solutions for Werfen employees.

Key Accountabilities
Among others, you will:
• Between 2 to 3 years of experience in a similar role, managing a team or multiple projects. Preferably in the digital/tech and health/diagnostics/life science space.
•Work with the team and business stakeholders to identify requirements, define models, and kickstart new analytics initiatives.
•Build data models with SQL and automate them with Python. Have deep knowledge of all the datasets inside the data lake to be able to provide guidance to stakeholders.
•Apply the correct data models to the business problem at hand.
•Leverage creative solutions, analytics, and visualization/ reporting techniques to enhance knowledge and drive actionable insights that deliver ROI.


Networking/Key relationships
Critical to be able to build relationships based in trust within the organization as the function is to respond to the internal customer needs while taking into consideration the overall corporate strategy.

Minimum Knowledge & Experience required for the position:
We expect that you have experience with:
• SQL advanced
• Good knowledge of any programming language like Python
• Power BI, Qlik or other dashboarding software
• Statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular libraries and tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.

We will consider it an advantage if you also have familiarity with any of the following:
• AWS
• Microsoft Azure cloud computing
• Familiarity with DataOps principles
• Familiar with Agile methodologies
• Git software versioning

Skills & Capabilities: We expect you to demonstrate proficiency in data analysis and have a keen interest in understanding various business domains. We will also need you to be able to communicate data concepts to non-technical colleagues.
• You are fluent in English both orally and in writing.
• You have good presentation skills.
• You can communicate well within the team and with stakeholders.
• You can analyze business requirements in dialogue with internal stakeholders.
• You can collaborate directly with external consultants and vendors.
• You are a team player willing to share knowledge, ideas, and banter.

Travel requirements: 5% of time

4026013717.title: Data Analyst (Product)
4026013717.description:
About the job
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products — including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more — help our 50+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‌ 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work™. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren’t kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They’re some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions 🤘

We’re looking for a superstar Data Analyst who does not believe there is a data task that can be too hard 🦬 From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills and delivering value.

Up for the challenge? Get in touch 👇

What You’ll Be Doing

Understanding our business and its processes through our data
Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and service teams
Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business
Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying
Maintaining and creating new dashboards to track metrics and visualise insights
Promoting data literacy across the company, organising and holding workshops

What You'll Need

Previous experience in an analytical role, creating impactful solutions
A strong background/education in a quantitative discipline
5+ years of experience with SQL
Great skills with Python or other programming languages
Evidence of strong mathematical and statistics knowledge

Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Important notice for candidates:

Job scams are on the rise. Please keep these guidelines in mind when applying for any open roles.

 Only apply through official Revolut channels. We don’t use any third-party services or platforms for our recruitment.
 Always double-check the emails you receive. Make sure all communications are being done through official Revolut emails, with an @revolut.com domain.

We won't ask for payment or personal financial information during the hiring process. If anyone does ask you for this, it’s a scam. Report it immediately.

By submitting this application, I confirm that all the information given by me in this application for employment and any additional documents attached hereto are true to the best of my knowledge and that I have not wilfully suppressed any material fact. I confirm I have disclosed if applicable any previous employment with Revolut. I accept that if any of the information given by me in this application is in any way false or incorrect, my application may be rejected, any offer of employment may be withdrawn or my employment with Revolut may be terminated summarily or I may be dismissed. By submitting this application, I agree that my personal data will be processed in accordance with Revolut's <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Candidate Privacy Notice

4142529204.title: Demand & Supply Data Solutions Analyst
4142529204.description:
About the job
At ADM, we unlock the power of nature to provide access to nutrition worldwide. With industry-advancing innovations, a complete portfolio of ingredients and solutions to meet any taste, and a commitment to sustainability, we give customers an edge in solving the nutritional challenges of today and tomorrow. We’re a global leader in human and animal nutrition and the world’s premier agricultural origination and processing company. Our breadth, depth, insights, facilities and logistical expertise give us unparalleled capabilities to meet needs for food, beverages, health and wellness, and more. From the seed of the idea to the outcome of the solution, we enrich the quality of life the world over.

The Role

We seek a motivated Software Developer to join our cross-functional supply chain team. This role focuses on building and optimizing software solutions for demand, supply, production, and material planning, including inventory management and supporting local teams with execution. You will work closely with local planners, managers, and data analysts to develop tools that harness the power of AI, predictive analytics, and machine learning to transform our inventory and production processes. This position is available for junior to mid-level developers, providing opportunities for growth and real-world business impact. Reporting to S&OP Process and Network Integration Specialist; this person will be responsible for:

Strategic Responsibilities
• Maintain, Improve and Develop software tools:
o Improve, maintain, and enhance existing Python scripts and create new scripts to support evolving business requirements.
o Collaborate with business stakeholders to design, develop, improve, and implement software tools that optimize demand forecasting, inventory management, and production planning.
o Maintain and develop SQL databases and Azure-based solutions to integrate and support cross-functional data needs.
o Partner with data analysts to identify opportunities for predictive modeling that can enhance supply chain decision making.
o Conduct regular reviews and testing of software tools to ensure they meet business needs and are scalable.
o Contribute to integrating new data sources to improve the accuracy and robustness of supply chain analytics.
o Scrutinize data related to cost, productivity, demand, and transportation to meet objectives.
o Create user guides and technical documentation to facilitate the onboarding and training of team members using the software tools.
o Create and update the documentation regularly to reflect changes and improvements made to software tools, ensuring it remains accurate and useful.

• Statistical Forecasting and Optimization:
o Contribute to continuously improving forecast accuracy to drive business value, including external variables.
o Develop and refine forecasting models to improve accuracy and reliability.
o Develop automated tools and scripts to streamline forecasting processes, including machine learning tools and recommendations.

• Supply, Material and Inventory Optimization:
o Develop automated tools and scripts to streamline inventory tracking.
o Analyze historical data to identify trends and potential areas for efficiency inventory gains through statistical and machine learning recommendations.
o Develop customized visualizations based on stakeholder needs.

Qualifications:
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, or a related field.
• Strong proficiency in Python and SQL (certifications are needed).
• Proven experience with machine learning and predictive analytics.
• Familiarity with Microsoft Azure (certifications are a plus).
• 1-3 years of professional experience in Python software development, ideally within a supply chain, manufacturing, or data driven environment.

Soft skills
• Strong problem-solving skills and a curiosity-driven mindset.
• Excellent communication skills to effectively engage with business stakeholders.
• Ability to work both independently and as part of a cross-functional team.
• Ability to perform in a constantly changing environment.
• Good understanding of business processes and a proactive attitude toward improving them.
• Attention to detail and ability to translate numbers and data into reliable insights.
• Problem-solving and decision-making capabilities.

Hard skills 
• Proficiency and hands-on experience in Python for developing supply chain-related applications.
• Experience with SQL for managing, querying, and optimizing databases.
• Experience Microsoft Azure for cloud-based software solutions as a plus.
• Experience in machine learning and predictive analytics, focusing on applications to demand forecasting, inventory optimization, and supply chain planning, is a plus.
• Ability to translate complex requirements into actionable technical solutions, ensuring a data-driven approach to solving supply chain challenges.
- English fluent.

Our Offer 
• Challenging tasks, short decision-making processes and a high level of personal responsibility in a modern work environment with flexible work time models
• Room for innovative thinking and growth with the possibility to manage your own career path.
• A company culture which promotes continuous learning and diversity.
• Excellent career opportunities in a world leading nutrition company.
• An attractive remuneration including a variety of social benefits like subsidized health & fitness offers.

Learn more about ADM at www.adm.com.

We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and value diversity at our company. If you feel this job is for you, unlock your potential and apply now online.

3740019947.title: Data Analyst
3740019947.description:
About the job
We are looking for a talented Data Analyst to join our team. You will be managing and analyzing data being captured and processed across TravelPerk in order to create useful insights for strategic purposes. This is an instrumental position to bring the business to the next level, you will support our Product Teams using analytics to facilitate conversations and assist in data-informed decision-making.
Are you ready to take off with us? Keep reading!

What you will do:
Work with other Data Analysts and other functions to use quantitative analysis to help shape TravelPerk's product and business strategy.
Explore data from different sources, turning it into information, information into insight and insight into product and business decisions
Analyze data to identify and resolve problems with our products or processes, or to validate hypotheses that could lead to impactful discoveries
Develop and create metrics, dashboards, and reports to track and assess the impact of new developments and initiatives

What you need:
2+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in data analytics
Excellent communication skills, both written and spoken, in English

You will need to prove the following:
You are a Master in data analysis tools (SQL and Excel)
Experience with statistical packages (Python / R)
Experience preparing, consolidating and normalizing data
Experience with different data visualization and BI tools (ie Looker or Tableau)
The desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction, and with highly engaged individuals
 How we work
Our Vision is for a world where TravelPerk is the platform for human connection in real life (IRL). We take an IRL-first approach to work, where our team works together in person 3 days a week. For roles in Customer Care, this can be up to 5 days per week in the office. As such, this role requires you to be within commuting distance of our hubs. We fundamentally believe in meeting in real life to improve connectivity, productivity, and creativity, ultimately making us a great workplace.
We are looking for a talented Data Analyst to join our team. You will be managing and analyzing data being captured and processed across TravelPerk in order to create useful insights for strategic purposes. This is an instrumental position to bring the business to the next level, you will support our Product Teams using analytics to facilitate conversations and assist in data-informed decision-making.
Are you ready to take off with us? Keep reading!
What you will do:
Work with other Data Analysts and other functions to use quantitative analysis to help shape TravelPerk's product and business strategy.
Explore data from different sources, turning it into information, information into insight and insight into product and business decisions
Analyze data to identify and resolve problems with our products or processes, or to validate hypotheses that could lead to impactful discoveries
Develop and create metrics, dashboards, and reports to track and assess the impact of new developments and initiatives
Work with other Data Analysts and other functions to use quantitative analysis to help shape TravelPerk's product and business strategy.
Explore data from different sources, turning it into information, information into insight and insight into product and business decisions
Analyze data to identify and resolve problems with our products or processes, or to validate hypotheses that could lead to impactful discoveries
Develop and create metrics, dashboards, and reports to track and assess the impact of new developments and initiatives
What you need:
2+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in data analytics
Excellent communication skills, both written and spoken, in English
2+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in data analytics
Excellent communication skills, both written and spoken, in English
You will need to prove the following:
You are a Master in data analysis tools (SQL and Excel)
Experience with statistical packages (Python / R)
Experience preparing, consolidating and normalizing data
Experience with different data visualization and BI tools (ie Looker or Tableau)
The desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction, and with highly engaged individuals
You are a Master in data analysis tools (SQL and Excel)
Experience with statistical packages (Python / R)
Experience preparing, consolidating and normalizing data
Experience with different data visualization and BI tools (ie Looker or Tableau)
The desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction, and with highly engaged individuals
How we work
Our Vision is for a world where TravelPerk is the platform for human connection in real life (IRL). We take an IRL-first approach to work, where our team works together in person 3 days a week. For roles in Customer Care, this can be up to 5 days per week in the office. As such, this role requires you to be within commuting distance of our hubs. We fundamentally believe in meeting in real life to improve connectivity, productivity, and creativity, ultimately making us a great workplace.
3 days a week

4159227453.title: Business Intelligence Analyst
4159227453.description:
About the job
Overview

The Celergo Streamline Organization (CSL) is committed to providing World Class Service to clients by hiring, developing and retaining qualified service professionals; by treating each client contact as a service opportunity and by delivering outstanding customer care to clients and associates.

Within the CSL Implementation department we are looking for an experienced Business Intelligence Analyst to lead data analysis and reporting efforts within the department.

What will I be doing?

You will formulate analytical problems, extracting & analyzing data from multiple systems, summarizing critical findings/insights, and developing a compelling visual representation of analyses with actionable recommendations
You will work with multiple stakeholders to identify, design, develop and implement advanced analytics projects 
You will acquire, clean and analyse large data sets and do exploratory analysis to understand our data and if it meets project requirements
You will design reports to help our management team make strategic decisions
You will be a champion for data-based decision making
You will drive the improvement in how we organise and classify our data across the Implementation department and beyond
You will help formulate our data analysis offering and produce new models to forecast future outcomes

What skills will I need?

You will have high ethical standards. You will understand the importance of keeping data safe and secure and ensure ADP and client data is safeguarded at all times
You will be able to extract data from core systems and understand how this data can be structured to make analysis more straightforward
You will be naturally analytical and will be able to see inconsistencies in data
You will be able to see through the numbers to spot trends in data and be able to model them to help plan for possible outcomes
You will be interested in discovering more about data patterns and automated decision making
You will be a born story teller. You will be able to make sense of large volumes of information. You will have a natural ability to find the useful information amongst reams of data and be able to translate this into simple charts or presentations to drive better decision making
You will be an Excel whizz. You will know your pivot tables from your data tables and will have macro programming abilities
You will have a keen attention to detail and the ability to produce highly accurate deliverables
You will be willing to roll up your sleeves and do the mundane work. Data will need to be cleansed; Master Data defined and taxonomies refined. 
You will be a critical thinker who is able to see the bigger picture and challenge assumptions and established processes to improve productivity and efficiency
You will be a first rate communicator. You will be required to challenge teams and management in a polite but forceful manner. You will be expected to present your findings at Executive level
You will be able to manage demanding workloads including working to conflicting and changing deadlines.
You will be comfortable with uncertainty. Elements of your work will be new, and not everything will be defined precisely at the outset

How will I know that I am successful at it?

Data will be cleaner and more accurate as an outcome of the work you are performing
Your project reports will be the talk of the company. They will be clear and concise and will be used to support decision making at the highest levels 
Your forecasts will be so accurate management may start to suspect you are a fortune teller

Qualifications And Experience

3 to 5 years of experience in reporting, business intelligence, data analysis or similar
Experience in project management and/or business improvement environments is a plus
Experience of working with BI tools and data visualization tools is required. Power BI will be a plus. 
Expert Excel skills, include macro and Power Query. Dax, M, and SQL knowledge are a plus.
Proven ability to work within a team and independently.
You care curious, had expose to an international culture and ability to work in a multinational environment.
Efficient in at least English. Additional languages are pluses.
University degree or equivalent in education or experience.

A little about ADP: We are a comprehensive global provider of cloud-based human capital management (HCM) solutions that unite HR, payroll, talent, time, tax and benefits administration and a leader in business outsourcing services, analytics, and compliance expertise. We believe our people make all the difference in cultivating a down-to-earth culture that embraces our core values, welcomes ideas, encourages innovation, and values belonging. We've received recognition for our work by many esteemed organizations, learn more at ADP Awards and Recognition.

Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Equal Employment Opportunity at ADP: ADP is committed to an inclusive, diverse and equitable workplace, and is further committed to providing equal employment opportunities regardless of any protected characteristic including: race, color, genetic information, creed, national origin, religion, sex, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lawful alien status, ancestry, age, marital status, protected veteran status or disability. Hiring decisions are based upon ADP’s operating needs, and applicant merit including, but not limited to, qualifications, experience, ability, availability, cooperation, and job performance.

Ethics at ADP: ADP has a long, proud history of conducting business with the highest ethical standards and full compliance with all applicable laws. We also expect our people to uphold our values with the highest level of integrity and behave in a manner that fosters an honest and respectful workplace. Click https://jobs.adp.com/life-at-adp/ to learn more about ADP’s culture and our full set of values.

4135107121.title: Data Analyst(They/She/He)
4135107121.description:
About the job
If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique? 

🤝 Our culture and strong values. 

💪 Our career development philosophy. 

🤝 Our commitment to being a force for good. 

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

Support the optimization of logistics features, with a focus on delivery areas and supply/demand imbalances, by maintaining and improving settings, quantifying their impact, providing data-driven insights, coordinating feature rollouts, and measuring their effectiveness.

THE JOURNEY 

Work closely with local/regional stakeholders, product teams and development teams, serving as a bridge between product and operations, to define how to best set up and enable products, monitor and give visibility of metrics and KPIs.
Deep-dive on business metrics, in order to explore areas of opportunity and enable data-driven decision-making, based on applied statistics and probability techniques
Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.
Build optimization processes to define the best tuning of every feature on each geography.
Build robust relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology, business and product.
Support recurrent processes within the team, enabling the adjustment of tools to business needs
Continuously explore and refine key operational metrics (delivery time, efficiency, costs), gaining a comprehensive understanding of Glovo’s logistics.

What You Will Bring To The Ride

1-3 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role
Excellent SQL and Excel/GoogleSheet skills
Solid proficiency in statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, ...
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Great spoken and written English.

Individuals representing diverse profiles, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable

💪 Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
🍔 Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
💳 Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
🏊 Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
👪 Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.

Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life? 

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

4176245712.title: Senior Data Analyst
4176245712.description:
About the job
Senior Data Analysts at Thoughtworks collect, process and analyze large datasets to provide valuable insights and support informed decision-making for our clients. They are responsible for the strategy, implementation, productionization and articulation of business impact. They collaborate with cross-functional teams and communicate findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. They stay up-to-date with industry advancements, ensure data quality and security, and actively mentor other Thoughtworkers, fostering a culture of continuous learning and professional development.

Job responsibilities

You will perform data extraction and modeling to generate insights and make recommendations for the business.
You will support the definition and construction of KPIs that best represent the business performance of our clients, assisting in decision-making processes.
You will work on the development and maintenance of strategic dashboards, reports and KPIs.
You will use storytelling practices for effective dashboard construction.
You will build solutions and validate hypotheses through comprehensive data analysis.
You will design, conduct and measure both qualitative and quantitative research.
You will create proposals and conduct A/B tests.
You will conduct ad-hoc studies as needed.
You will connect with stakeholders to understand database structures, apply necessary business rules and share analysis methods and methodologies.


Job Qualifications

Technical Skills

You have expertise with Tableau as a self-service BI tool.
You have experience in analytics and business intelligence projects.
You have proficiency in Excel or Google Sheets.
You have strong data visualization practices with relevant tools.
You have proficiency in database management, either relational or non-relational.
You have advanced knowledge in SQL and Python.
You have ability to clean, prepare and analyze big data, both structured and unstructured.
You have exploratory, qualitative and quantitative analysis skills.
You have experience with research techniques and satisfaction indicators.
You have ability to identify patterns, actionable insights and relationships in data.


Professional Skills

You have great stakeholder management skills and you are able to build rapport and gain buy-in from clients and key stakeholders.
You are a great problem solver, thrive in ambiguity, tackle challenges from various angles and embrace risk management.
You have a data-driven approach, seeking opportunities to leverage data for efficiency and value, and actively collaborate to drive data-based decisions.
You are a great communicator and have the ability to present findings to technical and non-technical audiences.
You are a team player and actively collaborate with colleagues and other teams.
You are eager to coach, mentor and motivate others and you aspire to influence teammates to take positive action and accountability for their work.
English and Spanish communication and relationship building skills – written, verbal, facilitation, etc, are a must.


Other things to know

Learning & Development

There is no one-size-fits-all career path at Thoughtworks: however you want to develop your career is entirely up to you. But we also balance autonomy with the strength of our cultivation culture. This means your career is supported by interactive tools, numerous development programs and teammates who want to help you grow. We see value in helping each other be our best and that extends to empowering our employees in their career journeys.

About Thoughtworks

Thoughtworks is a dynamic and inclusive community of bright and supportive colleagues who are revolutionizing tech. As a leading technology consultancy, we’re pushing boundaries through our purposeful and impactful work. For 30+ years, we’ve delivered extraordinary impact together with our clients by helping them solve complex business problems with technology as the differentiator. Bring your brilliant expertise and commitment for continuous learning to Thoughtworks. Together, let’s be extraordinary.

You will design, conduct and measure both qualitative and quantitative research.
You will create proposals and conduct A/B tests.
You will conduct ad-hoc studies as needed.
You will connect with stakeholders to understand database structures, apply necessary business rules and share analysis methods and methodologies.
