4094700111.title: Data Analyst, Solutions and Innovation
4094700111.description:
About the job
What You'll Do:

As a member of our AXSI team, you'll be at the forefront of measurement and experimentation. Your role will be crucial in helping our clients understand and maximise their return on investment while driving innovation in the rapidly evolving digital advertising landscape.

Incrementality measurement: Enable advertisers to quantify and understand the true value of Criteo's solutions through sophisticated measurement methodologies
Client Consultations: Partner with advertisers to deeply understand their business objectives and define meaningful success metrics for their advertising investments
Experimentation Design: Craft and implement robust testing strategies tailored to each client's unique needs and business context
Analysis & Communication: Transform complex experimental data into clear, actionable insights and recommendations for clients
Measurement Innovation: Contribute to our suite of measurement tools, enabling teams across Criteo to evaluate and optimise their initiatives
Data-Driven Innovation: Leverage cutting-edge tech like Hadoop, Vertica, Tableau, Git, Python, and SQL to transform complex business challenges into groundbreaking solutions
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with commercial teams and clients to deliver insights that drive revenue and foster client success


Who You Are:

A problem-solver with a passion for analytics and a logical approach to challenges
Solid foundation in statistical inference methodologies and experience in designing and analysing A/B tests
Interested in solving data problems using Python & SQL, and enthusiastic about automating and scaling solutions
Business-minded with a goal to turn data insights into actionable strategies
Ability to synthesise complex information and present clear, actionable recommendations
Team player who thrives in a collaborative, inclusive, and vibrant workspace
Fluent in English and skilled at simplifying complex concepts for diverse audiences
Eligible to work in Spain with no restrictions


We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

3945447879.title: Senior Data Analyst
3945447879.description:
About the job
Company Description

At Turner & Townsend we’re passionate about making the difference. That means delivering better outcomes for our clients, helping our people to realize their potential, and doing our part to create a prosperous society.

Every day we help our major global clients deliver ambitious and highly technical projects, in over 110 offices worldwide. As part of our 2025 Vision we are putting Sustainability and Net Zero at the heart of our business.

https://www.turnerandtownsend.com/en/about-us/our-purpose-and-values/

Our team is dynamic, innovative and client-focused, supported by an inclusive and fun company culture. Our clients value our proactive approach, depth of expertise, integrity and the quality we deliver. As a result, our people get to enjoy working on some of the most exciting projects in the world.

Job Description

Seeking people who aspire of moving into data science but already have significant Excel capability and exposure to working in Construction or Engineering, using excel to develop tools that improve the efficiency of an existing process. Typically, with excellent VBA knowledge, Power Query, and exposure to a range of other tools and systems. The successful candidate will provide business analysis expertise for our clients.

Minimum 5 years’ experience in Data Analyst
Considerable experience in working to develop software tools to improve the efficiency of an existing process using the Microsoft stack of products. Primarily in Excel, thus VBA is essential.
Understands project and program delivery in the built environment and ideally in the context of a large utility.
Who can deal with multiple stakeholders and ideally has some consultancy experience

Other Responsibilities, To Include

Preparing presentation and other materials for client pitches, etc.
Inputting key information into the Turner & Townsend internal database tools

Qualifications

This role will require good analytic and strong numeracy skills with the ability to understand and present data in different representations. Preferred skills include:

Bachelors / Masters Degree in an analytic subject, e.g., Math’s, Geography, Engineering, Economics etc. 
A Level Math’s and/or computing
Business Analysis qualifications such as BCS or IIBA
An understanding of different project delivery methodologies (e.g., waterfall, Agile etc.)
Experience with modelling. diagramming applications (e.g. Visio, Lucid Chart, etc.)
Problem-solving skills
Candidates must be able to demonstrate excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Candidates will be expected to engage with clients and be comfortable in eliciting requirements from non-technical stakeholders.

We are looking for people with excellent data focused computing skills and the desire to learn and apply these on major projects and programs. As a minimum we look for those with first class excel capability, Power BI, including DAX and ideally SQL and/or Python. As a consulting business it will be necessary to engage with our clients across Europe to translate user their business requirements into useful business insights.

Additional Information

Our inspired people share our vision and mission. We provide a great place to work, where each person has the opportunity and voice to affect change.

We want our people to succeed both in work and life. To support this we promote a healthy, productive and flexible working environment that respects work-life balance.

Turner & Townsend is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and actively encourage applications from all sectors of the community.

Please find out more about us at www.turnerandtownsend.com/

Join our social media conversations for more information about Turner & Townsend and our exciting future projects:

Twitter

Instagram

LinkedIn

It is strictly against Turner & Townsend policy for candidates to pay any fee in relation to our recruitment process. No recruitment agency working with Turner & Townsend will ask candidates to pay a fee at any time. 

Any unsolicited resumes/CVs submitted through our website or to Turner & Townsend personal e-mail accounts, are considered property of Turner & Townsend and are not subject to payment of agency fees. In order to be an authorised Recruitment Agency/Search Firm for Turner & Townsend, there must be a formal written agreement in place and the agency must be invited, by the Recruitment Team, to submit candidates for review.

4160382933.title: Logistics Data Analyst (They/She/He)
4160382933.description:
About the job
If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique? 

🤝 Our culture and strong values. 

💪 Our career development philosophy. 

🤝 Our commitment to being a force for good. 

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

Support the optimization of logistics features, with a focus on delivery areas and supply/demand imbalances, by maintaining and improving settings, quantifying their impact, providing data-driven insights, coordinating feature rollouts, and measuring their effectiveness.

THE JOURNEY 

Work closely with local/regional stakeholders, product teams and development teams, serving as a bridge between product and operations, to define how to best set up and enable products, monitor and give visibility of metrics and KPIs.
Deep-dive on business metrics, in order to explore areas of opportunity and enable data-driven decision-making, based on applied statistics and probability techniques
Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.
Build optimization processes to define the best tuning of every feature on each geography.
Build robust relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology, business and product.
Support recurrent processes within the team, enabling the adjustment of tools to business needs
Continuously explore and refine key operational metrics (delivery time, efficiency, costs), gaining a comprehensive understanding of Glovo’s logistics.

What You Will Bring To The Ride

1-3 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role
Excellent SQL and Excel/GoogleSheet skills
Solid proficiency in statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, ...
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Great spoken and written English.

Individuals representing diverse profiles, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable

Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

4030584379.title: Product Analyst (f/m/x)
4030584379.description:
About the job
JOIN EXPATRIO

Expatrio, an ambitious Berlin-based fintech and edtech start-up, currently has an opening for a

 Product Analyst (f/m/x)

Our goal is to make the way to and in Germany as easy as possible for international students. If you want to support us in this goal, then you are exactly right with us!

YOUR ROLE

At Expatrio, we aim to become the trusted partner of many expats who come to Germany, helping them find their occupation, providing the banking and insurance products they need and guiding them throughout their stay in Germany.

We are now exponentially evolving our portfolio and are looking for a business-oriented product analyst to help us elevate our solutions. You will be part of a small data team and collaborate with your product and engineering counterparts to drive business value. As a scale-up with less than a decade of life and just over 70 employees, at Expatrio you will have the ability to directly influence the experience of thousands of expats while being exposed to many different challenges. The impact you will generate and your growth will happen at breakneck speed. If you are looking for a challenging and fun opportunity to grow as a product analyst, please read on.

Responsibilities

Perform product discovery on business areas to unveil and size opportunities
Use in-depth analysis to guide the product roadmap
Help designing experiments to validate hypothesis
Own the event tracking plan and the tracking strategy
Pair with product managers and engineers to produce business outcomes
Define and implement the product KPIs (design and dashboarding)
Help to establish a data-driven culture throughout the organisation

YOUR PROFILE

4+ years working as a product analyst
Proven track record of delivering business impact through data insights
Proficiency in SQL and Python
Previous experience working with tools such as Amplitude, MixPanel or Google Analytics
Previous experience performing hypothesis testing and experimentation
Proven track record delivering high quality in-depth analysis on business opportunities
Proficiency with at least one BI tool (Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI, Looker, Quicksight)
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to effectively convey complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

WHY EXPATRIO?

Workation: Do you love working from your home country, enjoying the sun by the sea or simply going skiing in winter after work? YES, we love that too. With us, you have the opportunity of working from abroad.
Flexible work: Working according to an unflexible work plan? We don't think that's timely anymore! With us, you have the opportunity to work flexible.
Personal development: At Expatrio you will also receive a budget to constantly develop yourself and your skills.
Team events: We love having company parties! From Halloween parties to off-site events, department events, and our quarterly meetings, there's always something fun going on. It's never boring, so don't miss out! ;)
Vacation: In addition to your contractual vacation entitlement, we also grant 3 extra days of vacation for your own Birthday, X-Mas Eve and New Year's Eve.
Company culture: What else can we tell you? All in all we are a super international, diverse, and intrinsically motivated team and have an autonomous and progressive work environment with fast decision-making processes. This is not just an empty phrase. This is the way we live it at Expatrio, as it also has a strong impact on our company values.

About Us

Expatrio aims is to be the best solution for international students in Germany. With a digital platform approach (an all-in-one app) at the interface of Fintech, Govtech, and Edtech, we are accompanying tens of thousands of students on their entire journey from study preparation and visa application to arriving and living in Germany. Always focusing on the most convenient experience for our users, we are aggregating all the needed services and products in one single place and offer bespoke solutions for everyone.

Does the position sound interesting to you? Then we would be very happy to receive your application.

Your Expatrio team

Use in-depth analysis to guide the product roadmap
Help designing experiments to validate hypothesis

Define and implement the product KPIs (design and dashboarding)
Help to establish a data-driven culture throughout the organisation

4106740215.title: Senior Product Analyst
4106740215.description:
About the job
Are you a creative person who loves a challenge? Solve the complex puzzles you’ve been dreaming of as our Senior Product Analyst. If you have a passion for innovation in tech, we want you on our team! Thrive in this crucial role.

The Product Analyst is a key contributor to our product strategies. Working with Product Managers and Leadership across the organization, Product Analysts collect internal and external data, analyze it, and build visualizations and plans, which feed into business strategies, go-to-market plans, and executive reports. Product Analysts are key advisors and help us make realistic decisions and justify them with data.


Responsibilities
Be the expert on all data-related questions. Drive timely gathering and analysis of data from the business and produce key business insights through easily digestible visual presentations.
Conduct in-depth research of data sources, making sure that the gathered data matches the requested problems and business requirements.
Design, develop and maintain scaled, automated, user-friendly systems/reports/dashboards/workbooks that will support our business needs.
Understand the technical capabilities of our platform, components ownership across Applications Development, and advise on instrumentation strategies and tooling.
Be a "know your data, know your business" champion across Applications Product Development Teams. Educate and collaborate with the Teams so that they take ownership of their own data and insights.
Collaborate with Product Directors and Managers, as well as collaborators from the business, to define and implement success metrics across the product portfolio.
Collaborate with other data science-oriented and data-driven teams within the organization.


Typical work
Data streams, imports and exports
KPIs, visualizations and reports
Financial and usage models and forecasts


What you will bring
5+ years of product analysis and development experience. Degree in Mathematics and Statistical Sciences is a plus.
You are passionate about understanding complex systems, getting deep into data structures and making them talk.
An ability and interest in working, and continuous re-learning, in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment.
Ability to build trust by producing high-quality and accurate insights.
High level of autonomy, demonstrating the ability to work in a global, multi-functional team environment, collaborating with groups of subject matter experts (SMEs) and stakeholders at all levels.
Data science and machine learning experience is a plus.


Key skills
Excellent knowledge of statistics and tools for analyzing big data (SQL, Python, etc.)
Advanced skills in data visualizations and story telling.
Excellent analytical, problem discovery, and problem solving skills.
Working knowledge of data mining and big data warehouse.
Great (English) communication and presentation skills.
Great time management, ability to plan and complete with sometimes changing priorities.

If this sounds like you, we hope to meet you!


About the NetSuite Product Team
NetSuite is one of Oracle's top products and kept on operating as its own global business unit (GBU), after its acquisition by Oracle. The world's first cloud-based, multi-tenant ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) and CRM (Customer Relationship Management) service, our focus is on small, emerging and mid-size companies. NetSuite provides a unified experience across a suite of business software: financials, supply chain, order management, omnichannel e-commerce, and all extendable on one platform.

The Product Development Application Team is a multinational team, having members from more than 12 countries, spanning diverse roles: Developers, SW Engineers in Test, Technical Writers, UX Designers, Researchers, Product Analysts and Product Managers. Our mission is to deliver intuitive, unified solutions, to help our customer grow their business. We take a customer-first approach, and organize applications product development across four value streams: acquire & grow new customers, build and deliver products & services, optimize cash & profits, and hire & empower employees. 
Data is at the heart of everything we decide and build. 


We offer more than just a job
Agile environment – Start-up culture backed by a strong enterprise
English-speaking environment and international team
Strong professionals around you that will help accelerate your growth
High-impact learning culture: free access to online learning platform and regular in-house training sessions
Competitive salary and great benefits
Open and diverse environment, with opportunities to give back to the community
Flexible working hours


Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, and disability.
We believe that innovation starts with diversity and inclusion and to create the future we need talent from various backgrounds, perspectives, and abilities.
That’s why we’re committed to creating a workforce where all individuals can do their best work. It’s when everyone’s voice is heard and valued that we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before.
Are you a creative person who loves a challenge? Solve the complex puzzles you’ve been dreaming of as our Senior Product Analyst. If you have a passion for innovation in tech, we want you on our team! Thrive in this crucial role.

Product Analysts are key advisors and help us make realistic decisions and justify them with data.

4158197938.title: Senior Business Data Analyst
4158197938.description:
About the job
Do you have business analysis background and wide knowledge and experience in Business Data Analytics roles? Are you an open-minded professional with good English skills? If it sounds like you, this could be the perfect opportunity to join EPAM as a Senior Business Data Analyst.

Our teams work in highly agile working environments for Fortune 1000 clients, following XP practices and best CI/CD practices. We are looking for a Business Data Analyst with open-minded personality, who can join our friendly environment and become a core contributor to our team of experts.

Our client is a global investment firm that multiplies the potential of companies and people to build successful businesses with growth ambitions. Their sector expertise, thematic approach, value-based investment philosophy and commitment to partnership help them drive long-term value and transform businesses into market leaders.

Responsibilities


Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and analyze data from various sources
Develop and maintain requirements for further development of reports and dashboards
Conduct quantitative and qualitative analysis to identify opportunities for business optimization and growth
Ensure data integrity and compliance with relevant industry regulations and standards
Support scrum team in development activities. Focus on clear product requirements
Build and maintain relations with stakeholders from different company divisions


Requirements


Strong communication skills and BA Stakeholders management 
Previous BA experience, focused on BA artifacts documentation, Data Analysis and Dimensional modelling
Strong understanding of the requirements lifecycle and quality criteria 
Familiarity with Agile methodologies, especially Scrum 
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills 
Good interpersonal, communication, and organizational skills 
Effective performance both independently and in a team setting


We offer


Private health insurance
EPAM Employees Stock Purchase Plan
100% paid sick leave
Referral Program
Professional certification
Language courses


EPAM is a leading digital transformation services and product engineering company with over 52,650 EPAMers in more than 55 countries and regions. Since 1993, our multidisciplinary teams have been helping make the future real for our clients and communities around the world. In 2018, we opened an office in Spain that quickly grew to over 1,450 EPAMers distributed between the offices in Málaga and Madrid as well as remotely across the country. Here you will collaborate with multinational teams, contribute to numerous innovative projects, and have an opportunity to learn and grow continuously.

Why Join EPAM
WORK AND LIFE BALANCE. Enjoy more of your personal time with flexible work options, 24 working days of annual leave and paid time off for numerous public holidays.
CONTINUOUS LEARNING CULTURE. Craft your personal Career Development Plan to align with your learning objectives. Take advantage of internal training, mentorship, sponsored certifications and LinkedIn courses.
CLEAR AND DIFFERENT CAREER PATHS. Grow in engineering or managerial direction to become a People Manager, in-depth technical specialist, Solution Architect, or Project/Delivery Manager.
STRONG PROFESSIONAL COMMUNITY. Join a global EPAM community of highly skilled experts and connect with them to solve challenges, exchange ideas, share expertise and make friends.

4139756566.title: EMEA Claims Operations Data Analyst
4139756566.description:
About the job
Job Description

The EMEA Claims Operations team at Chubb is on the lookout for a passionate and skilled Operations Analyst to join our mission of delivering deep data insights that drive impactful decisions for our regional leadership and claims management teams. As part of our EMEA Claims Operations team, you’ll play a vital role in shaping the future of claims management through data-driven insights. You will collaborate with diverse teams, from Claims Leaders to IT and actuarial experts, to ensure our operations thrive in a complex and evolving landscape.

Key Responsibilities

Drive Data Excellence: Take ownership of data analytics and advanced data generation, ensuring accuracy and timeliness while communicating effectively with stakeholders to support business objectives.
Build Meaningful Relationships: Establish strong connections with IT and other key internal departments to validate and discuss data sources, fostering collaboration that fuels our growth.
Monitor and Innovate: Keep a close eye on the performance of MI/BI initiatives and engage in critical projects that require your expertise in data interpretation and generation.
Embrace Continuous Improvement: Actively participate in professional development through Chubb’s Claims Craftsmanship modules, honing your skills in data manipulation and digital innovations.
Be a Knowledge Champion: Drive self-studies and contribute to the collective knowledge of the team, ensuring a sustainable knowledge base and encouraging continual learning.
Exemplify Our Values: Uphold Chubb’s ethical standards and service excellence while demonstrating flexibility and a lean mindset in your daily operations.

What We’re Looking For

Interpersonal Skills: Strong communication abilities to quickly grasp strategic business requirements and prioritize effectively. Your capacity to escalate needs when necessary will be key.
Technical Proficiency: Familiarity with data/reporting solutions using enterprise systems (e.g., IBM Netezza, Microsoft SQL Server, IBM DB2) and experience with reporting tools like QlikSense, QlikView, Cognos BI, or SSRS.
Analytical Expertise: Solid understanding of SQL querying and scripting, alongside knowledge of data lake/data warehouse concepts.

Qualifications

Multilingual Advantage: Fluent in English, with proficiency in German, French, or Spanish preferred. Your ability to communicate across cultures will enhance our regional engagement.
Educational Background: A degree in Business Administration, Mathematical/Statistics Science, or equivalent qualifications from a global corporation or consulting environment.
Seasoned Professional: A minimum of 5 years of relevant experience in the insurance industry or a similar field, with a robust track record of execution and accountability in complex environments.
Entrepreneurial Spirit: A proactive mindset, capable of navigating tight deadlines and pressure to deliver data-driven insights and lead discussions with senior stakeholders.

WE OFFER IN RETURN!

Competitive salary & pension scheme, 25 days annual leave plus ability to purchase 5 additional days, Private Medical cover, Employee Share Purchase Plan, Life Assurance, Subsidised gym membership, Comprehensive Learning & development offerings.

Employee resource groups: Gender Equality Network, Abilities & Wellbeing, Social Mobility, Parents & Carers, Pride Network, Cultural Awareness Network.

Integrity. client focus. respect. excellence. teamwork

Our core values dictate how we live and work. We’re an ethical and honest company that’s wholly committed to its clients. A business that’s engaged in mutual trust and respect for its employees and partners. A place where colleagues perform at the highest levels. And a working environment that’s collaborative and supportive.

Diversity & Inclusion. At Chubb, we consider our people our chief competitive advantage and as such we treat colleagues, candidates, clients, and business partners with equality, fairness and respect, regardless of their age, disability, race, religion or belief, gender, sexual orientation, marital status or family circumstances.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

About Us

Chubb is a world leader in insurance. With operations in 54 countries, Chubb provides commercial and personal property and casualty insurance, personal accident and supplemental health insurance, reinsurance and life insurance to a diverse group of clients. The company is distinguished by its extensive product and service offerings, broad distribution capabilities, exceptional financial strength, underwriting excellence, superior claims handling expertise and local operations globally.
Job Description
Key Responsibilities
Drive Data Excellence: Take ownership of data analytics and advanced data generation, ensuring accuracy and timeliness while communicating effectively with stakeholders to support business objectives.
Build Meaningful Relationships: Establish strong connections with IT and other key internal departments to validate and discuss data sources, fostering collaboration that fuels our growth.
Monitor and Innovate: Keep a close eye on the performance of MI/BI initiatives and engage in critical projects that require your expertise in data interpretation and generation.
Embrace Continuous Improvement: Actively participate in professional development through Chubb’s Claims Craftsmanship modules, honing your skills in data manipulation and digital innovations.
Be a Knowledge Champion: Drive self-studies and contribute to the collective knowledge of the team, ensuring a sustainable knowledge base and encouraging continual learning.
Exemplify Our Values: Uphold Chubb’s ethical standards and service excellence while demonstrating flexibility and a lean mindset in your daily operations.

4170816530.title: Marketing Data Analyst
4170816530.description:
About the job
🦸‍♂️🦸‍♀️ Do you want to develop your talent in a TOP Startup and collaborate with a multidisciplinary team where you will see the impact of your work from the very beginning?

💻 Would you like to work 100% remotely, and organize your schedule according to your needs in an excellent technical in a Growth Tribe?

Our purpose

From Lookiero we are driving the change of online personalised shopping, making it more accessible to everyone. Our mission is to empower thousands of customers, inspire them and help them discover their full potential to succeed in their daily lives.

Thanks to technology, Data and Artificial Intelligence, we have an extraordinary opportunity to deliver a unique shopping experience tailored to each individual.

Since our launch in 2016, we have grown rapidly to become Europe's leading online personal shopping platform with a presence in 12 European countries and more than 600 employees and collaborators of 27 nationalities.

What will be your challenge?

You will be responsible for defining and providing data sources of truth for the Growth tribe decision making. This responsibility involves internal data sources, third-party data sources (e.g., Facebook CAPI, Google Ads, etc.) and digital analytics events (Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, Big Query, etc.).
You will be responsible for defining and providing business intelligence tools (dashboards, automatic reports, alerts, notifications) to the stakeholders to monitor the KPI and proxy metrics and to facilitate the data-driven decision making.
You will be responsible for the deep analysis of data to answer business questions and to seek for opportunities.
You will be a partner of Product Managers, Tech Leads, and Business stakeholders of the Growth squads to prioritize and work in an agile way and to define the digital analytics strategy (channel mix measurement and performance, attribution model, user tracking...)
You will ship fast and often, measuring the impact using a robust experimentation framework.
Story-telling. As a data owner, you will connect business problems with data-driven solutions.
You promote data-driven decisions and proactively participate in enhancing sources of truth and pipelines.


What will make you succeed? (Skills, know-how and experience)

 To feel comfortable in the project, you should ideally have at least +4 years of experience on data processing and visualization technologies, i.e., SQL, Python, Spark, Tableau, Power BI, Data Studio, or similar technologies. 
 Demonstrable 2+ years of experience working in Digital Marketing and the Google Analytics technological ecosystem (Google Tag Manager, Google Analytics 4, Big Query) 


In addition, we would especially like to see…👀

You have analytical skills. Working with large amounts of data and being able to see through them and analyze it to find conclusions
You have a clear vision of the steps of a data-driven project and you can share it with others.
You can simplify a complex concept and explain it using clear visual references to help.
You want to work in a multidisciplinary team and profiles: internal and external team members, clients, providers.
You have excellent communication skills; being able to visualize your analysis-results clearly and unambiguously.
We are an international company, the ability to read and speak in English is needed.


What will we bring to you?

⌛ 100% remote and flexible working hours. If working from Bilbao is too far away for you, that's OK! We support remote working and flexible hours so that you can have the balance you want with your personal life.

📚 English classes and training budget: We believe in training as a tool to evolve as a professional, to get the best out of you and to be always up to date!

💰Flexible remuneration. Benefit platform through which you will obtain interesting tax advantages and interesting discounts.

🛍️ Lookiero Discounts. And of course, you will enjoy discounts on your purchases at Lookiero, valid for friends and family.

🤩 Professional growth. Personal development plan to evolve within Lookiero.

💼 Your impact will be tangible - and we empower people in the “how”. Your challenge will be to find solutions to problems and you will even have the freedom to propose new projects and initiatives with a direct impact on your day to-day in Lookiero.

💻 You are a #ProductLover and share, like us, your passion for working on our product.

👫 We are one team. With a culture of true collaboration and support, you will find that everyone is always up to help you solve your challenges and have a friendly chat. Good vibes reign!

What will the selection process be like?

1- Initial interview with the Talent Team.

2- Technical assessment/ case study.

3- Technical interview with the Hiring Manager

4- The Last stage will be a final interview with a stakeholder

5- Last but not least, the final stage is the Offer.

How do we like to do things?

We think big and act fast.

We own our decisions and drive results.

We say things the way they are.

We are a team.

Anything is possible for us.

If you want to be a key player in our team, see the impact of your work and are excited to learn more about us and the position, APPLY.

Disclaimer:The data controller of your personal data is Lookiero Style, S.L. with tax identification number B-95810826. Your personal data will be collected and processed according to all applicable regulations and specifically to GDPR 2016/679. Your personal data will be collected for the purpose of evaluating your application for the selection process and will be kept for the terms established by law. We remind you that you can exercise your rights of access, rectification, deletion, limitation of processing and portability by writing to dpo@lookiero.com. We also inform you that your data will not be subject to automated individual decisions or transfers to countries outside the EEA. For more information you can consult our privacy policy.

4122676751.title: Product Data Analyst
4122676751.description:
About the job
Product Data Analyst (Hybrid) 

As you contemplate your future, you might be asking yourself, what’s the next step? Start your journey with us!

We’re seeking an experienced Product Data Analyst to join our eDreams ODIGEO Experiments & Insights team, which is the centre of excellence for Online (AB) Experimentation and for providing best practices to generate insights and learning from and for the experiments. Our goal is to help different teams across the organization to succeed in their mission by providing insights generation and data analysis support in a healthy data-informed environment.

Why eDreams ODIGEO

Join the world’s leading travel subscription platform and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe.

20 million customers – 44 markets – 5 brands – 6.5M members in Prime

16.2 million bookings FY23 – More than 50,000 bookings per day – 100 million daily user searches

1400 employees – More than 50 different nationalities – 99% permanent contracts – 36.3 average age

We’re a leading travel tech company, revolutionising the travel booking experience through our consumer insight, innovative technology, market leadership, and Prime, the world’s first travel subscription program.

We are looking for a Product Data Analyst who has experience working with analytics tools such as SQL (mostly for BigQuery usage) and, as a plus, also R/Python, visualization tools as LookerStudio; that has a strong statistics knowledge and experience in statistics applied to AB testing or experimentation.

In this role, you would be performing as a product data analyst to support a set of product teams, but you will also be part of the next experimentation generation at eDreams ODIGEO. The team is constantly investigating best in class methodologies and processes to implement in our business/analysis and tests, which means you will be required to apply your mathematical knowledge in some strategic projects that are focused on taking more accurate decisions maintaining a strong statistical confidence level.

What you will do:

The Role’s Key Responsibilities and Tasks

As an eDOer, you will have clear objectives, great challenges and a clear overview of how your work contributes to the global company project and its customers. As a Product Data Analyst in the Experiments & Insights team, you will be in charge of:

 Analyse performance and identify behaviours in our different websites and interfaces related to our products; 
 Analyse performance and user behaviours in the A/B Tests experiments or Pre-Post run by the product teams; 
 Help the product teams to generate their testing hypotheses by providing exploratory analysis about our products, past tests, etc, 
 Data cleaning and validation, 
 Definition of new tracking that will all mostly be added in Google Analytics (to be able to answer different kinds of research/product questions); 
 Build and maintain dashboards (mostly using LookerStudio) and/or reports (mostly in Google Sheets) to share performance information with senior management and C-level stakeholders; 
 Lead data-driven initiatives to improve company decision making and business knowledge; 
 Responsible for one or more team’s projects such as the investigation and implementation of new methodologies, new data analysis techniques or the usage of new tools; 
 Collaborate with user researchers and designers to detect gaps in knowledge about our user; identify research opportunities to fill those gaps. 


What you need to succeed:

Job Requirements

Bring your unique perspective, speak up, and offer disruptive solutions. You’ll have the opportunity to learn and grow while making a real impact on our team.

 Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative discipline is a requirement (Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, etc.), 
 Minimum of 4 years experience in a role with strong analytical component, 
 Previous experience in user behavior analysis (product performance) using data from any of the followings: Google Analytics/Adobe Analytics/Mix Panel/ Amplitude/Matomo/… 
 Strong knowledge of the math and statistical concepts behind A/B testing, 
 Strong knowledge of SQL is a requirement, as well as experience in working with databases and large sets of data, 
 Advanced Office skills. Strong experience with analytical tools, ideally with the Google toolset (spreadsheets, google docs, etc), 
 Knowledge of visualisation tools like LookerStudio, Tableau, Looker or Qlikview, 
 Business Proficiency in English, 
 A self-starter and team player, who also enjoys to have fun! 


Plus:

 R or Python programming skills (mostly for data extraction and data manipulation), 
 Google Analytics knowledge (as well as Google Analytics API, googleAnalyticsR library for R, GA4, etc.), 
 Previous experience in programming, 
 Knowledge on data structure and data sets management in Google Cloud Platform. 


What’s in it for you?

The best talent deserves the best benefits

At eDO, we want you to be a part of our success story and great culture. Here’s what we offer:

 A rewarding Compensation package! 💥 Prime Plus membership, Competitive salary and benefits package, including flexible benefits, performance-based bonuses, birthday day off, discounts and partnerships, relocation support and the possibility of choosing your equipment and, even better, keeping it for free after 3 years. 
 Grow opportunities to empower your career, and unleash your potential! 🚀 Personalised career paths and the eVOLVE Program will help you discover, grow, and thrive. Internal mobility opportunities let you pursue horizontal career changes and promotions. 
 Your Well-being is our Priority. Embrace Freedom and Flexibility! 💙 At eDO, we value flexibility, employee care, and transparency. We offer a hybrid home-office model focused on outcome, not time-in-seat. You’ll be able to find the right work-personal life balance that suits you best. 
 Work hard, party hard! We believe in having fun and connecting with colleagues! 🎉 Join eDO for after-work events, padel tournaments, parties, and more. Create communities based on your passions, like sports and music. Come to work as you are, with no dress code, and enjoy free fruit, coffee, and tea at our offices. 
 Enjoy a dynamic and healthy environment! 💫 Be innovative, take risks, and share your ideas. Our diverse and open-minded teams support high performance, learning, and growth. You’ll work in an Agile Mindset environment with recognition at our core. 


Wanna take a peek into what it’s like to work at eDO? Follow us on LinkedIn and discover more about life at eDO!

If you are ready for a career opportunity with unmatched benefits, continuous learning, and a supportive work-life balance, look no further! Take your career to new destinations by applying now and help our diverse, inclusive, and passionate team shape the future of travel.

Apply now!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status. Our people are the key to our success. Each one of them is unique in their own way and the respect for their uniqueness is and will always be a passion and motivation.
Product Data Analyst (Hybrid)
Product Data Analyst

4142620101.title: Senior Product Analyst (d/f/m)
4142620101.description:
About the job
Personio's intelligent HR platform helps small and medium-sized organizations unlock the power of people by making complicated, time-consuming tasks simple and efficient. Our growing team of 1,800+ Personios across Europe and the US are building user-friendly products that delight our 14,000+ customers and their 1.5 million employees. Ready to make an impact from day one?

The Role: How you'll make an impact at Personio

This position can be hybrid from one of the following office locations: London, Madrid, Munich, Dublin, or Berlin.

Bring your skills. Drive our decisions. Data is on a mission to facilitate better decisions within the company. We build core data products and enable internal teams to create and share their own. Join our team and help us build the foundation of data at Personio.

As an early member of our PTech Analytics team, you’ll be the driving force behind the data revolution within one of our critical product domains. Working as a trusted advisor to leaders from Product, Design & Engineering, you’ll be responsible for leveraging data & insights to directly influence our product strategy & roadmap. You’ll work embedded in our cross-functional product teams helping them to define, measure & maximize their impact with data, ultimately enabling them to build products our customers love.

Role Responsibilities: What you'll do

Influence Decision-Making: Use a deep understanding of our product, users, and business to craft compelling data stories that guide product leaders in critical decisions.
Generate Insights: Analyze large, complex datasets to generate insights that shape product strategy and size opportunities to guide prioritization.
Define Success: Guide teams in defining success metrics and setting measurable goals (OKRs) that align with broader product and business objectives.
Monitoring & Reporting: Create engaging dashboards and reports to track product success and monitor performance.
Impact measurement: Work with teams to define hypotheses, develop testing plans and measure impact with statistical rigor.
Data Modeling: Collaborate with engineers to build scalable data models that enable self-service analytics and democratize data access.
Drive Data Literacy: Evangelize the use of data and empower teams to self-serve insights by increasing data literacy through enablement and close partnership.

Role Requirements: What you need to succeed

5+ years experience in a data analytics role, with significant experience directly supporting product teams in B2B or B2C product led companies.
Excellent SQL skills, experience using DBT for data modeling is a plus.
Expert in creating compelling dashboards & visualizations in Looker, Tableau or similar BI tools.
Expert in the fundamentals of product analytics including building metric trees, experimentation, user activity & retention analytics, funnels & customer segmentation.
Experience working with event based tracking data for web or mobile and hands-on experience with a behavioral analytics tool e.g. Amplitude, Heap, MixPanel etc.
Foundational understanding of statistical modeling with proficiency in Python/R (e.g. basic regression/ML models, common statistical tests)
Ability to communicate findings in a succinct and clear manner to a wide variety of stakeholders so that they can draw conclusions quickly and make rapid decisions.

Why Personio

Personio is an equal opportunities employer, committed to building an integrative culture where everyone feels welcomed and supported. We embrace uniqueness and understand that our diverse, values-driven culture makes us stronger. We are proud to have an inclusive workplace environment that will foster your development no matter your gender, civil status, family status, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, education level, or race.

Aside from our people, culture, and mission, check out some of the other benefits that make Personio a great place to work:

Receive a competitive reward package – reevaluated each year – that includes salary, benefits, and pre-IPO equity
Enjoy 28 days of paid vacation, plus an additional day after 2 and 4 years
Make an impact on the environment and society with 1 Impact Day per year
Receive generous family leave, child support, mental health support, and sabbatical opportunities
We follow an office-led, remote-friendly approach, including opportunities to work from home and international locations. Many of our teams have designated days for gathering in the office to enhance collaboration and foster a sense of community.
We enjoy gathering for meals, cultural initiatives, and events like local Summer Sessions and year-end celebrations. There's also healthy snacks, drinks, and a weekly catered lunch.
The Role: How you'll make an impact at Personio
This position can be hybrid from one of the following office locations: London, Madrid, Munich, Dublin, or Berlin.
Role Responsibilities: What you'll do
Influence Decision-Making: Use a deep understanding of our product, users, and business to craft compelling data stories that guide product leaders in critical decisions.
Generate Insights: Analyze large, complex datasets to generate insights that shape product strategy and size opportunities to guide prioritization.
Define Success: Guide teams in defining success metrics and setting measurable goals (OKRs) that align with broader product and business objectives.
Monitoring & Reporting: Create engaging dashboards and reports to track product success and monitor performance.
Impact measurement: Work with teams to define hypotheses, develop testing plans and measure impact with statistical rigor.
Data Modeling: Collaborate with engineers to build scalable data models that enable self-service analytics and democratize data access.
Drive Data Literacy: Evangelize the use of data and empower teams to self-serve insights by increasing data literacy through enablement and close partnership.

4124756442.title: Data Analyst
4124756442.description:
About the job
We are BOB, a hybrid L2 to build and launch Bitcoin applications. Our mission is accelerating the world's transition to a fair and transparent financial system through Bitcoin as a credibly neutral, global settlement asset. We believe in a world with access to finance for everyone, everywhere, in a secure and usable manner.

As a Data Analyst for BOB, you will be leading the quantitative insights to grow and direct decisions at BOB. You are the main person responsible for analysing various on- and off-chain data sources to create and track KPIs and identify trends with a deep product understanding. You will work closely with the product, business, and marketing teams to formulate hypothesis and deliver actionable recommendations focussing on DeFi on BOB.

What You Will Do

Product Metrics and Reporting: Track, analyse, and report on key performance metrics, including channel performance, user activation and retention, TVL, trading volume, and other KPIs
Market Research: Conduct in-depth market analysis to identify emerging trends within the Bitcoin and DeFi ecosystem
Identify DeFi Opportunities: Regularly prepare and update reports about investment opportunities on BOB for our institutional partners
Data Infrastructure: Together with the engineering team, design and build foundational data systems, including ETLs, dashboards, and analytics that drive data-driven decision-making and support scalable business growth


Requirements

Proven ability to lead complex analytical projects from concept to completion, especially in web3 environments
Advanced proficiency in SQL and Python through your experience as business or data analyst or other quant-related position
Deep understanding of DeFi, including protocols, block explorers, and data sources
Eagerness to improve products through fast experimentation, A/B testing, and a data-driven approach
Enjoy working in a results-driven and fast-paced startup environment


Benefits

Research-oriented team
Solve novel problems
Stock options
Remote working
30-day vacation
Allowance for a co-working space
Yearly retreat

4139628722.title: Data Analyst I (They/She/He)
4139628722.description:
About the job
If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique? 

🤝 Our culture and strong values. 

💪 Our career development philosophy. 

🤝 Our commitment to being a force for good. 

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

As an Operations Analyst you will work on the Regional forecasting function (supply & demand balance). This role will require a mix of operations, stakeholder management, analytical skills, and creativity to tackle different challenges. We offer a challenging and dynamic environment with many opportunities for learning and development.

THE JOURNEY

Execute forecasts at a city level inAFRICA (Morocco, Tunisia, Kenya, Uganda, Ivory Coast, Nigeria) , being the owner of the process.
Coordinate with the different countries and cities in order to understand key insights about local markets.
Align with each Local Operations owner the strategy in the country, and enable it by managing the demand and supply balance (rider availability)
Perform country and city analysis to come up with insights to help to improve the forecast's accuracy.
You will combine advanced analytical data insights with business understanding and market knowledge.
Work very close with local teams, to ensure the best in class operations in the region.
Implement and standardize analytical processes, and playbooks to ensure quality in Operations.

What You Will Bring To The Ride

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Engineering, Mathematics/Statistics or in similar roles
2+ years experience in a supply/demand planning position. Experience in Operations is a plus
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. Data-driven decision-making is a must.
Ability to engage internal and external stakeholders through excellent communication skills
Proficiency in Excel
Knowledge of SQL
Ability to manage the big picture, and the smallest details. You're always on top of your deadlines and an organization freak.
Proactive, organized, and obsessed with details
Fluent English Level

Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves

🌟 An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
💪 Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
🍔 Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
💳 Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
🏊 Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
👪 Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.

Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life? 

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

4133059569.title: Data Analyst, EMEA Performance Media
4133059569.description:
About the job
What You'll Do:

As a Data Analyst in our Analytics Performance Media team, you will drive advertising strategies thanks to your oversight of business objectives and technical expertise of our products.

Client insights: you will analyse complex data from multiple sources to understand the performance of our advertisers’ campaigns and generate innovative and impactful insights 
Business strategy: you will partner with account executives, account strategists, and campaign managers to help drive client strategy and direction 
Reporting tools and metrics: you will develop and scale reports and metrics that will present actionable insights to teams across the business and strategic leadership.
Testing: you will design, monitor and analyse A/B tests to understand better how our products work for clients. 
Collaborative projects: you will work on ad hoc projects with different teams to automate analyses globally, improve our internal processes and our way of working and scale knowledge across the company 


Your work environment:

Flexible remote working options - balance your life the way you want.
A tech-forward, primarily digital workspace.
Need special work hours? Let's talk about it!


Who You Are:

At least 2 years of experience in data analysis 
A problem-solver with a passion for analytics and a logical approach to challenges.
Able to solve data problems using Python, SQL, and enthusiastic about automating and scaling solutions.
Business-minded with a goal to turn data insights into actionable strategies.
Team player who thrives in a collaborative, inclusive, and vibrant workspace.
You are skilled at simplifying complex concepts for diverse audiences. 
Experience in online advertising, marketing, or consulting will be a plus.
Fluent in English
Must be eligible to work in Spain full-time with no restrictions.


We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.
What You'll Do:
Client insights: you will analyse complex data from multiple sources to understand the performance of our advertisers’ campaigns and generate innovative and impactful insights 
Business strategy: you will partner with account executives, account strategists, and campaign managers to help drive client strategy and direction 
Reporting tools and metrics: you will develop and scale reports and metrics that will present actionable insights to teams across the business and strategic leadership.
Testing: you will design, monitor and analyse A/B tests to understand better how our products work for clients. 
Collaborative projects: you will work on ad hoc projects with different teams to automate analyses globally, improve our internal processes and our way of working and scale knowledge across the company

4158197933.title: Senior Data Analyst
4158197933.description:
About the job
Do you have business analysis background and wide knowledge and experience in Data Analytics roles? Are you an open-minded professional with good English skills? If it sounds like you, this could be the perfect opportunity to join EPAM as a Senior Data Analyst.

Our teams work in highly agile working environments for Fortune 1000 clients, following XP practices and best CI/CD practices. We are looking for a Data Analyst with open-minded personality, who can join our friendly environment and become a core contributor to our team of experts.

Our client is a global investment firm that multiplies the potential of companies and people to build successful businesses with growth ambitions. Their sector expertise, thematic approach, value-based investment philosophy and commitment to partnership help them drive long-term value and transform businesses into market leaders.

Responsibilities


Collect and refine business and technical requirements 
Write documentation 
Handle changes requests, plan scope
Manage expectations 
Investigate incidents (data and dashboard related) 
Consult client on data solutions (propose best dashboard layout and logic) 
Perform source-to-target mapping between several systems and from the source system to the final KPI on the dashboard
Support on the build-up of our Data Catalog within our client, enhancing completeness and accuracy of our Data Dictionary, Business Glossary, Data Lineage, Data Classification and Governance


Requirements


Capability to read technical documentation of systems (API, Database models, etc.)
Strong communication skills and management of BA stakeholders
Previous experience in building Data Dictionaries, Business Glossaries, and Data Governance models
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills 
Self-motivation to drive issues to completion
Good interpersonal, communication, and organizational skills 
Effective performance both independently and in a team setting


Nice to have


Technical skills in SQL and Python
Experience working with Atlan or any other equivalent Data Catalog tools


We offer


Private health insurance
EPAM Employees Stock Purchase Plan
100% paid sick leave
Referral Program
Professional certification
Language courses


EPAM is a leading digital transformation services and product engineering company with over 52,650 EPAMers in more than 55 countries and regions. Since 1993, our multidisciplinary teams have been helping make the future real for our clients and communities around the world. In 2018, we opened an office in Spain that quickly grew to over 1,450 EPAMers distributed between the offices in Málaga and Madrid as well as remotely across the country. Here you will collaborate with multinational teams, contribute to numerous innovative projects, and have an opportunity to learn and grow continuously.

Why Join EPAM
WORK AND LIFE BALANCE. Enjoy more of your personal time with flexible work options, 24 working days of annual leave and paid time off for numerous public holidays.
CONTINUOUS LEARNING CULTURE. Craft your personal Career Development Plan to align with your learning objectives. Take advantage of internal training, mentorship, sponsored certifications and LinkedIn courses.
CLEAR AND DIFFERENT CAREER PATHS. Grow in engineering or managerial direction to become a People Manager, in-depth technical specialist, Solution Architect, or Project/Delivery Manager.
STRONG PROFESSIONAL COMMUNITY. Join a global EPAM community of highly skilled experts and connect with them to solve challenges, exchange ideas, share expertise and make friends.

4133434427.title: BI Data Analyst - Hybrid
4133434427.description:
About the job
BI Data Analyst - (Hybrid) 

As you contemplate your future, you might be asking yourself, what's the next step? Start your journey with us!

We're seeking an experienced BI Data Analyst to join our team in Barcelona. Our Business Intelligence team is the centre of excellence for providing insights and learning from the Data. Our goal is to help different teams across the organization to succeed in their mission by providing insights generation and data analysis support in a healthy data-informed environment. If you're ready to soar, we're ready to take you there.

Why eDreams ODIGEO

Join the world's leading travel subscription platform and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe.

21 million customers – 44 markets – 5 brands – 6.5M members in Prime

More than 100 million searches per day - Up to 1.8 billion daily AI predictions

Over 1,600 employees – More than 60 different nationalities from all continents

99% permanent contracts - 36 average age

We're the world’s leading travel subscription platform and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe. We are a tech company revolutionizing the travel booking experience through our consumer insight, innovative technology, market leadership, and Prime, the world's first travel subscription program.

What you will do:

The Role's Key Responsibilities and Tasks

As an eDOer, you will have clear objectives, great challenges and a clear overview of how your work contributes to the global company project and its customers. As a Data Analyst in the BI team, you will be in charge of:

 Analyse performance and identify behaviours in different data sets; Translate complex and potentially ambiguous information into a clear structure and actionable deliverables. 
 Perform analysis on large data sets using appropriate data analysis techniques and tools with a strong focus on quality; 
 Build and maintain dashboards and/or reports to share performance information with senior management and C-level stakeholders; 
 Identify and analyze relevant customer data to drive business goals and validate hypothesis & designs; turn data into actionable insights; 
 Lead data-driven initiatives to improve company decision making and business knowledge 
 Working with multi-disciplinary teams – Qualitative Researchers, Designers, Product Owners, Developers, and Pricing Managers – to blend different statistical and data analytics techniques to generate a holistic understanding of the users and markets. 


What you need to succeed: 

Job Requirements

Bring your unique perspective, speak up, and offer disruptive solutions. You'll have the opportunity to learn and grow while making a real impact on our team. Here's what you need to succeed:

 Degree in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Physics, Engineering or other quantitative fields); 
 Minimum 3 years of experience as an analyst in a digital and eCommerce environment. 
 Strong knowledge of tools and programming languages such as BigQuery/SQL, Python, R; 
 Experience with cloud platforms and scalable solutions will be a plus. 
 Self-starter with good time management skills; able to manage multiple tasks and prioritize quickly the most relevant ones; 
 Ability to multitask; desire to work in a challenging, fast-paced, high-performance environment; 
 Written and oral communication skills (in English). 


What’s in it for you?

The best talent deserves the best benefits

At eDO, we want you to be a part of our success story and great culture. Here's what we offer:

 A rewarding Compensation package! 💥 Prime Plus membership, competitive salary and benefits package, including flexible benefits, performance-based bonuses, birthday day off, discounts and partnerships, relocation support and the possibility of choosing your equipment and, even better, keeping it for free after 3 years. 
 Continuous learning to fuel your growth and explore new horizons! 📚 Learn and grow with free Coursera access, soft skills workshops, tech training, leadership development, and more. Plus, enjoy a great onboarding program. 
 Grow opportunities to empower your career, and unleash your potential! 🚀 Personalised career paths and the eVOLVE Program will help you discover, grow, and thrive. Internal mobility opportunities let you pursue horizontal career changes and promotions. 
 Your Well-being is our priority. Embrace Freedom and Flexibility! 💙 At eDO, we value flexibility, employee care, and transparency. We offer a hybrid home-office model focused on outcome, not time-in-seat. You'll be able to find the right work-personal life balance that suits you best. 
 Work hard, party hard! We believe in having fun and connecting with colleagues! 🎉 Join eDO for after-work events, padel tournaments, parties, and more. Create communities based on your passions, like sports and music. Come to work as you are, with no dress code, and enjoy free fruit, coffee, and tea at our offices. 
 Enjoy a dynamic and healthy environment! 💫 Be innovative, take risks, and share your ideas. Our diverse and open-minded teams support high performance, learning, and growth. You'll work in an Agile mindset environment with recognition at our core.

3942683490.title: System Analyst, Marketplace Recruitment & Dev
3942683490.description:
About the job
Description

We are looking for mid-senior System Analysts with a strong technical background. Do you have passion for using data in order to drive business actions? Are you experienced on reporting and advanced SQL techniques, analytical problem-solving and data visualization?

This is an amazing opportunity if you are you keen to improve current reporting solutions and innovate by creating new and simpler ones providing to the Marketplace business with robust automated insights.

In this role, you will help identify, track and manage Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), partner with the internal and external program teams to identify root-causes of spikes or plummets in key metrics while carrying on mid-term to long-term projects to improve our services, processes and tools and communicating with tech, program and product teams.

Career Growth

We care about your career aspirations and tailor your development to your unique abilities. We want you to grow and progress in Amazon. We will facilitate your growth through an increase in scope of the projects you work on over time, and include in projects for partner teams to experience new and interesting challenges.

Key job responsibilities

 Simplify and automate reporting while building data solutions to have maximum scale, self-service ability by stakeholders and improve productivity
 Solve complex and broad business problems with analytically derived solutions, applying analytical best practices.
 Translate business requirements into reporting while working with internal and external stakeholders to define best output based on business needs
 Effectively collaborate in a fast-paced environment with multiple teams in a large organization.

About The Team

Over 2 million Sellers in 10 countries list their products for sale on the Amazon Marketplace. Sellers are a critical part of Amazon’s ecosystem to deliver on our vision of offering the Earth’s largest selection and lowest prices. These Sellers offer hundreds of millions of unique products providing a broad and diverse inventory of products from Books, Electronics and Apparel to Consumables and beyond. In our vision to build a global marketplace, we will enable Sellers to list, make their selection available to customers globally while optimizing their inventory placement across multiple countries. EU 3P Compliance organization enables Sellers to sell on Amazon’s EU Marketplaces in compliant manner, adhering to EU legislative requirements across Tax, Trade, EPR (Extended Producer Responsibility) and Product Compliance.

Basic Qualifications

 Bachelor's degree or equivalent
 Proficient with SQL
 Experience defining requirements and using data and metrics to build reports and metrics for business insights
 Experience working with stakeholders to document data and operational processes
 Familiarity with database types and data models
 Experience with data visualization using Quicksight, or similar tools and Excel (pivot tables, array functions, power pivots, etc.)

Preferred Qualifications

 Master's degree or equivalent
 Experience as business analyst, data analyst or similar role experience
 Proficiency with Python
 Proficiency with Amazon Technologies: AWS S3, RS, Lambda

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.


Company - Amazon Spain Services, S.L.U.
