4146119105.title: Product Analyst (Data team)
4146119105.description:
About the job
About us:

Planner 5D is a global hub for home design, uniting over 100+ million users in 230 territories around our planet (yes, we have 2 users connecting from Antarctica each month!). Our platform simplifies the home renovation process from concept to execution, and this process has never been more straightforward with our cutting-edge software. You don't need to be a professional designer to enhance your home or workspace. We are dedicated to streamlining the design experience, making the customization of dream homes accessible to everyone.

Our cross-platform presence spans Web, iOS, Android, Windows, and MacOS, ensuring seamless synchronization for our users. Planner 5D is more than just software; it's a vibrant community of enthusiastic and product-oriented professionals. From diverse backgrounds, our team collaborates across time zones, fueled by a shared passion to revolutionize the home design market.

We are constantly looking for like-minded talent eager to take ownership and drive innovation within our expanding suite of tools. Join us in shaping the future of home design.

The Senior Product Analyst will play a critical role in driving data-informed decision-making and product optimization.

Key responsibilities include:

Tracking Events Design and Specification: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and specify tracking events that capture user behavior and product interactions
Tracking Events Delivery and Quality Management: Ensure accurate and timely delivery of tracking events and maintain high data quality standards
Definitions of Features and Connected Tracking Events: Clearly define product features and their associated tracking events to enable comprehensive analysis
Product and Feature Usage Metrics and KPIs: Develop and monitor key metrics and KPIs to measure product and feature performance
Framework for Feature Usage Analysis and Insights: Create a framework for analyzing feature usage and generating actionable insights
Overall Product Growth Metrics and Analysis: Track and analyze overall product growth metrics to identify trends and opportunities
A/B Test Framework for Continuous Improvements: Implement and manage an A/B testing framework to facilitate data-driven experimentation and optimization
Hypothesis and Experiments Documentation, Delivery, and Analysis: Document hypotheses, design and execute experiments, and analyze results to validate assumptions and inform product decisions
Conduct Quantitative and Qualitative Product Research: Utilize both quantitative and qualitative research methods to gain a deep understanding of user needs and behaviors
Use AI Tools and Approaches for Product Analysis: Leverage AI tools and techniques to enhance product analysis and uncover valuable insights


Qualifications:

Strong Analytical Skills: Proven ability to collect, analyze, and interpret complex data sets
Product Development Knowledge: Familiarity with product development processes and methodologies
Technical Proficiency: Experience with data analysis tools such as BigQuery, Looker Data Studio, and product analytics platforms like Amplitude, Devtodev, Mixpanel, or other modern tools and frameworks
AI and Machine Learning Experience: Knowledge of AI and machine learning techniques and their application in product analysis
Communication and Collaboration: Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively across teams
Problem-Solving and Critical Thinking: Strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills, with a data-driven approach to decision-making
Education: Bachelor's or Master's degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering) or equivalent experience


Key Skills:

Data Analysis
Product Analytics
SQL
BigQuery
Looker Data Studio
A/B Testing
Experimentation
AI and Machine Learning
Communication
Collaboration
Problem-Solving


Additional Skills:

Knowledge of data visualization tools
Statistical modeling expertise


What we offer:

 Great work environment that balances freedom and responsibility
 Our team is made up of friendly and passionate enthusiasts who are eager to help and share their knowledge
 We believe in work-life balance, so you'll receive around 30+ days of paid holidays per year
 Company computer equipment by request
 Education courses for our team members, and we're willing to allocate funds toward your training expenses
 English classes on our corporate platform
 Offline company events in Lithuania and online team-building
 Unlimited free Planner5D subscriptions

4172643972.title: Data Scientist - Product Analyst I Logistics (They/She/He)
4172643972.description:
About the job
If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique? 

🤝 Our culture and strong values. 

💪 Our career development philosophy. 

🤝 Our commitment to being a force for good. 

We have a vision: Building the largest marketplace in your city, to give access to anything in minutes. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

Support the development of logistics features, quantifying the impact that they might bring to the company, supporting the design process with data to make decisions, coordinating the rollout of features, and measuring their impact.

THE JOURNEY 

Work closely with product and operations teams to define the product roadmap and strategy, monitor and give visibility of product metrics and KPIs.
Apply various advanced mathematical and statistical modeling techniques and analyses (A/B test, multivariate test, clustering, supervised learning, etc) to solve for product and business problems that drive the highest impact.
Translate product questions and hypotheses into analysis and actionable insights.
Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.
Owning everything analytics end to end in the product development cycle, from ideation and opportunity sizing, to experimentation and post-launch impact analyses.
Build optimization processes to define the best tuning of every feature on each geography.
Build robust relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology, business and product.

What You Will Bring To The Ride

1-3 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role, preferably in product facing teams
Knowledge or experience in digital product development
Experience with an application of statistical modeling and advanced analytics to provide product-shaping insights
Excellent SQL skills and experience applying those on-the-job; you know how to join multiple tables, you know how and when to use CTEs, and you use aggregate functions to come up with relevant statistics
Solid proficiency in programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.
Knowledgeable and preferably experienced in designing and analyzing experiments in digital products (A/B test, multivariate, etc)
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, Qlikview.
Excellent spoken and written English.

Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves

🌟 An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
💪 Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
🍔 Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
💳 Discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
🏊 Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
👪 Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.

Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life? 

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!
exciting ride
new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

4166981741.title: Snr Process Analyst, EU Central Operations
4166981741.description:
About the job
Description

Central Operations refers to a new approach in Amazon Logistics to define a scalable solution to run the increasingly complex and growing last mile delivery network. Central Operations is a key strategic initiative with a vision to transform the way AMZL executes route planning, scheduling and last mile delivery. We are looking for a strong Business Analyst to join the team and drive improvement in in-station processes and technology used within the operational team.

This person will have a strong ability to gather data from multiple data sources (real-time and batch data), build new metrics from these sources and generate actionable insights coming from consumable and interactive dashboards that will allow operations to make quick decisions and avoid in-station volume risks.

The analyst will have the opportunity to start a project from scratch, helping to set up the foundations of an entirely new operational process with metrics, tools and built in AMZL platforms.

The role will provide opportunities to think big, develop original ideas, and partner with AMZL Planning, Transportation, Last Mile Tech, Operations and business expansion teams to develop a strategic approach to scale Central Operations.

Key job responsibilities

 Managing and partnering with Operational teams as an analytical partner, that will define and guide the analytical strategy for operations
 Enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format
 Partnering with other analysts and BI engineers in planning and analytics to build analytical solutions to deliver on business goals
 Propose and implement business metrics for senior management reviews and work with business intelligence and data engineers to design and develop data infrastructure to support business growth
 Perform deep-dives to find the root causes behind variances of key parameters over a given time-period
 Harness data to create business requirements documents and guide actionable technology requests

Basic Qualifications

 Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Finance, Computer Information Systems, Engineering, Operations Research, Mathematics or other business/analytical disciplines or equivalent
 Demonstrable relevant professional experience as a Business Analyst, Data Analyst, or related - Proficiency in SQL, Microsoft Excel, and statistical analysis tools
 Demonstrated experience leading technical projects with strong analytical components.
 Excellent written and oral communication skills in English, including the ability to communicate across business areas

Preferred Qualifications

 Master’s degree in Business Administration, Finance, Computer Information Systems, Engineering, Operations Research, Mathematics or other business/analytical disciplines or equivalent
 SQL experience.
 Direct experience using business intelligence reporting tools (Quicksight, Tableau, etc.) - Working knowledge of Redshift and/or data base management in AWS
 Previous experience in creating detailed Business Requirement Documentation

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.


Company - Amazon Road Transport Spain, S.L.U.

4168623616.title: Senior Product Analyst - (All genders)
4168623616.description:
About the job
Company Description

More than 20 years ago, zooplus was one of the first to bring the pet category into the world of eCommerce. Today, we stand strong as Europe’s leading online pet platform, delivering moments of happiness to more than 9 million pet parents each year.

We're on a mission to create joy for pets and their parents, driven by our core values of Care, Courage, Openness, and Simplicity. At the heart of everything we do, they inspire us to grow, raise the bar for our customers and fuel a pet-first business.

Job Description

As a Senior Product Analyst at zooplus, you will join our Product Analytics team, serving as the advanced analytics service-provider for our product teams, within the CPO division. You'll take ownership of the entire analytics pipeline for your assigned stakeholders, from provisioning analytical data (e.g., via analytical data marts) to crafting reports, designing dashboards, conducting exploratory data analysis, creating visualizations, generating insights, and offering actionable recommendations.

Your role involves close collaboration with designated product areas, understanding their unique business goals and challenges. You'll ensure that the insights you uncover are fully aligned with our product strategy and objectives. When necessary, you'll coordinate with relevant colleagues to ensure data generation and collection meet analytical requirements, ensuring you have all the necessary data to perform your analyses effectively. You'll play a pivotal role in fostering a data-driven culture within zooplus.

By sharing your insights with your assigned product area and business teams, you'll empower them to make informed decisions. Additionally, you'll provide training to team members, enabling them to independently access and utilize reporting data, further strengthening our data-driven approach.

Key Responsibilities:

Own the end-to-end analytics pipeline, focusing on transactional and behavioral data analysis utilizing applied statistics.
Conduct deep dives into product-specific datasets, providing rigorous and actionable insights.
Conduct product discovery analysis aligned with product objectives to identify opportunities, generate hypotheses, and guide experimentation.
Apply statistical techniques (A/B testing, regression analysis, forecasting) to analyze product performance and inform decision-making.
Develop advanced dashboards and SQL-based reports to track key performance indicators.
Present findings and recommendations for action to key stakeholders, adapting communication for different audiences.
Integrate insights from multiple data sources into a cohesive analytical framework.
Act as a data specialist within the product domain, guiding best practices in transactional data and statistical modeling.
Mentor junior team members and contribute to developing the analytics function.
Stay updated on analytical advancements and recommend new methodologies or tools.

Qualifications

Strong analytical and statistical background with a critical thinking mindset.
5+ years of experience in a data-driven product environment, preferably in e-commerce.
Proven ability to apply statistical techniques (A/B testing, regression, forecasting) to business challenges.
Expert-level in SQL (including query optimization, handling large datasets, and data mart creation) and transactional data analysis for evaluating business performance and customer behavior.
Proficiency in Tableau, Power BI, or similar visualization tools.
Experience with Adobe Analytics or similar digital analytics tools is a plus.
Experience working in/with digital customer facing product teams and event data is a plus.
Good knowledge of Python or R for statistical modeling and automation.
Ability to simplify complex data insights and tailor messaging for different audiences.
Experience leading analytics projects that impacted the whole company and working cross-functionally with product and business teams.
Strong communication skills and confidence in presenting findings to senior stakeholders.
First steps in project & team leadership
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field is preferred.

Additional Information

With more than 1,000 passionate professionals located across 6 European offices, we believe our success comes from working together and leveraging our international strengths. Expect a hybrid work setup: 60% in-office, 40% remote, collaborating with colleagues across locations.

Our benefits:

🐾 20% discount in our zooplus shop

📖 Internal and external training

🎈 Team events

✈️ 28 Annual Vacation Days

🩺 Private Medical Health Insurance

⏰ Hybrid working model (up to 40%Home Office per month)

Want to know more? Learn more about zooplus here, and check out our LinkedIn, Instagram, TikTok and YouTube to get a glimpse into the zooplus culture.

zooplus is committed to equal opportunity. We value and embrace diversity and inclusion of all Team Members.

4151315992.title: Online Data Analyst
4151315992.description:
About the job
Online Data Analyst - Spanish (ES)


Job Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:
In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community
Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.

Qualification Path:
No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.

Basic Requirements
Full Professional Proficiency in Spanish and English
Being a resident in Spain for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Spain
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

Assessment:
In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

Equal Opportunity
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

4139647970.title: PRICING DATA ANALYST
4139647970.description:
About the job
En Mango inspiramos y unimos mediante nuestra pasión por el estilo y la cultura. Estamos en más de 115 países y nuestra presencia online se extiende a más de 110 países. Nuestro equipo está formado por personas de 112 nacionalidades y en un 78% por mujeres.

Buscamos un/a

PRICING DATA ANALYST

¿CÓMO SERIA TU DÍA A DÍA EN MANGO?

¿QUÉ HACE UN PRICING DATA ANALYST EN MANGO?

En tu día a día llevarás a cabo análisis sobre el desempeño comercial de la compañía, con especial foco en la actividad promocional (mark down).

En tu día a día…

Analizarás el desempeño comercial de la compañía y reportarás regularmente a varios departamentos los principales KPIs al respecto.
Harás análisis ad-hoc de las campañas promocionales más relevantes.
Analizarás posibles estrategias de actividad promocional y harás recomendaciones sobre su idoneidad.
Monitorizarás la actividad de m-down de los competidores.
Apoyarás desde la vertiente analítica la implementación de proyectos transformacionales en el área de Pricing.
Estarás en contacto con las áreas comerciales de la compañía.
Trabajarás con Excel y herramientas de BI avanzadas. 

¿QUÉ ESPERAMOS DE TI?

Se requiere formación en Economía, ADE, Ingeniería o similar.
Buscamos perfiles analíticos, personas entusiastas, participativas y con ilusión por aprender y aportar nuevas ideas.
Excelentes habilidades de comunicación oral y escrita, incluyendo la capacidad de explicar de manera sencilla.
Imprescindible nivel alto de inglés y dominio de Excel muy avanzado.
Valorable experiencia / formación en gestión y explotación de herramientas de BI
Valorable experiencia profesional relevante

¿QUÉ NOS HACE ESPECIALES?

Horario Flexible (entrada de 8h a 9h30 y salida de 17h a 18h30), jornada intensiva los viernes (de 8h a 9h hasta las 14h / 15h) y mayoría de vigilias de festivos
Posibilidad de Teletrabajo
Descuento en todas nuestras líneas (Woman, Man, Kids, Teen & Home) además de un Market de muestrario para renovar tu armario dos veces al año
Servicio de comedor y cocina en las instalaciones de central. La empresa subvenciona parte del menú diario, así como los artículos de cafetería
Retribución flexible con ventajas fiscales: seguro médico, formación, descuento comedor, guarderías etc.
Transporte gratuito de empresa desde Barcelona y el Vallés
Oportunidades constantes de desarrollo con retos muy variados que generan aprendizaje en el puesto de trabajo y cursos específicos en función de tus necesidades
Workshops, meetups, comunidades de prácticas, team buildings y company meetings sobre transformación digital, moda y actividades de nuestros equipos
Servicio médico propio, servicio de fisioterapia una vez a la semana, sala de fitness y vestuarios en nuestras oficinas centrales
Formarás parte de una empresa líder en el sector de la moda, dinámica, en plena innovación, con gran concienciación y realizando acciones hacia la sostenibilidad con un ambiente de trabajo cercano, inspirador y ambicioso

You got it?

We like you!

Analizarás el desempeño comercial de la compañía y reportarás regularmente a varios departamentos los principales KPIs al respecto.

4125751464.title: Data Analyst Power BI
4125751464.description:
About the job
En Logicalis Spain estamos buscando un perfil de Analista de Datos con buenos conocimientos en Power BI para incorporarte a nuestro área de Data & Analytics. En Logicalis trabajamos con clientes nacionales e internacionales, llevando a cabo importantes proyectos de inteligencia artificial y analítica avanzada, estrategia del dato, gobierno, integración y arquitectura, abarcando todo el ciclo de vida del dato.

FUNCIONES
Diseñar, desarrollar y mantener informes y dashboards interactivos en Power BI que proporcionen insights clave para diferentes áreas de la empresa.
Optimizar modelos de datos en Power BI para mejorar el rendimiento y la eficiencia de los informes, asegurando tiempos de respuesta rápidos y uso eficiente de recursos.
Crear y mantener medidas y cálculos complejos utilizando DAX para proporcionar análisis avanzados y personalizados.
Utilizar Power Query para transformar y preparar datos provenientes de múltiples fuentes, asegurando que los datos sean precisos y estén listos para el análisis.
Crear visualizaciones de datos efectivas y persuasivas que comuniquen insights de manera clara y concisa.
Asegurar que los informes y dashboards estén actualizados y reflejen los datos más recientes, implementando actualizaciones y mejoras continuas.

REQUISITOS
Mínimo 2 años de experiencia trabajando con Power BI en un entorno profesional.
Experiencia avanzada en Power BI, incluyendo la creación de informes y dashboards.
Experiencia en la integración de Power BI con otras plataformas y sistemas empresariales.
Dominio de DAX para crear cálculos y medidas.
Experiencia con Power Query para la transformación y preparación de datos.
Conocimientos en lenguajes de programación como SQL, Python, o R.
Valorable certificaciones en Power BI o análisis de datos.

BENEFICIOS
> Incorporación inmediata a compañía líder del sector IT con un alto grado de expertise en el área de Data & Analytics dónde nos encontramos en pleno proceso de expansión.
> Estabilidad laboral a través de contrato indefinido con amplias oportunidades de desarrollo profesional y crecimiento en la compañía.
> Modalidad de trabajo 100% remoto desde cualquier punto de España.
> Paquete retributivo muy competitivo acorde a la valía del candidato.
> Posibilidad de acogerse a planes de retribución flexible (tarjeta restaurante, tarjeta transporte y tarjeta guardería).
> Seguro médico y GYMPASS.
> Planes de formación adaptados a cada perfil (cursos técnicos, certificaciones oficiales, formación de idiomas...).
> Portal de descuentos especiales para empleados.
> Buen ambiente de trabajo y entorno muy colaborativo.

Alter Solutions es una compañía de consultoría de tecnologías de la información y un catalizador de la transformación digital. Somos un equipo, una comunidad, un grupo de personas con un objetivo común: crecer y hacer crecer a la compañía.

4105558500.title: Senior Data Analyst - Partner Ads (They/She/He)
4105558500.description:
About the job
If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique? 

🤝 Our culture and strong values. 

💪 Our career development philosophy. 

🤝 Our commitment to being a force for good. 

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

You will be a key resource to provide revenue and performance insights to Glovo’s commercial teams dedicated to the sales of advertising and monetisation products. You will use and generate information resources regarding our sales pipelines, and team performance developing data products, analytics and models to drive prioritization, pricing, budgeting and campaigns optimisations.

In this role you will be part of the Monetisation Team at Glovo HQ, being able to Improve Glovo’s food partners P&L and developing a scalable revenue stream from Ads, Promotion and other services to support our Partner’s Growth . Working in the Global team you will play a pivotal role for the teams in all our geographies to deliver the Ads & Monetisation business plan contributing directly to the company P&L.

You’ll be part of a fast growing area and have the opportunity to work on new solutions and bring existing ones to the next level.

THE JOURNEY

Build Kpis, logics and data products to define the Next Best Action per account managed in order to encourage higher sale values, volumes, conversion rates, margin rates, and Advertiser’s satisfaction. 
Build Kpis. logics and data products to measure and optimize sales team performances, and assess the effectiveness of implemented strategies. 
Work closely with multi-disciplinary to lead projects end to end and contribute to strategy definition for revenue development and optimisation. 
Establishing timelines, defining deliverables, and managing stakeholders flow end-to-end for project development. 
Maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools ensuring all related systems are configured correctly, validated and working to full capacity.
Distribute weekly, monthly and quarterly dynamic reporting of expected sales results, variances and budget comparisons.
Conduct trainings to ensure all impacted colleagues are fully competent in the use of all tools, processes and insights 
Drive clarity and solve ambiguous, challenging business problems using data-driven approaches
Provide guidance and support to business leaders and stakeholders on how best to harness available data in support of critical business needs and goal

What You Will Bring To The Ride

2-4 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role, preferably in commercial facing teams
Mastery in SQL and statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with analytics/ds libraries such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown
In-depth knowledge of BI tools such as Looker, Tableau, and practical experience analyzing data, program metrics, and performance
Ability to summarize and represent data (e.g., descriptive statistics and graphs).
Ability to create robust, insightful, and story-telling visualizations using modern BI & Analytics tools and ability to identify data Issues.
Familiarity with a collaborative environment and/or version control (GitHub, Git).
Ability to build hypotheses and test them (sometimes by piloting projects entirely)
Project management / coordination skills. Determined to get things done
Understanding of A/B test principles, to design, conduct and analyze different experiments.
You are eager to learn, hungry for knowledge, and want to work towards growing in your career from day one.
You are independent in solving problems within your capabilities and proactive in asking for support when the task is beyond your expertise.
You are not afraid of giving/receiving constant & honest feedback

NICE TO HAVE 

Experience within the digital advertising industry and data monetisation

Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves

🌟 An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
💪 Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
🍔 Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
💳 Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
🏊 Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
👪 Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.

Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life? 

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

4135234742.title: Senior Data Analyst
4135234742.description:
About the job
Senior Data Analyst – Monetization & Subscription Analytics

At Ideawise, we build communities that empower people to live authentic and fulfilled lives. Our mission is to create impactful user experiences, and we’re seeking a Senior Data Analyst to join our Monetization Squad.
In this role, you’ll use cutting-edge tools like SQL, Snowflake, and Tableau to analyze subscription-based revenue streams, in-app purchases (IAPs), and ads. If you’re passionate about data storytelling, app monetization, and driving decisions through insights, this is the role for you.

What You’ll Do
Analyze subscription-based revenue models and recommend strategies to maximize LTV, ARPU, ARPPU, and ROAS.
Design and implement A/B testing and multivariate experiments to validate feature impacts.
Build dashboards and tools to support data-driven decisions across Product, Tech, and Business teams.
Estimate potential impacts of product features and sunset non-performing ones.
Collaborate with data engineers to ensure accurate data tracking and pipelines.
Identify high-performing revenue channels and prioritize resource allocation accordingly.
Present actionable insights to stakeholders through compelling data storytelling.

What We’re Looking For
Must-Have Skills and Experience
5+ years of experience in data analysis, ideally in subscription-based businesses.
Expertise in SQL and Python for advanced data analysis.
Experience with cloud-native data warehouses (e.g., Snowflake, BigQuery, or Redshift).
Strong communication skills in English (written and spoken).
Proficiency with BI tools like Tableau, Superset, Power BI, or Looker.
Experience in designing and implementing A/B tests and statistical analyses.
Nice-to-Have Skills
Knowledge of app-based business models (e.g., App Store, Google Play).
Experience in paid user acquisition metrics (e.g., ROAS, LTV, payback periods).
Familiarity with tools like Mixpanel, Amplitude, or Eppo.
Background in the dating or gaming industries with IAPs/ads experience.

Why Join Us?
Impactful Work: Shape the future of our app monetization strategy.
Global Team: Collaborate with talented professionals from around the world.
Remote Flexibility: Work from anywhere with flexible hours.
Growth Opportunities: Access to training, mentorship, and career advancement.

How to Apply
Are you ready to take your data analysis skills to the next level? Apply now!
Submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your experience with app-based subscription models and data storytelling.

Please send your cover letter directly to wouter@ideawisegroup.com

4145141558.title: Snr Process Analyst, EU Central Operations
4145141558.description:
About the job
Description

Central Operations refers to a new approach in Amazon Logistics to define a scalable solution to run the increasingly complex and growing last mile delivery network. Central Operations is a key strategic initiative with a vision to transform the way AMZL executes route planning, scheduling and last mile delivery. We are looking for a strong Business Analyst to join the team and drive improvement in in-station processes and technology used within the operational team.

This person will have a strong ability to gather data from multiple data sources (real-time and batch data), build new metrics from these sources and generate actionable insights coming from consumable and interactive dashboards that will allow operations to make quick decisions and avoid in-station volume risks.

The analyst will have the opportunity to start a project from scratch, helping to set up the foundations of an entirely new operational process with metrics, tools and built in AMZL platforms.

The role will provide opportunities to think big, develop original ideas, and partner with AMZL Planning, Transportation, Last Mile Tech, Operations and business expansion teams to develop a strategic approach to scale Central Operations.

Key job responsibilities

 Managing and partnering with Operational teams as an analytical partner, that will define and guide the analytical strategy for operations
 Enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format
 Partnering with other analysts and BI engineers in planning and analytics to build analytical solutions to deliver on business goals
 Propose and implement business metrics for senior management reviews and work with business intelligence and data engineers to design and develop data infrastructure to support business growth
 Perform deep-dives to find the root causes behind variances of key parameters over a given time-period
 Harness data to create business requirements documents and guide actionable technology requests

Basic Qualifications

 Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Finance, Computer Information Systems, Engineering, Operations Research, Mathematics or other business/analytical disciplines or equivalent
 Demonstrable relevant professional experience as a Business Analyst, Data Analyst, or related - Proficiency in SQL and/or Python, Microsoft Excel, and statistical analysis tools
 Excellent written and oral communication skills in English, including the ability to communicate across business areas

Preferred Qualifications

 Master’s degree in Business Administration, Finance, Computer Information Systems, Engineering, Operations Research, Mathematics or other business/analytical disciplines or equivalent
 Direct experience using business intelligence reporting tools (Quicksight, Tableau, etc.) - Working knowledge of Redshift and/or data base management in AWS
 Previous experience in creating detailed Business Requirement Documentation

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

4151320998.title: Online Data Analyst
4151320998.description:
About the job
Online Data Analyst - Spanish (ES)


Job Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:
In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community
Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.

Qualification Path:
No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.

Basic Requirements
Full Professional Proficiency in Spanish and English
Being a resident in Spain for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Spain
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

Assessment:
In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

Equal Opportunity
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

4075809820.title: Data Scientist, Spain - BCG X
4075809820.description:
About the job
Locations: Madrid | Madrid

Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

We Are BCG X

We’re a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world’s most complex problems. Leveraging BCG’s global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.

What You'll Do

Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.

Our Data Scientists and Senior Data Scientist are part of our rapidly growing team to apply data science methods and analytics to real-world business situations across industries to drive significant business impact. You'll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions.

Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X. Successful candidates are intellectually curious builders who are biased toward action, creative, and communicative.

We Are Looking For Dedicated Individuals With a Passion For Data Science, Statistics, Operations Research And Redefining Organizations Into AI Led Innovative Companies. Successful Candidates Possess The Following

 Comfortable in a client-facing role with the ambition to lead teams
 Likes to distill complex results or processes into simple, clear visualizations
 Explain sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner
 Love building things and are comfortable working with modern development tools and writing code collaboratively (bonus points if you have a software development or DevOps experience)
 Significant experience applying advanced analytics to a variety of business situations and a proven ability to synthesize complex data
 Deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques and their mathematical underpinnings, and can translate this into business implications for our clients
 Have strong project management skills
 Fluency in English and Spanish is required

#BCGXjob

What You'll Bring

Requirements

Master’s or PhD degree program in Computer Research Science, Data Science, Statistics, Operations Research, or related field

Technologies

Programming Languages: Python

#BCGXjob

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.

4034765489.title: Quantitative Analyst Junior
4034765489.description:
About the job
En QUANT AI LAB, seguimos creciendo para desarrollar las más avanzadas soluciones de inteligencia artificial y analíticas del mercado, siempre desde la vanguardia y unos conocimientos técnicos asentados. Unirse a QUANT AI LAB significa unirse a una aventura donde cada miembro es una parte importante de este proyecto, y cada parte resulta esencial para hacerlo realidad.

Como parte de nuestra continua apuesta por el progreso, estamos buscando reforzar nuestra división incorporando varios perfiles de consultor en finanzas cuantitativas.

Las funciones:

Desarrollo de proyectos de consultoría para clientes, dentro del ámbito de gestión de riesgos.
Desarrollo de modelos numéricos.
Validación de sistemas y desarrollos de cliente.
Análisis de la normativa vigente y actualización a la misma.
Apoyo en el diseño de requisitos funcionales para las herramientas de gestión de riesgo.
Labores de transformación y análisis de datos.
Apoyo en la implantación de herramientas en cliente.
Elaboración de documentación.
Realización de demos a potenciales clientes.
Interacción con el cliente para resolución de dudas, soporte funcional en las herramientas de gestión de riesgo, asesoramiento normativo, toma de requisitos, etc.

Las competencias y conocimientos del candidato son:

Recién graduado (ingeniería, matemáticas, física, finanzas cuantitativas) 
Muy valorable máster en finanzas cuantitativas
Valorable experiencia con VBA 
Demostrar curiosidad e interés en el ámbito de finanzas cuantitativas.
Ser dinámico y capacidad de trabajar en equipo.
Idiomas: inglés (equivalente C1). Valorable idioma francés.
Deseable tener conocimientos de gestión de activos y pasivos (ALM)
Deseable tener conocimientos de programación (R, Python, …) y SQL.

QUANT AI LAB, lo que le ofrecemos:

Contribuir al desarrollo de una empresa internacional en continuo crecimiento y desarrollando proyectos y productos de vanguardia.
Integrar un equipo multidisciplinar con formación profesional y académica de alto nivel, compuesto por algunos de los mayores expertos en el área de la inteligencia artificial, analítica avanzada y tratamiento del dato.
La oportunidad de trabajar directamente con clientes de talla internacional, y algunas de las mayores compañías del país y del mundo.
Un entorno de trabajo colaborativo, emprendedor y solidario, y un equipo joven y dinámico en el que todos se apoyan para crecer juntos.
Un ambiente divertido y agradable y eventos festivos (afterworks, seminarios...).
Contrato indefinido y un salario muy competitivo, que se determinará en función del perfil y la experiencia.

4163318515.title: Data Analyst – Ads & Marketing Analytics (They/She/He)
4163318515.description:
About the job
If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique? 

🤝 Our culture and strong values. 

💪 Our career development philosophy. 

🤝 Our commitment to being a force for good. 

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

THE JOURNEY

Advertising performance:
Measure the effectiveness of the implemented commercial initiatives and establish KPIs to assess their performance (e.g., fill-rates, budget exhaustion rates) 
Design new KPIs to measure advertising campaigns success (ie. ROAS, New To Brand, Sales Uplift,)
Build data processing pipelines to make data available in Looker Dashboards for Commercial team
To deliver ad-hoc actionable insights and strategic initiatives to solve critical challenges in each market.
Audience monetization:
To use first-party data to build custom user segments that deliver value for advertiser and combine shopping behaviour and category data to enlarge audience capabilities creation
Create segmentation criteria for our 1P data to make it relevant and useful for Advertisers
Build API integrations with different Ads buying platforms (e.g.: DV360, TTD, CDPs)
Sales performance:
Make local teams' life easier by setting up and supporting centralized dashboards with FMCGs Sales, and performance data.
Contribute to continuous enhancement and innovation on how local teams consume data and share it with brands to unlock new opportunities.
Apply various advanced mathematical and statistical modeling techniques and analyses (experimentation, machine learning, causal inference, etc.) to solve for product and business problems that drive the highest impact.
What You Will Bring To The Ride

3-5 years of professional work experience on analytics in a similar/relevant industry experience in a data analytics role, preferably in advertising facing teams
Demonstrated proficiency in working with clean & optimized SQL and python, querying mid to large volumes of data.
A higher education in scientific discipline such as Physics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering or Mathematics.
Knowledge or experience in digital product development
Understanding of A/B test principles, to design, conduct and analyze different experiments.
Mastery in SQL and statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown
Demonstrated experience in designing and analyzing experiments in digital products (A/B test, multivariate, etc)
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, PowerBI
Excellent spoken and written English
Experience working on FMCG/CPG in Analytics is a Plus.

Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves

🌟 An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
💪 Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
🍔 Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
💳 Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
🏊 Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
👪 Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.

Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life? 

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

4148944608.title: Data Analyst - WhereTo, Spain
4148944608.description:
About the job
Hola, 안녕하세요, Salut, Привет! 

WhereTo is a business travel startup from San Francisco that evolved into an agile development and design studio within the Flight Centre family. We build travel solutions used by some of the largest companies on the planet - we have just one goal: making business travel better for everybody.

WhereTo provides an AI-powered travel platform for corporate travel. Their platform uses machine learning algorithms to recommend personalized travel options based on a traveler's preferences, company policies, and budget. WhereTo's technology also allows for real-time travel tracking, reporting, and cost analysis, enabling companies to optimize their travel programs and reduce costs.

To learn more about WhereTo click HERE

About Your Opportunity...

If you love data, this job is for you. We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated individual to take on the role of Data Analyst. As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for advanced data analysis, development of complex reports and dashboards, and providing strategic insights to drive operational performance for our global business. This position requires expertise in data transformation, modeling, and reporting development. Join our fast-paced environment at WhereTo as a Level II Data Analyst and play a pivotal role in shaping the future of travel through data analysis and innovation.

 A day in the life... 

 Develop advanced visual reports, interactive dashboards, and KPI scorecards to provide in-depth insights into operational performance. 
 Collect and process vast amounts of data from multiple sources, employing advanced data transformation techniques to ensure usability and accuracy. 
 Generate ad hoc reports, complex datasets, and leverage database or data warehouse queries and scripts to extract information for end-users. 
 Integrate data from diverse sources and systems to produce comprehensive and requested data elements. 
 Conduct ad hoc analysis of business data, identifying patterns, trends, and anomalies to support decision-making. 
 Provide assistance and support to customers, addressing data integrity, validation questions, and resolving related queries. 
 Analyze data and trends and propose performance improvement measures to optimize operational efficiency. 
 Collaborate effectively with operations and engineering teams, participating in issue identification, estimation, prioritization, and resolution. 
 Comfortably operate within the Agile Scrum model, actively contributing to team meetings and sprint planning sessions. 
 Attend meetings with clients and stakeholders, presenting findings, insights, and recommendations with clarity and professionalism. 

Experience & Qualifications...

 Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitative field (e.g., Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Physics) or related experience. 
 Strong communication skills required. 
 Strong experience working with analytics platforms such as mixpanel or similar required. 
 Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI, Superset, Tableau, etc 
 Experience with data analytics databases such as Druid. 
 Demonstrate a deep understanding of data relationships and a mastery of SQL syntax to perform advanced data retrieval and manipulation. 
 Exhibit exceptional analysis and design skills, critical thinking, and problemsolving abilities to tackle complex business challenges. 
 Experience in the DAX language, enabling the development of complex calculations and measures within Power BI a plus. 
 Prior experience working with travel data, understanding the unique challenges and requirements within the industry a plus. 
 Proficiency in Python or R, enabling advanced data manipulation, statistical analysis, and machine learning capabilities a plus. 

 Work Perks! - What’s in it for you... 

FCTG is renowned internationally for having amazing perks and an even better culture. We understand that our people are our most valuable asset. It is the passion and dedication of our teams that keep the company on top of the industry ladder. It’s also why we offer some great employee benefits and perks outside of the norm. 

 Our fantastic offices are located in the heart of Barcelona, at Plaça Catalunya. 
 The opportunity to join our free language lessons (English, French, Spanish or Catalan). 
 An attractive package: health insurance
 25 days off/year + 5 compensation days + reduced time during summer + bank holidays. 
 Flexible working-time. 
 Table tennis on the terrace, a kitchen area with free snacks, fresh fruits and drinks. 
 The opportunity to work with an international and talented team. 
 Several activities organised by the ambassadors!

4122058387.title: Data Analyst Intern
4122058387.description:
About the job
About The Job

Every time we eat and drink, we choose the world we want to live in. We believe that the health of people and the planet are 100% interconnected. This is what our One Planet One Health vision conveys. We invite you to join our food revolution with the goal of creating a healthier world.

Are you passionate about IT&DATA? Join our BTheOne Program and start your journey at Danone!

Your main objectives will be the following

Work on real-world projects that provide practical experience and deepen your expertise in data analytics tools such as SQL, excel, powerbi, and python. 
Gather and structure data from various sources, collect, prepare, and understand data, and present clear information. 
Contribute to the improvement of data quality and support the delivery of data products. 
Develop solutions to specific challenges that are compliant with our data quality framework and collaborate with internal data teams. 
Utilize powerpoint skills to report results to relevant stakeholders and communicate effectively with them. 
Collaborate with professionals around the world and gain insights and guidance from experienced data leads. 

About you

Do not hesitate to apply if...

In your studies, you’ve focused on Business Analytics, Data Analytics , IT, or Software Engineering
You’re familiar with Office 365 programs, and have a strong interest in product development
You have experience with SQL, and it’s a plus if you have skills with one or more of the following technologies SAP, Python, Snowflake, Informatica, MS PowerBI
You have strong analytical, problem-solving, and conceptual capabilities
You have a high level of English
And above all... you are looking forward to learning in a multinational company like Danone 🙂

About us

Working at Danone gives you the opportunity to impact more than 12 million consumers in Spain, where we lead the ranking of the most chosen brands in the country.

At Danone you will work to make a vision a reality “One Planet, One Health” and it doesn't matter where you are to make an impact on it.

Here, you will have space to create, to undertake, to grow and above all to be yourself, thanks to our culture of Inclusive Diversity, where we are clear that “our differences are what make the difference”.

You will work with agile methodologies, in high performance teams where you will learn, influence and contribute to achieve specific goals and grow with the company.

We want you to come and see for yourself, but if you want more information first, click here to convince you danoneespana.es / @danonecareers_es

At Danone we are 100% committed to guaranteeing selection processes free of bias and equal opportunities. For this we have trained all the people who participate in them. Because to work with us, what matters to us is what you can contribute and nothing else.

4057470357.title: Senior Data Analyst
4057470357.description:
About the job
Senior Data Analyst – Growth 
Location: Remote | Flexible Work

About Ideawise
At Ideawise, we build communities that empower people to live authentic and fulfilled lives. Our mission is to create impactful user experiences, and we’re seeking a Senior Data Analyst to join our Growth Squad.
In this role, you’ll analyze user retention, subscription-based revenue, in-app purchases (IAPs), ads and other growth-related areas. If you’re passionate about data storytelling, product growth and driving decisions through insights, this is the role for you.

What You’ll Do
Work closely with squads and squad leaders to design and implement A/B testing and multivariate experiments to validate feature impacts.
Analyze different growth areas and recommend strategies to maximize metrics such as D7 retention, ARPU, Landing page conversions, etc.
Build dashboards and tools to support data-driven decisions across Product, Tech, and Business teams.
Estimate potential impacts of product features and sunset non-performing ones.
Collaborate with data engineers to ensure accurate data tracking and pipelines.
Identify high-performing revenue channels and prioritize resource allocation accordingly.
Present actionable insights to stakeholders through compelling data storytelling.

What We’re Looking For
Must-Have Skills and Experience
5+ years of experience in data analysis in subscription-based businesses.
Strong expertise in designing and implementing A/B tests and statistical analyses, as well as communicating the experiment results to extended teams
Experience working in fast paced growth teams (acquisition, monetization or retention/engagement)
Expertise in SQL and Python for advanced data analysis.
Experience with cloud-native data warehouses (e.g., Snowflake, BigQuery, or Redshift).
Strong communication skills in English (written and spoken).
Proficiency with BI tools like Tableau, Superset, Power BI, or Looker.

Nice-to-Have Skills
Experience in paid user acquisition metrics (e.g., ROAS, LTV, payback periods).
Familiarity with tools like Mixpanel, Amplitude, or Eppo.
Background in the dating or gaming industries with IAPs/ads experience.

Why Join Us?
Impactful Work: Shape the future of our app monetization strategy.
Global Team: Collaborate with talented professionals from around the world.
Remote Flexibility: Work from anywhere with flexible hours.
Growth Opportunities: Access to training, mentorship, and career advancement.

How to Apply
Are you ready to take your data analysis skills to the next level? Apply now! Submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your experience with app-based subscription models and data storytelling.
Please, send your cover letter to wouter@ideawisegroup.com

4140795067.title: Data Analyst, Tracking & Analytics
4140795067.description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
Are you eager to develop and implement tracking and analytics solutions that help large international companies make informed decisions?

Do you want to join our ambitious journey within data tracking & analytics?

Are you ready to make a real impact on how global brands use data?At s360, we're not just collecting data – we're turning it into actionable insights that drive business growth.

Join our new team in Barcelona and help shape the future of ad-tech in a dynamic, startup-like environment while being part of a leading North European agency.Your key responsibilitiesYou will play a crucial role in delivering and advising on tracking and analytics solutions for our clients.

Overall your responsibilities will encompass the development and implementation of durable measurement and tracking setups.More specifically, your responsibilities will include:Responsible for own portfolio of clients within tracking & analyticsDriving strategic roadmaps towards a durable measurement setupPlanning, project management and execution as primary or part of projects for clients on an ad hoc basisAdvising and configuring e.G.

Google Analytics 4, Consent Mode, Enhanced Conversions, Conversion API, and Consent Management Platform (Cookiebot and Cookie Information)Testing, auditing, and ensuring the quality of tracking setupsDeveloping documentation and implementing both smaller and larger tracking setupsImplementing and adjusting conversion tracking/pixel across various channels and platformsDebugging and resolving ad hoc tracking issuesAbout your future teamYou will join our Measurement team who each day collaborate to make sure our clients succeed.

We strive to work closely on projects, complex cases, and troubleshooting while having fun and prioritizing the social aspects of working together.

Staying ahead with the latest technologies and products is part of our DNA, ensuring our clients gain a competitive advantage through future-proof tracking setups.Moreover, as part of our new Barcelona team, you'll contribute to building a collaborative environment.

You will help shape the growth of our office and contribute to building a culture that thrives on innovation, teamwork, and the shared goal of delivering exceptional results for our clients.Your profileYou have 4-6 years of hands-on experience from e.G.

a digital agency or an in-house role in a digital company.

You possess high professionalism as well as personal integrity and thrive in a fast-paced environment, where we constantly strive to improve and create more value for our clients.Furthermore, you:High-level user of Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager for ecommerceHave a working knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScriptHave experience in driving larger tracking & analytics projects for complex setups and client organizationsComfortable explaining complex and technical concepts both verbally and in writingAble to communicate in English with colleagues and external stakeholders from various locationsAre a problem-solver, unafraid of tackling challenging tasksAre detail-oriented and structured, taking pride in delivering thorough solutionsHave a direct and open communication style, and you are comfortable with giving and receiving constructive feedbackAppreciate collaborative sparring and knowledge-sharing within the team, coupled with the ability to work independently and manage tasks in a structured mannerNote: You must be eligible to work in Spain and the EU without requiring sponsorship.What we offerYou will be a part of a strong team with some of the industry's top specialists who all strive to ensure that our next delivery is always better than before.

You will join an international team working with clients across the s360 group.Moreover, you will be a part of a company characterized by:A culture that is down-to-earth and full of constructive feedback and sparring that drives your personal and professional developmentFreedom under responsibility and flexible working hoursAmbitious and professional colleagues - who also like to have fun!Continuous learning and development opportunities to enhance your skills and advance your career.Social events like our MeetUp for all s360-employeesOur office in the popular Norrsken House Barcelona offers the city's best location with views of the beach and W-hotel, as well as many social and networking activities.We'd love to hear from you!Is this the right fit for you?

Then don't hesitate to apply or reach out to Andrej Plancic, Managing Director, at ****** review applications on an ongoing basis and hire as soon as the right candidate is found, so please send your CV and application as soon as possible.

All inquiries are treated confidentially.About s360s360 is a leading Northern European digital marketing agency that helps brands and retailers grow by providing a strong tech foundation, best-in-class execution, and deep industry expertise.

With a team of +300 digital specialists, s360 operates ten offices across seven countries: Denmark, Finland, Norway, Sweden, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands, and Spain.

4151324411.title: Online Data Analyst
4151324411.description:
About the job
Online Data Analyst - Spanish (ES)


Job Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:
In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community
Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.

Qualification Path:
No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.

Basic Requirements
Full Professional Proficiency in Spanish and English
Being a resident in Spain for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Spain
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

Assessment:
In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

Equal Opportunity
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

4168603437.title: Data Engineer / Analyst
4168603437.description:
About the job
Desde Grupo Planeta estamos buscando incorporar un/a Data Engineer / Analyst apasionado y con experiencia para unirse a nuestro equipo de datos.

Somos un equipo innovador, creativo y proactivo. Así que buscamos a una persona muy motivada, con ganas de implicarse en el proyecto y aportar, no solo a nivel profesional sino también personal.

¿En qué consistirá tu día a día?

Construir y mantener pipelines de datos eficientes.
Conectar los diferentes sistemas al data lake y limpieza de datos.
Extraer insights valiosos para la toma de decisiones estratégicas.
Proyectos de conexión de APIs y extracción de datos
Desarrollo de pipelines de datos y automatización de procesos


¿Qué ofrecemos?

Contrato estable: Indefinido y a jornada completa.
Podrás desarrollarte profesionalmente gracias a nuestros planes de formación y desarrollo de talento interno.
Descuentos y promociones exclusivas para nuestros empleados (másteres y posgrados, sellos editoriales, coleccionables, Casa del Libro…).
Un atractivo paquete de beneficios sociales a través del plan de retribución flexible que incluye: tarjeta transporte, tarjeta restaurante, cheque guardería, seguro médico, etc.


Requisitos:

¿Qué nos gustaría ver en tu CV?

2 años de experiencia en roles de Data Engineer o Data Analyst.
Experiencia demostrable en proyectos de conexión de APIs y extracción de datos.
Experiencia en desarrollo de pipelines de datos y automatización de procesos.
Experiencia en la creación de dashboards y visualización de datos (por ejemplo, con Tableau, Power BI, Looker)..


¿Cómo nos gustaría que fueras?

Habilidades analíticas y capacidad para traducir datos en insights accionables.
Excelentes habilidades de comunicación y capacidad para trabajar en equipo.
Capacidad para trabajar de forma autónoma y gestionar múltiples proyectos simultáneamente.


Si cumples con los requisitos y te gusta asumir nuevos retos, ¡queremos conocerte!

En Grupo Planeta ofrecemos igualdad de oportunidades. Nos comprometemos a tratar todas las candidaturas por igual en función de sus capacidades, logros y experiencia independientemente de su raza, nacionalidad, sexo, edad, discapacidad, orientación sexual, identidad de género o cualquier otra clasificación protegida por la ley.
