4124932530.title: Brand Advertising Data Analyst (They/She/He)
4124932530.description:
About the job
If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique? 

🤝 Our culture and strong values. 

💪 Our career development philosophy. 

🤝 Our commitment to being a force for good. 

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

THE JOURNEY

Advertising performance:
Measure the effectiveness of the implemented commercial initiatives and establish KPIs to assess their performance (e.g., fill-rates, budget exhaustion rates) 
Design new KPIs to measure advertising campaigns success (ie. ROAS, New To Brand, Sales Uplift,)
Build data processing pipelines to make data available in Looker Dashboards for Commercial team
To deliver ad-hoc actionable insights and strategic initiatives to solve critical challenges in each market.
Audience monetization:
To use first-party data to build custom user segments that deliver value for advertiser and combine shopping behaviour and category data to enlarge audience capabilities creation
Create segmentation criteria for our 1P data to make it relevant and useful for Advertisers
Build API integrations with different Ads buying platforms (e.g.: DV360, TTD, CDPs)
Sales performance:
Make local teams' life easier by setting up and supporting centralized dashboards with FMCGs Sales, and performance data.
Contribute to continuous enhancement and innovation on how local teams consume data and share it with brands to unlock new opportunities.
Apply various advanced mathematical and statistical modeling techniques and analyses (experimentation, machine learning, causal inference, etc.) to solve for product and business problems that drive the highest impact.
What You Will Bring To The Ride

3-5 years of professional work experience on analytics in a similar/relevant industry experience in a data analytics role, preferably in advertising facing teams
Demonstrated proficiency in working with clean & optimized SQL and python, querying mid to large volumes of data.
A higher education in scientific discipline such as Physics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering or Mathematics.
Knowledge or experience in digital product development
Understanding of A/B test principles, to design, conduct and analyze different experiments.
Mastery in SQL and statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown
Demonstrated experience in designing and analyzing experiments in digital products (A/B test, multivariate, etc)
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, PowerBI
Excellent spoken and written English
Experience working on FMCG/CPG in Analytics is a Plus.

Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves

🌟 An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
💪 Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
🍔 Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
💳 Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
🏊 Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
👪 Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.

Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life? 

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

4175871085.title: Data Scientist
4175871085.description:
About the job
About Halr Tech Group

At Halr Tech Group, we specialise in technology-driven recruitment, seamlessly connecting leading companies with top-tier talent across IT, tech, engineering, and sales. We focus on finding skilled professionals who drive innovation and deliver impactful results.

About the Role
We are seeking a Data Scientist to join a forward-thinking team in the EMEA region. This role involves working with large datasets, applying statistical analysis, and leveraging machine learning to drive business insights and develop predictive models.
The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical mindset, experience in data-driven decision-making, and expertise in working with modern data science tools and frameworks.

OTE - Y1 - €60,000

Key Responsibilities
Develop and implement machine learning models to solve complex business problems.
Analyse large datasets to extract meaningful insights and drive strategic decision-making.
Work with structured and unstructured data from multiple sources.
Design and maintain data pipelines for processing and transforming data efficiently.
Collaborate with engineering, product, and business teams to apply data-driven solutions.
Develop and optimise predictive models for forecasting and automation.
Conduct A/B testing and statistical analysis to evaluate performance metrics.
Visualise and present findings using tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Matplotlib.
Ensure data integrity, security, and compliance with industry standards.

Requirements
3+ years of experience in data science, machine learning, or a related field.
Proficiency in Python, R, or SQL for data manipulation and analysis.
Strong understanding of machine learning algorithms and statistical modelling techniques.
Experience with big data technologies (Spark, Hadoop, Databricks) is a plus.
Knowledge of cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) and containerisation (Docker, Kubernetes).
Hands-on experience with data visualisation tools and dashboarding.
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work with complex datasets.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science, or a related field.

Nice to Have
Experience with deep learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Knowledge of natural language processing (NLP) or computer vision.
Exposure to MLOps for deploying machine learning models at scale.
Experience in financial services, healthcare, or e-commerce analytics.

Benefits
Highly competitive salary and performance-based incentives.
Remote/hybrid working options across the EMEA region.
Access to cutting-edge AI/ML projects and technologies.
Professional development and certification support.
Comprehensive benefits package (health insurance, pension, etc.).

How to Apply
If you are a data-driven professional passionate about using analytics and machine learning to solve real-world challenges, we encourage you to apply!

4151326482.title: Online Data Analyst
4151326482.description:
About the job
Online Data Analyst - Spanish (ES)


Job Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:
In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community
Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.

Qualification Path:
No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.

Basic Requirements
Full Professional Proficiency in Spanish and English
Being a resident in Spain for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Spain
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

Assessment:
In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

Equal Opportunity
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

4087514001.title: Senior Data Analyst (Spain based)
4087514001.description:
About the job
At XRHealth, we're at the forefront of healthcare innovation, specializing in groundbreaking virtual reality (VR) and augmented reality (AR) solutions. Our recent merger with Amelia Virtual Care, a leader in VR applications for treating conditions such as anxiety, phobias, stress, addictive disorders, OCD, and ADHD, exemplifies our dedication to pioneering healthcare technology.

Join us as a Senior Data Analyst on this exciting journey, where you will play a key role in developing a comprehensive strategy for integrating data warehouses and BI tools and, supporting the company’s growth, by developing extensive capabilities in KPI visualizations.

Would you like to know about the people working in this environment? 

We’re an international team of self-driven, energetic, and passionate professionals on a mission to change the world for the better and be part of a meaningful business.

Your mission: 

Be the right-hand of product and business leaders in building business cases. 
Uncover actionable insights and make recommendations that will influence the company's strategic and tactical decisions. 
Analysis of patient lifecycle, marketing funnel analysis, examining and studying trends, and communicating insights 
Produce analysis to facilitate resource allocation decisions across business units by studying CAC, LTV, Sales ROI. 
Lead & implement data-related projects and solutions - from design to implementation, including ETL / ELT processes and DWH infrastructure. 

You'll be a good fit if you are/have: 

A Hands-on Senior Data Analyst, with 4+ years of experience with advanced skills in SQL and BI Tools 
Advanced knowledge and capabilities in data engineering, including ETL / ELT tools and DWH architecture. 
B.A./B.Sc. degree with a focus on statistical and analytical skills. 
Proficient in effectively communicating analytics outcomes to business stakeholders. 
Excellent teamwork skills while also being capable of working autonomously. 
Ability to plan, prioritize, and develop data solutions to support business growth. 
Self-motivated, independent, organized, and proactive. 
Highly responsive, flexible, and adaptable when collaborating with multiple teams. 
Excellent communication skills in English. 
Aligned with our values: entrepreneurial, global mindset, full of passion & empathy and motivated to make a positive difference in the world. 

It’d be nice if you are/ have: 

Experience with product/marketing analytic tools such as Mixpanel, Pixel, Google Tag Manager, and Google Optimize 
Experience with Python for statistical analysis 

What will you find if you join: 

The chance to bring your daily effort and energy to a positive and real impact solution for society. 
 Work in a fast-growing industry, being the leading company in virtual reality for healthcare. 
 Constant innovation: We work very hard to deliver an innovative product to our clients. 
Real development opportunities with the opportunity to grow professionally and personally. Be surrounded by a diverse environment and constantly interact with people from different backgrounds, nationalities, languages, cultures, and ways of thinking. 
We care about our crew: we promote communication and team spirit at company-wide events and team-building activities. 

Powered by JazzHR

4173963033.title: Business Data Analyst en Customer Intelligence
4173963033.description:
About the job
Description And Requirements

¿Te apetece unirte a Endesa?

Estamos buscando a una persona para poder trabajar como Consultor/a Customer Intelligence en nuestra sede en Madrid o Sevilla.

Te contamos un poco más.

¿Qué se realiza en el área?

En Endesa ponemos al cliente en el centro de nuestra estrategia basada en mejorar la eficiencia y la experiencia del cliente. Nuestro equipo aplica técnicas de Advanced Analytics innovadoras que permiten conocer mejor a nuestro cliente, ofrecerle productos y servicios personalizados e incrementar su satisfacción.

¿Y cuáles serán tus funciones?

Trabajarás desarrollando e implementando modelos de advanced analytics con un alto impacto económico en el negocio. En particular tus responsabilidades incluirán:

 Definir y diseñar los modelos analíticos para la resolución de problemas de negocio, explorando diferentes técnicas.
 Implementar los modelos analíticos utilizando lenguajes de programación orientados a datos (Python).
 Operar y mantener los modelos implementados, identificando oportunidades de mejora continua.
 Generar los resultados, reportarlos e interpretarlos desde el punto vista tanto técnico como de negocio.
 Acceder, unificar, validar y transformar grandes volúmenes de datos, tanto de clientes como de mercado, garantizando la calidad para su uso posterior.
 Analizar e interpretar los datos, de forma metódica, siendo capaz de extraer conclusiones concretas que aporten valor al negocio.
 Buscar, identificar, analizar y seleccionar variables a incluir en los modelos.
 Establecer los criterios para la operación y mantenimiento de los modelos. los resultados, reportarlos e interpretarlos desde el punto vista tanto técnico como de negocio.

¿Para poder realizar este trabajo qué necesitamos de ti?

Será requisito indispensable para la ocupación de la posición que cuentes con los siguientes conocimientos y/o experiencia:

Grado en Matemáticas, Informática, Física o Ingeniería.
Lenguaje de programación de BBDD estructuradas: Consultas complejas en SQL.
Explotación BBDD estructuradas: Creación de objetos, extracción y carga de datos masivo (Redshift, MySql,Postgre).
Modelos analíticos: Regresión logística, series temporales, clustering, redes neuronales, Random Forest, XGBoost, Deep-learning, etc.
Librerías de Python y su ecosistema (Jupyter, Numpy, Pandas, ScikitLearn, SciPy, Matplotlib, Pyplot, etc..).
Herramientas de visualización: QlikView, Qliksense, PowerBi.
Keras y TensorFlow.

Además el candidato deberá contar con actitud para trabajar en equipo, capacidad de resolución de problemas, fuerte motivación.

Otra información a tener en cuenta:

 Actitud para trabajar en equipo, capacidad de resolución de problemas, fuerte motivación.
 Actitud proactiva para proponer nuevas iniciativas, así como áreas de mejora.
Inquietud por la formación técnica, buscando oportunidades de aprendizaje que permitan la actualización constante de tu conocimiento.
Capacidades de comunicación y habilidades para reportar resultados con un lenguaje adaptado al negocio.

Actitud colaborativa e iniciativa para fomentar el intercambio de conocimiento técnico entre los distintos miembros del equipo.

 Capacidad analítica para extraer información relevante de negocio a partir de la explotación y análisis de datos

Y ahora seguro que te interesa saber qué es lo que te vamos a ofrecer

Para esta posición ofrecemos un contrato indefinido y un salario alineado a tu perfil y la posición que vas a ocupar.

También disfrutarás de una variedad de beneficios sociales; por ejemplo, plan de pensiones, tarifa eléctrica de empleado, ayuda de estudios, ayuda al deporte, préstamos, ayuda económica si tienes hijos con discapacidad, retribución flexible (transporte, formación, seguro médico, guardería, compra de acciones de la empresa, comedor…).

Además, ofrecemos otros servicios como asesoramiento financiero, tarifas especiales con agencia de viajes, condiciones bancarias especiales por ser empleado de Endesa. Dependiendo del centro de trabajo, existe la opción de profesor de pilates, yoga, nutricionista, car sharing, aparcamiento gratuito…

Si crees que esta posición supone una oportunidad de desarrollo y un reto para ti, ¡no lo dudes e inscríbete!

Sólo tienes que aplicar a esta oferta de empleo. Si tu perfil encaja con lo que buscamos, Laura y Teresa del equipo de Atracción de Talento, valorarán tu candidatura y contactarán contigo, para conocerte más.

Por último, pero no menos importante, para nosotros la diversidad y la inclusión son puntos esenciales en nuestro día a día, por lo que en nuestros procesos de selección siempre contamos con todas las personas que muestran su interés y tienen el perfil que buscamos. Integramos e incluimos la diversidad de personas en todos sus sentidos.

Si quieres conocer un poco más sobre Endesa y Enel, te invitamos a que hagas click en estos enlaces:

Endesa: https://www.endesa.com/es/sobre-endesa/quienes-somos

Enel Green Power: https://www.enelgreenpower.com/es 

Endesa X: https://www.endesax.com/es/es

4143684158.title: Data Analyst
4143684158.description:
About the job
Desde Grupo Planeta estamos buscando un/a Data Analyst para integrarse en el Departamento de Transformación Digital BI, asumiendo la gestión en temas de Reporting y Análisis de los distintas marcas que integran la división de Planeta Formación y Universidades (HQ - Barcelona).

¿Cuáles serán tus principales funciones?

Activar proyectos de analítica para las áreas de Planeta Formación y Universidades 
Desarrollar e implementar dashboards en Power BI
Establecer KPI y métricas para evaluar soluciones de análisis dado un caso de uso o proyecto particular
Refinar los requisitos en problemas de modelado


Requisitos:

¿Qué queremos ver en tu CV?

Valorable máster en Data Analyst
Experiencia profesional en Power BI
Experiencia profesional de al menos 2 años trabajando en Power BI, Tableau, Qlik o herramientas similares
Experiencia en la investigación de nuevas tecnologías y tendencias
Conocimientos en SQL, Python
Valorable experiencia en Fabric, Azure Machine Learning


Encajarías con nosotros si te consideras una persona con:

Gran capacidad de análisis
Autonomía y adaptación


¿Qué ofrecemos?

Contrato estable: Indefinido y Jornada Completa.
Podrás desarrollarte profesionalmente gracias a nuestros planes de formación y desarrollo de talento interno.
Descuentos y promociones exclusivas para nuestros empleados (masters y posgrados, sellos editoriales, coleccionables, Casa del Libro…).
Un atractivo paquete de beneficios sociales a través del plan de retribución flexible que incluye: tarjeta transporte, tarjeta restaurante, cheque guardería, seguro médico, etc.


Si crees que es tu oportunidad laboral, ¡Te animamos a inscribirte y formar parte de nuestro equipo!

4172625305.title: Mid-Level Data Scientist
4172625305.description:
About the job
Company Description
Work smart, have fun and make an impact!

Our purpose is to guide all companies toward a sustainable world. EcoVadis is the leading provider of business sustainability ratings. Our solutions are backed by an international team of experts and powerful technology. We analyze data and build sustainability scorecards that give companies actionable insights into their environmental, social and ethical risks.

Why apply to EcoVadis? Be a part of the global sustainability change in business. Grow your career. Work with extraordinary people. Feel valued for your contribution.
Learn more about our team and culture on EcoVadis careers page.

Job Description
We are looking for a highly motivated Mid-Level Data Scientist to join our growing AI Center of Excellence team, responsible for using machine learning and natural language processing to drive innovation across the organization and accelerate positive impact on our planet and society. You will be part of the team of 25 scientists and engineers delivering solutions for our product portfolio and enhancing operational excellence.
Your global responsibilities will include (but will not be limited to):
Working with large, complex data sets to solve challenging business problems by applying advanced analytical methods as needed
Articulating and translating business questions into technical solutions
Building, benchmarking, and maintaining machine learning models and identifying data annotation efforts
Leveraging Python, MLflow, Azure stack (e.g., Azure cloud, Azure ML, Azure Data Factory) and Databricks to deliver end-to-end solutions
Staying in close contact with customers to evaluate their needs and recommend solutions that increase customer satisfaction and drive business value

Qualifications
Education and experience
Master’s degree in quantitative discipline (e.g., Statistics/Applied Math, Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science or a related field)
2+ years of overall experience in Machine Learning/NLP and data mining techniques
Knowledge of Machine Learning algorithms, frameworks and libraries, including deep learning frameworks
Good understanding of text representation techniques and experience in implementing NLP solutions (e.g., named entity recognition, information retrieval, question answering)
Strong analytical, mathematical, and coding skills
Strong communication skills
Any experience with Azure or other cloud provider would be a distinct advantage

Skills, abilities and work standards:
Continuous Learner – Ability to continually develop and improve one’s skill and knowledge to perform effectively and adapt to change in the workplace. Development occurs through a variety of learning opportunities, seeking feedback, and individual reflection.
Personally Effective - Making use of all of the personal resources at your disposal (talents, skills, energy, and time) to achieve goals.
Authentic - Being honest and authentic in communication, feedback and strategy.
Results-driven - Setting high goals for themselves and others. They accomplish their goals by effectively working through challenges and demonstrate commitment to the company's goals.
Creative Problem Solver - Focused on improving their practices and results. They are open to new ideas and they maximize available resources.
Collaborator & Partner - Works effectively with others to achieve shared goals through cooperation, sharing knowledge, joint problem-solving, and celebrating success.

Additional Information
Location: Hybrid in Barcelona (4 times a month in the office) or Remote from Spain
Start date: 2025

In return for your expertise, we offer:
Support with all the necessary office and IT equipment
Flexible working hours
Wellness allowance for mental and physical wellbeing
Access to professional mental health support
Referral bonus policy
Learning and development
Sustainability events and community involvement
Peer recognition program
Employee-led resource groups
Hybrid work organization (from the office or from home)
Remote work from abroad policy
Meals and Transportation Vouchers (Cobee card)
Dental Benefits
Life & Accident Insurance + Private Health Insurance
Paid employee volunteer day
Paid moving day (1/year)
Time off: 1 Community Service Day + 1 Personal Day
Summer Hours in July and August (36 hours per week)
Hybrid Monthly Allowance for electricity and Internet

Our hiring team looks forward to reviewing your CV and cover letter with a guaranteed response to every application. A new job with purpose awaits you!

Don’t fit all the criteria but still think you’d be a good candidate? Please apply anyway to give our hiring team the opportunity to assess your skills and to learn more about what you could bring to EcoVadis. We’re interested in hiring capable people, regardless of professional and educational background.

Can the hiring process be adjusted to suit my needs? Yes. We want everyone going through the hiring process with EcoVadis to feel confident that you are able to demonstrate your full potential. We welcome applications from disabled people, people with long-term health conditions, and neurodiverse candidates. If you need any adjustments, including the provision of interview questions, please let the hiring team know.

Our team’s strength comes from everyone’s uniqueness and is founded upon mutual respect. EcoVadis commits to equity, inclusion and reducing bias in our hiring processes. EcoVadis does not accept any form of discrimination based on color, national or ethnic origin, ancestry, citizenship, religion, beliefs, age, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, neurodiversity, disability, parental status, or any other protected characteristic that makes you unique. In your application, we encourage you to remove personal information such as: photographs, marital status, number of children, religion, gender, residential postal code, university graduation date, past medical or parental leave(s) taken, nationality (instead, please state if you are legally eligible to work in the job region/country), university name (instead, please state any degrees obtained and the study major).
Company Description
Work smart, have fun and make an impact!
Our purpose is to guide all companies toward a sustainable world. EcoVadis is the leading provider of business sustainability ratings. Our solutions are backed by an international team of experts and powerful technology. We analyze data and build sustainability scorecards that give companies actionable insights into their environmental, social and ethical risks.
Our purpose is to guide all companies toward a sustainable world
Why apply to EcoVadis? Be a part of the global sustainability change in business. Grow your career. Work with extraordinary people. Feel valued for your contribution.
Why apply to EcoVadis?
Learn more about our team and culture on EcoVadis careers page.
Job Description
We are looking for a highly motivated Mid-Level Data Scientist to join our growing AI Center of Excellence team, responsible for using machine learning and natural language processing to drive innovation across the organization and accelerate positive impact on our planet and society. You will be part of the team of 25 scientists and engineers delivering solutions for our product portfolio and enhancing operational excellence.
Mid-Level Data Scientist
Your global responsibilities will include (but will not be limited to):
Working with large, complex data sets to solve challenging business problems by applying advanced analytical methods as needed
Articulating and translating business questions into technical solutions
Building, benchmarking, and maintaining machine learning models and identifying data annotation efforts
Leveraging Python, MLflow, Azure stack (e.g., Azure cloud, Azure ML, Azure Data Factory) and Databricks to deliver end-to-end solutions
Staying in close contact with customers to evaluate their needs and recommend solutions that increase customer satisfaction and drive business value

Strong analytical, mathematical, and coding skills
Strong communication skills

4166261570.title: Data Scientist
4166261570.description:
About the job
En Lognext llevamos más de 18 años identificando e implementando soluciones tecnológicas prácticas que nos permitan seguir avanzando y optimicen nuestras operaciones, acompañando a los equipos con talento experto de alto rendimiento y haciendo de la tecnología una fuerza transformadora en nuestro día a día. 

Buscamos un Data Scientist con talento para incorporarse a nuestro equipo para una multinacional líder en el sector asegurador.

🔍¿Qué buscamos?
Formación deseable en matemáticas o estadística. Se valorará positivamente el Máster en Big Data
2 ó 3 años de experiencia en puestos de Data Science.
Conocimiento de Python y Spark. Deseable Scala.
Capacidad para realizar análisis y preparación de datos así como modelos de ML cumpliendo los estándares necesarios para su puesta en producción.
Deseable conocimiento sobre LLMs.
Deseable inglés fluido hablado y escrito.

🛠️ Funciones y responsabilidades
Evolución y mantenimiento de los distintos proyectos de Data e IA desplegados por el equipo de Data Science del grupo
Trabajo con negocio en la identificación de posibles mejoras para los proyectos ya desplegados en producción.
Desarrollo de los evolutivos identificados.
Análisis de posibles mejoras en los proyectos.
Incorporación de buenas prácticas y nuevas técnicas.
Gestión de incidentales con soporte del Data Scientist responsable del proyecto.

🏆 ¿Qué ofrecemos?
💰Salario Competitivo
📍Modalidad hibrida (1 vez por semana)
💼Retribución flexible
🚀 Bono de formación anual
⏰ Flexibilidad horaria
✈️ 23 días de vacaciones
🏆 Referral Program

Únete a un equipo de NEXTERS que van más allá, un equipo donde la creatividad, el ingenio y la audacia marcan la diferencia en un mundo lleno de oportunidades. En Lognext apostamos por la igualdad entre mujeres y hombres y prueba de ello tenemos Plan de Igualdad registrado y publicado. Y asimismo, creemos que en la multiculturalidad existe una fuente de valores, experiencias y conocimiento, que aportan valor añadido a nuestros proyectos, es por ello por lo que creemos en la diversidad y estamos comprometidos con ella.

4092713751.title: Business Intelligence Analyst
4092713751.description:
About the job
About The Role

As a Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing and interpreting complex data to provide actionable insights that help the organization make informed business decisions. This role involves collecting, processing, and analyzing data from various sources to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for business improvement.

Key Responsibilities

Data Collection and Management: Gather data from internal and external sources, ensuring accuracy and consistency. This may include working with databases, data warehouses, and cloud storage systems.
Data Analysis: Analyze large datasets using statistical and analytical tools to uncover trends, patterns, and correlations.
Reporting and Visualization: Create and deliver reports, dashboards, and data visualizations to communicate findings clearly to stakeholders, ensuring they are actionable and relevant.
Business Insights: Collaborate with departments such as marketing, sales, and finance to understand business needs and provide insights that inform strategy and decision-making.
Data Quality Assurance: Monitor data quality and ensure integrity across reporting systems. Identify and resolve data inconsistencies or discrepancies.
Tools and Technologies: Use business intelligence tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Excel, SQL, etc.) to automate reporting processes and support data-driven decision-making.
Continuous Improvement: Stay up-to-date with industry trends and new technologies to improve BI processes and methodologies.

Critical Skills

Excellent analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex datasets and extract actionable insights.
Proactive, flexible, and problem-solving attitude, able to prioritize in a fast-paced and dynamic work environment.
Humble and approachable, a team player with great collaboration skills.
Excellent communication skills to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

Job Requirements

A degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Analytics, or a related field.
Experience in a similar role, with a strong background in business intelligence, data analysis, and project management, ideally with exposure to various business domains (sales, marketing, finance).
Experience with SQL and databases (e.g., MySQL, SQL Server, Oracle).
Advanced Excel skills, including the ability to use functions, pivot tables, and data analysis tools.
Proficiency in BI tools and technologies (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, SAP BI).
Strong knowledge of data management, data mining, and statistical analysis techniques.

Diversity & Inclusion commitment

At Kings League we strongly believe in building an inclusive and diverse work environment, where everyone can develop their full potential. We are committed to the integration of people with disabilitites and different capabilities, and fostering a team where everyone has the opportunity to contribute and grow. If you meet the requirements of the position, we invite you to send us your application; we value the richness that diversity brings and look forward to welcoming your talent and experience.

4159235520.title: Data Analyst
4159235520.description:
About the job
About Finmid

finmid's mission is to enable software companies to reimagine how their business customers access capital. By productizing the complexity of financial services, finmid empowers companies to offer financial services where FinTech isn't the mission but enables the mission.

About The Opportunity

We are seeking a Data Analyst based in Berlin or remotely. This role is designed for someone who thrives at the intersection of business and technology, translating raw data into actionable insights that fuel strategic decisions. You will act as a bridge between Engineering and Business teams, ensuring data is leveraged effectively to drive company growth.

If you are a self-starter who is proactive, inquisitive, and thrives in a fast-paced environment, this is the role for you.

In this role, you will:

Partner with business stakeholders to identify opportunities where data insights can drive better decision-making. 
Develop dashboards, reports, and data models that provide visibility into key performance metrics and business health. 
Conduct exploratory data analysis (EDA) to identify trends, gaps, and opportunities in our business and product offerings. 
Work closely with Engineering team to ensure data pipelines are structured effectively and that data integrity is maintained. 
Support business strategy by providing data-driven insights that guide revenue, marketing, and operational initiatives. 
Drive A/B testing and experiment analysis, ensuring our decisions are backed by strong statistical evidence. 
Translate complex data into clear narratives that stakeholders across teams can understand and act upon. 

What you need to be successful (requirements):

Minimum 3 years of experience in a Data Analyst or similar role, ideally in a fast-paced fintech environment. 
Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field. 
Strong business acumen with a focus on strategic problem-solving and decision-making. 
Excellent communication skills—you can break down complex data insights into clear, actionable takeaways for non-technical stakeholders. 
Excellent SQL skills and familiarity with data visualization tools such as Metabase, Tableau, Looker or Power BI. 
Knowledge of Python or R for data analysis is a plus, but not required. 
Experience working cross-functionally, particularly with Product, Engineering, and Business teams. 
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, ambiguous environment and take ownership of data projects from start to finish. 
A self-starter mindset with a passion for uncovering insights and driving business impact. 

Benefits

We see ourselves as “distributed first” but also have a beautiful office in Berlin where you can work. 
We are flexible and cover whatever you need to be as productive as possible. 
Home office stipend. 
30 days vacation. 
Meaningful equity. 
Open-minded and transparent culture that includes regular get-together meetings (e.g. All Hands, Brown Bag Lunch, Offsite). 

We're looking for people with passion, grit and integrity. You're encouraged to apply even if your experience doesn't precisely match the job description. We welcome diverse perspectives and people who think out of the box and aren't afraid to challenge assumptions. Join us.

4125164497.title: Data Analyst – Brand Advertising (They/She/He)
4125164497.description:
About the job
If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique? 

🤝 Our culture and strong values. 

💪 Our career development philosophy. 

🤝 Our commitment to being a force for good. 

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

THE JOURNEY

Advertising performance:
Measure the effectiveness of the implemented commercial initiatives and establish KPIs to assess their performance (e.g., fill-rates, budget exhaustion rates) 
Design new KPIs to measure advertising campaigns success (ie. ROAS, New To Brand, Sales Uplift,)
Build data processing pipelines to make data available in Looker Dashboards for Commercial team
To deliver ad-hoc actionable insights and strategic initiatives to solve critical challenges in each market.
Audience monetization:
To use first-party data to build custom user segments that deliver value for advertiser and combine shopping behaviour and category data to enlarge audience capabilities creation
Create segmentation criteria for our 1P data to make it relevant and useful for Advertisers
Build API integrations with different Ads buying platforms (e.g.: DV360, TTD, CDPs)
Sales performance:
Make local teams' life easier by setting up and supporting centralized dashboards with FMCGs Sales, and performance data.
Contribute to continuous enhancement and innovation on how local teams consume data and share it with brands to unlock new opportunities.
Apply various advanced mathematical and statistical modeling techniques and analyses (experimentation, machine learning, causal inference, etc.) to solve for product and business problems that drive the highest impact.
What You Will Bring To The Ride

3-5 years of professional work experience on analytics in a similar/relevant industry experience in a data analytics role, preferably in advertising facing teams
Demonstrated proficiency in working with clean & optimized SQL and python, querying mid to large volumes of data.
A higher education in scientific discipline such as Physics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering or Mathematics.
Knowledge or experience in digital product development
Understanding of A/B test principles, to design, conduct and analyze different experiments.
Mastery in SQL and statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown
Demonstrated experience in designing and analyzing experiments in digital products (A/B test, multivariate, etc)
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, PowerBI
Excellent spoken and written English
Experience working on FMCG/CPG in Analytics is a Plus.

Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves

🌟 An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
💪 Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
🍔 Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
💳 Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
🏊 Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
👪 Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.

Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life? 

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!
exciting ride
new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.
non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people
Not your usual app
What makes our ride unique?
🤝 Our culture and strong values.
💪 Our career development philosophy.
🤝 Our commitment to being a force for good.
To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities.

Measure the effectiveness of the implemented commercial initiatives and establish KPIs to assess their performance (e.g., fill-rates, budget exhaustion rates) 
Design new KPIs to measure advertising campaigns success (ie. ROAS, New To Brand, Sales Uplift,)
Build data processing pipelines to make data available in Looker Dashboards for Commercial team
To deliver ad-hoc actionable insights and strategic initiatives to solve critical challenges in each market.

Create segmentation criteria for our 1P data to make it relevant and useful for Advertisers

Contribute to continuous enhancement and innovation on how local teams consume data and share it with brands to unlock new opportunities.

4151323359.title: Online Data Analyst
4151323359.description:
About the job
Online Data Analyst - Spanish (ES)


Job Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:
In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community
Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.

Qualification Path:
No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.

Basic Requirements
Full Professional Proficiency in Spanish and English
Being a resident in Spain for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Spain
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

Assessment:
In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

Equal Opportunity
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

4111431143.title: Web Analyst, Amplitude (BI Team)
4111431143.description:
About the job
Hi there!

We are Semrush, a global IT company developing our own product – a platform for digital marketers. New stars are born here, so don’t miss your chance.

This is our Web Analyst, Amplitude role for those who strive to implement functional processes and drive them to full completion.

Tasks in the role

Amplitude Implementation & Management: Configure and maintain Amplitude for effective user behavior tracking, ensuring accurate data capture for internal platform products
GA4 & GTM Support: Provide backup support for Google Analytics 4 (GA4) and Google Tag Manager (GTM) configurations, including troubleshooting and maintenance
Tagging & Tracking: Develop tagging strategies, ensuring proper implementation and consistency across digital products
Technical Data Integrations: Optimize and maintain integrations between Amplitude, Google tools, and other third-party services to create seamless data flows
Stakeholder Support: Provide technical support and guidance to internal teams for troubleshooting and implementing tracking needs
Documentation & Best Practices: Maintain clear documentation of tracking implementations, standards, and best practices
Training: Support internal teams through training sessions and ongoing assistance with analytics tools


Who we are looking for

Amplitude Expertise: Proficiency in configuring and managing Amplitude, including experience with custom events, user properties, and analytics queries
GA4 and GTM Knowledge: Strong knowledge of GA4 and GTM, with experience in tag management and troubleshooting
Web Technologies: Familiarity with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and APIs, especially for integration and tag management
Data Skills: SQL proficiency for data extraction and analysis, with an understanding of exporting data to data warehouses (DWH)
Visualization Tools: Experience with data visualization platforms such as Looker Studio or Tableau
Communication Skills: Strong ability to work cross-functionally and communicate across various stakeholder levels


Not required, but a plus

Additional Programming: Skills in HTML, CSS, JavaScript for more advanced tag management
Advanced Analytics Stack: Experience with Google BigQuery, Airflow, and dbt
A/B Testing & CMP: Familiarity with A/B platforms (e. G. , Optimizely, VWO) and consent management platforms
Version Control: Knowledge of Git for managing codebases related to analytics implementations
You share our common values: Trust, because we prefer to speak up and be our true selves; Sense of Ownership, because it’s not worth wasting time on something you don’t believe in; and enthusiasm for Constant Changes, because we are always looking to make things better


We will try to create all the right conditions for you to work and rest comfortably

This offer stands for remote work format. But you are always welcome in our offices, for work or fun times.
Flexible working hours
Unlimited PTO
Flexi Benefit for your hobby
Employee Support Program
Loss of family member financial aid
Employee Resource Groups
Meals, snacks, and drinks at the office
Corporate events
Teambuilding
Training, courses, conferences
Gifts for employees


A Little More About Our Company

Semrush is a leading online visibility management SaaS platform that enables businesses globally to run search engine optimization, pay-per-click, content, social media and competitive research campaigns and get measurable results from online marketing.

We’ve been developing our product for 16 years and have been awarded G2s Top 100 Software Products, Global and US Search Awards 2021, Great Place to Work Certification, Deloitte Technology Fast 500 and many more. In March 2021 Semrush went public and started trading on the NYSE with the SEMR ticker.

10,000,000+ users in America, Europe, Asia, and Australia have already tried Semrush, and over 1,000 people around the world are working on its development. The Semrush team is constantly growing.

Our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion commitments

Semrush is an equal opportunity employer. Building a better future for marketers around the world unites people from all backgrounds. Even if you feel that you don’t 100% match all requirements, don’t be discouraged to apply! We are committed to ensure that everyone feels a sense of belonging in the workplace.

We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, creed, color, national origin, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, ancestry, physical or mental disability, or medical condition including medical characteristics, genetic identity, marital status, military service, or any other classification protected by applicable local, state or federal laws.

Our new colleague, we are waiting for you!

Stanislav (he/him)

Researcher

stanislav.matrosov@semrush.com

4142393609.title: Data Scientist
4142393609.description:
About the job
¿Te apasiona la ciencia de datos y el desarrollo de soluciones analíticas? 👀

➥ Unirte a Innova, es formar parte de una empresa de consultoría líder a nivel nacional y en pleno desarrollo internacional. Si estás interesado en participar en proyectos innovadores de IA, Cloud Computing y Transformación Digital, creemos este es tu lugar. 🤝

En Innova-tsn buscamos incorporar profesionales con 3 años de experiencia en proyectos de ciencia de datos y modelización avanzada, para reforzar nuestro equipo en diferentes sectores como energía, retail, banca y más.

📌 ¿Qué buscamos?

Experiencia como Data Scientist de al menos 3 años en desarrollo y mantenimiento de modelos.
Conocimiento avanzado de técnicas de tratamiento y preparación de datos y analítica descriptiva.
Conocimiento del desarrollo, mantenimiento y monitorización de modelos de Machine Learning (Regresión, Clustering, XGBoost, Random Forest….) y técnicas de Forecasting.
Conocimiento avanzado de los lenguajes Python y R.
Estudios mínimos: Licenciatura/Grado en Matemáticas, Estadística, Ingeniería, Físicas, Económicas…

✅ ...es un plus!
Buen nivel en SAS y PySpark.
Perfil matemático con habilidades técnicas en el entorno de datos.

📈 ¿Qué valoramos?

Máster en Data Science, Machine Learning, Inteligencia Artificial.
Experiencia en Desarrollo de Redes Neuronales en frameworks como Keras, Pytorch, TensorFlow.
Conocimiento/experiencia de algoritmos de Optimización.
Experiencia en el desarrollo en entornos colaborativos (Github, Gitlab).
Experiencia en MLOps.
Conocimiento de LLMs: Técnicas de Prompt Engineering, RAG y Fine tuning.
·Experiencia /certificación en plataformas Cloud (AWS, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud) tanto en el desarrollo como el despliegue de modelos.
Nivel avanzado de inglés.
Habilidad para trabajar en equipo y aportar en entornos colaborativos.

👋 ¿Qué te ofrecemos nosotros?

Contrato indefinido, invertimos y buscamos tu desarrollo a largo plazo.
Formaciones en plataformas e internas, y certificaciones oficiales a cargo de la empresa.
Planes de carrera personalizados, adaptados a tus fortalezas e intereses y basados en evaluaciones de desempeño anuales.
Beneficios sociales: seguro médico de cobertura completa.
Retribución flexible: ticket guardería y ticket restaurant.
Ser parte de un equipo especializado en soluciones empresariales y arquitectura de datos.

En Innova, fomentamos mucho el desarrollo del talento, la creatividad y el trabajo en equipo. Invertimos en espacios, tecnologías y herramientas para que los que componen nuestra compañía profundicen en sus habilidades, exploren nuevas áreas y se sientan una pieza fundamental.

Si estás buscando un lugar donde impulsar y desarrollar tu carrera profesional, únete a nosotros y sé parte de este equipo innovador 🤓

Formaciones en plataformas e internas, y certificaciones oficiales a cargo de la empresa.
Formaciones
Planes de carrera personalizados, adaptados a tus fortalezas e intereses y basados en evaluaciones de desempeño anuales.
Planes de carrera personalizados
Beneficios sociales: seguro médico de cobertura completa.
Retribución flexible: ticket guardería y ticket restaurant.
Ser parte de un equipo especializado en soluciones empresariales y arquitectura de datos.
En Innova, fomentamos mucho el desarrollo del talento, la creatividad y el trabajo en equipo. Invertimos en espacios, tecnologías y herramientas para que los que componen nuestra compañía profundicen en sus habilidades, exploren nuevas áreas y se sientan una pieza fundamental.
Innova
Si estás buscando un lugar donde impulsar y desarrollar tu carrera profesional, únete a nosotros y sé parte de este equipo innovador 🤓

4158302628.title: Consultor/a BI
4158302628.description:
About the job
Grupo Altia es una compañía gallega que fue fundada en 1994. Somos un equipo de más de 3500 grandes profesionales repartidos en más de 20 oficinas en toda España, Portugal, Brasil, Chile, Estados Unidos, Irlanda y Holanda; además de tres Data Centers en Vigo, Madrid y Barcelona.

Somos una compañía de servicios de alto valor de transformación digital que ha emprendido, cambiado y reformulado proyectos internacionales para cerca de un millar de clientes. Altia cotiza en BME Growth desde 2010, el mercado de BME para pymes. Hemos ido creciendo con el paso de los años, posicionándonos con grandes clientes en múltiples sectores.

En los últimos años, se han ido incorporando al grupo diferentes empresas que nos han ayudado a crecer y mejorar: Exis, Noesis, Wairbut y Bilbomática.


¿Qué buscamos?

Actualmente estamos buscando incorporar en nuestro equipo un/a Analista Business Intelligence para un importante cliente dentro del sector público.

Es necesario que la persona que se incorpore tenga al menos 4 años:

- Analista en proyectos de implantación BI.
- Diseño de cuadros de mando e informes en diversas herramientas BI.
- Experiencia en toma de requerimientos y elaboración de documentación
funcional.
- Conocimientos en PowerBI, Tableau, etc.


¿Qué te podemos ofrecer?
🌏 Trabajo híbrido 1 día a la semana - zona Miribilla (Bilbao).
⏰ Flexibilidad horaria. Jornada intensiva en verano.
📜 Contrato Indefinido.
💻 Proyecto estable de alto impacto, con una de las entidades de mayor prestigio de su sector.
💙 Ambiente de trabajo colaborativo, integrándote en un equipo de altamente cualificado.
💵 Retribución Flexible.
📚 Plan de Formación continua.

Si crees que puede encajarte, ¡no dudes en inscribirte! ✍️

4171868010.title: Business Intelligence Analyst
4171868010.description:
About the job
Role; BI Analyst
Salary; Up-to €75,000
Location; Remote in the EU, Europe or Switzerland with occasional travel to Berlin

Brio Digital is supporting a Tech4Good organisation who are looking at developing their internal Data and BI team. We are looking for a skilled BI Analystwho has product management experience to join their team and help turn data into insights that drive strategic decisions.

If SQL, Power BI & Python are all something you can work on in your sleep, apply now!

The Role
As a BI Analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing business data, developing reports and dashboards, and providing actionable insights to key stakeholders. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and translate them into data-driven solutions. If you have experience in product management, that’s a big plus!

Responsibilities
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and data models using Power BI.
Write efficient SQL queries to extract, transform, and analyze data.
Use Python for advanced analytics, automation, or data processing tasks.
Work closely with stakeholders to understand business objectives and deliver meaningful insights.
Identify trends, patterns, and opportunities to improve business performance.
Leverage product management experience to shape data-driven product decisions.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity across all reporting tools.

Requirements
Proven experience as a BI Analyst or in a similar role.
Strong proficiency in SQL, Power BI, and Python.
Ability to interpret complex data and communicate insights effectively.
Experience working with large datasets and data visualization best practices.
Experience in product management or working closely with product teams.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

4160805608.title: Senior Data Scientist
4160805608.description:
About the job
We are growing our data science team to help Tendam solve challenging problems from the retail fashion industry. We are now seeking a Sr. Data Scientist for a unique opportunity to impact the way the world experiences fashion.

What will you do? 

Extract valuable insights from data as well as from cross-functional teams, including e-commerce, logistics, marketing, and others, to gain a comprehensive understanding of business opportunities. Collaborate closely with these departments to align data-driven insights with strategic decisions, identifying key areas for growth, optimization and innovation
Lead and mentor a team of junior data scientists, providing guidance on best practices, methodologies, and tools. Foster a collaborative environment where team members can develop their technical skills, contribute to projects, and continuously improve their problem-solving abilities
Generate insights using statistical techniques and machine learning models that transform raw data into actionable levers for change. These insights will empower the organization to make informed decisions and enhance operational efficiency
Generate insights using statistical techniques and machine learning models that transform raw data into actionable levers for change. These insights will empower the organization to make informed decisions and enhance operational efficiency.
Transform and productionize machine learning models, ensuring their deployment into scalable and robust environments for real-time or batch processing. This includes collaborating with engineering and IT teams to integrate models into existing systems, establishing monitoring and maintenance protocols, and ensuring the models operate efficiently under various conditions. Additionally, focus on optimizing models for performance, implementing version control, and ensuring compliance with best practices in data governance and security.

What are we looking for? 

Business background with strong computational and analytical skills that promotes and end-to-end view of the challenge and considers market, business and client priorities
Strong problem solving skills with emphasis on analyzing issues, identifying causes, and generating hypotheses that allow to generate an MVP solution to start piloting and collecting knowledge to adjust solution
Impact driven mentality that supports an agile way of working where the focus is on evolving solutions
Extensive knowledge and hands-on experience working with big data systems, particularly with PySpark. Proficient in writing and optimizing Spark jobs for performance, and scalable data processing.
In-depth knowledge of a wide range of machine learning techniques, including both supervised and unsupervised learning methods. Experienced in applying algorithms such as regression, classification, decision trees, and ensemble methods for supervised learning, as well as clustering, dimensionality reduction, and anomaly detection for unsupervised learning
Proficient in selecting, implementing, and fine-tuning the appropriate models based on specific business needs and dataset characteristics, ensuring accurate and meaningful predictions.
Experience with AWS tool stack, such as Athena, EMR, Sagemaker, Lambda. Skilled in leveraging these tools to develop scalable, efficient, and cost-effective data and machine learning solutions
Demonstrated proficiency in SQL, including the ability to write complex queries for data extraction, manipulation, and analysis. Experience in working with structured data to help the Data Engineering team with quality and consistency across projects
Highly skilled in using data visualization tools such as Amazon QuickSight, Tableau, Power BI, and Qlik to create clear, impactful visualizations. Capable of transforming complex data into intuitive and interactive dashboards and reports, enabling stakeholders to quickly grasp trends, patterns, and insights.
Collaborative spirit and the ability to communicate complex ideas effectively to both colleagues and stakeholders
Proactive mindset to be able to identify potential risks / blockers and design effective mitigation strategies
A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques

Extra qualifications

Knowledge and/or experience in the fashion retail industry
Experience leading teams

Why coming to Tendam?

One of the largest customer data repositories in industry: more than 20M Club members
Exposure to all kind of business problems across all business departments in a challenging and highly dynamic industry
Building machine learning models for real world problems: have a real impact in the business!
Ability to test and learn in a fast paced environment
Working with cutting edge technologies
Exposure to agile methodologies
A great team!


Las oficinas donde se desarrollará el trabajo se encuentran en Madrid, en la zona norte, accesible en metro y cercanías Renfe, además de autobuses urbanos e interurbanos.
Contamos con un horario flexible, de lunes a jueves entrada entre las 7:30h y las 9:30h y viernes jornada flexible e intensiva, con entrada entre las 7:30h y las 9:30h y salida entre las 13h y las 15h. Modalidad híbrida de trabajo. 
Incorporación inmediata.
Contratación indefinida. 
Salario de fijo + variable. 
Ambiente joven y dinámico.
Uso de tecnologías punteras.

4173571945.title: Analista de datos
4173571945.description:
About the job
¿El reto?
Te apetece unirte al equipo de Mutua Madrileña y formar parte de un proyecto único y en continuo crecimiento?
Buscamos un Analista de Datos para nuestra área de Planificación y Dimensionamiento, afrontando nuevos desafíos en un entorno dinámico y en constante evolución.
Valoramos a personas versátiles, con una actitud proactiva y capacidad para involucrarse tanto en tareas operativas como estratégicas.

¿Qué harás en tu día a día?
Diseño, desarrollo e implementación de procesos ETL adaptados a las necesidades del negocio, permitiendo analizar el comportamiento de actividad en las distintas plataformas.
Creación de informes y herramientas de análisis, facilitando la toma de decisiones mediante reportes automatizados.
Generación de simulaciones de escenarios para el análisis y evaluación de posibles resultados, con sólidos conocimientos en matemáticas y/o estadística.
Optimización de los recursos en las distintas plataformas de la empresa, asegurando la eficiencia y el rendimiento de los sistemas.
Desarrollo de aplicaciones para el monitoreo y control de KPIs del negocio.

¿Qué esperamos de ti?
Buscamos un profesional con Grado en carreras técnicas (Matemáticas, Estadística, Física o Ingeniería).
Experiencia mínima demostrable de al menos tres años en posición similar en otras compañías.
Imprescindible experiencia en el diseño y desarrollo de modelos de datos en SQL.
o Conocimientos en soluciones Microsoft 365, como Excel, Power BI, Power Apps, Power Automate.
Se valorarán conocimientos en Visual Basic y PySpark.

¿Qué te ofrecemos?
Un proyecto empresarial sólido y de futuro.
Posibilidades para formarte y desarrollarte profesionalmente.
Expertos profesionales con los que compartir tu experiencia.
Igualdad de oportunidades para desarrollarte profesionalmente.
Un excelente ambiente de trabajo que refleja en lo que creemos: compañerismo, profesionalidad, resultados y solidaridad.

En Grupo Mutua Madrileña, valoramos la diversidad y creemos en la igualdad de oportunidades para todos. Promovemos un entorno inclusivo donde la equidad salarial y la no discriminación son pilares fundamentales. Si buscas trabajar en una empresa que se compromete a que cada persona se sienta valorada y respetada, ¡nos encantaría conocerte!

4160678024.title: AI Data Scientist
4160678024.description:
About the job
Exciting Opportunity at Insud Pharma: We're Hiring an AI Data Scientist!
Are you passionate about artificial intelligence and data science? Do you want to make a significant impact in the pharmaceutical industry? Join our innovative team at Insud Pharma as an AI Data Scientist and help us revolutionize healthcare with cutting-edge technology.

Want to know more? 👇

INSUD PHARMA operates across the entire pharmaceutical value chain, providing specialized knowledge and experience in scientific research, development, manufacturing, sales, and marketing of a wide range of active pharmaceutical ingredients (API), finished dosage forms (FDF), and branded pharmaceutical products, adding value to human and animal health.

The activities of INSUD PHARMA are organized into three synergistic business areas: Industrial (Chemo), Branded (Exeltis), and Biotech (mAbxience), with over 9,000 professionals in more than 50 countries, 20 state-of-the-art facilities, 15 specialized R&D centers, 12 commercial offices, and more than 35 pharmaceutical subsidiaries, serving 1,150 customers in 96 countries worldwide. INSUD PHARMA believes in innovation and sustainable development.

Ready to be a #Challenger?

What are we looking for? 🔎

We are seeking a highly skilled Data Scientist to join our Applied AI Team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in statistics, machine learning, and data analysis, with experience working in cross-functional teams.

As a Data Scientist at AI Labs, you will be tasked with developing and implementing advanced analytics and machine learning solutions across business units within our company, including Regulatory, Business Intelligence, Clinical Trials, and Drug Manufacturing.

The ideal candidate will be responsible for extracting valuable insights from complex datasets, developing predictive models, and collaborating with engineers and product owners to integrate AI solutions into our products and processes.

The challenge!

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and develop data-driven solutions.
Design and implement machine learning models and statistical analyses to solve complex business problems.
Develop and maintain data pipelines for efficient data processing and model deployment.
Conduct exploratory data analysis to uncover patterns and insights in large datasets.
Create visualizations and reports to communicate findings to technical and non-technical stakeholders.


What do you need?

Proficient in Spanish and English in written and verbal communication.
Strong understanding of statistics, machine learning, and data mining techniques.
Expertise in Python programming, including proficiency with data science libraries (e.g., NumPy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow…).
Strong understanding of data preprocessing, feature engineering, and model evaluation techniques.
Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git) and collaborative development practices.
Proven ability to translate complex technical concepts into clear, actionable insights for non-technical audiences.
Familiarity with software engineering best practices and ability to write clean, maintainable code.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and their machine learning services.
Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Spark, Hadoop) and SQL databases is a plus.
Knowledge of deep learning architecture and natural language processing is beneficial.
Knowledge and experience in causal inference methodologies will be highly valued
Familiarity with Large Language Models (LLMs) and their applications in business contexts is a plus


Our benefits!

⏰ Flexible start time from Monday to Friday
💸 Attractive salary package.
💸 Benefits and Savings Club.
📈 Development plans, internal mobility policy.
⭐ Many more!


What will the Selection process be like? 🕵️

➡️ Stay tuned to your phone and email! The first thing we will likely do is contact you through one of the two channels.

➡️ Prepare well! We will continue with an in-person/virtual interview depending on availability and what we agree upon; there may be one or two interviews in the process, and depending on the type of process, there may also be some kind of test.

➡️ Wait for the result! We care that you feel guided throughout each selection process and know what to expect from us, so we will always try to inform you of the status of the process.

🔷 Do you think this offer is not for you? 🔷

Follow us on social media like LinkedIn/Instagram and stay tuned for any offers we may release; the opportunity to be a new Insuder is waiting!

#InsudPharma #Challenger #Insuder #InsudTalent

COMMITMENT TO EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES

The InsudPharma group is aware that business management must align with the needs and demands of society, and therefore assumes the commitment to equal opportunities and treatment between men and women, as stated in the current regulations on the matter - Organic Law 3/2007, and we do not discriminate against any person on the grounds of ethnicity, religion, age, sex, nationality, marital status, affective or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, or any other personal or social circumstance.
Exciting Opportunity at Insud Pharma: We're Hiring an AI Data Scientist!
Are you passionate about artificial intelligence and data science? Do you want to make a significant impact in the pharmaceutical industry? Join our innovative team at Insud Pharma as an AI Data Scientist and help us revolutionize healthcare with cutting-edge technology.
Want to know more? 👇
Want to know more?
INSUD PHARMA operates across the entire pharmaceutical value chain, providing specialized knowledge and experience in scientific research, development, manufacturing, sales, and marketing of a wide range of active pharmaceutical ingredients (API), finished dosage forms (FDF), and branded pharmaceutical products, adding value to human and animal health.
The activities of INSUD PHARMA are organized into three synergistic business areas: Industrial (Chemo), Branded (Exeltis), and Biotech (mAbxience), with over 9,000 professionals in more than 50 countries, 20 state-of-the-art facilities, 15 specialized R&D centers, 12 commercial offices, and more than 35 pharmaceutical subsidiaries, serving 1,150 customers in 96 countries worldwide. INSUD PHARMA believes in innovation and sustainable development.
Ready to be a #Challenger?
What are we looking for? 🔎
What are we looking for?
We are seeking a highly skilled Data Scientist to join our Applied AI Team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in statistics, machine learning, and data analysis, with experience working in cross-functional teams.
As a Data Scientist at AI Labs, you will be tasked with developing and implementing advanced analytics and machine learning solutions across business units within our company, including Regulatory, Business Intelligence, Clinical Trials, and Drug Manufacturing.
The ideal candidate will be responsible for extracting valuable insights from complex datasets, developing predictive models, and collaborating with engineers and product owners to integrate AI solutions into our products and processes.
The challenge!
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and develop data-driven solutions.
Design and implement machine learning models and statistical analyses to solve complex business problems.
Develop and maintain data pipelines for efficient data processing and model deployment.
Conduct exploratory data analysis to uncover patterns and insights in large datasets.
Create visualizations and reports to communicate findings to technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and develop data-driven solutions.
Design and implement machine learning models and statistical analyses to solve complex business problems.
Develop and maintain data pipelines for efficient data processing and model deployment.
Conduct exploratory data analysis to uncover patterns and insights in large datasets.
Create visualizations and reports to communicate findings to technical and non-technical stakeholders.
What do you need?
Proficient in Spanish and English in written and verbal communication.
Strong understanding of statistics, machine learning, and data mining techniques.
Expertise in Python programming, including proficiency with data science libraries (e.g., NumPy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow…).
Strong understanding of data preprocessing, feature engineering, and model evaluation techniques.
Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git) and collaborative development practices.
Proven ability to translate complex technical concepts into clear, actionable insights for non-technical audiences.
Familiarity with software engineering best practices and ability to write clean, maintainable code.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and their machine learning services.
Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Spark, Hadoop) and SQL databases is a plus.
Knowledge of deep learning architecture and natural language processing is beneficial.
Knowledge and experience in causal inference methodologies will be highly valued
Familiarity with Large Language Models (LLMs) and their applications in business contexts is a plus
