4150425505.location: Pamplona, Chartered Community of Navarre, Spain
4150425505.description:
About the job
Tomorrow is our home.

¡Qué fácil es explorar nuevas ideas en BSH Electrodomésticos! Como grupo líder en la fabricación de electrodomésticos, ideamos soluciones para mejorar la calidad de vida de las personas. Con nuestras marcas Bosch, Siemens y Balay exploramos la tecnología más innovadora, desde el reconocimiento de voz a la inteligencia artificial. Así creamos nuevas experiencias de usuario. Pensamos, prototipamos, construimos y no dejamos de aprender. ¡Únete a nuestro equipo y dale a tu carrera un hogar!

BSH Electrodomésticos España, S.A. | Jornada completa |

Pamplona

Tus funciones

¿Crees Que Ha Llegado El Momento De Hacer Algo Diferente? ¡Entonces Estás En El Lugar Adecuado! Trabajarás En Un Entorno Internacional Apasionante y Contribuirás Personalmente Al Éxito De La Empresa. Te Esperan Proyectos Apasionantes y Tareas Diferentes, Como

Definir y supervisar los estándares de desarrollo, aprobar cambios en objetos de desarrollo e implementar SAP Notes.
Coordinar las operaciones de SAP BW y Datasphere, gestionar el despliegue, la configuración y garantizar la precisión y la seguridad de los datos.
Definir y organizar las actualizaciones y el mantenimiento del sistema, coordinar las pruebas con los equipos de análisis.
Aplicar las políticas de gobernanza, gestionar el acceso de los usuarios y garantizar la preparación para las auditorías de SAP BW y Datasphere.
Actuar como primer contacto con los stakeholders para comprender las necesidades y conexiones de los datos.

Tu perfil

Grado en Ingeniería o similar.
Al menos 2 años de experiencia en Business Intelligence (SAP BW/4HANA).
Experiencia en SAP BW, modelado de datos o cualquier otro producto de análisis de datos.
Experiencia en gestión de operaciones de IT, preferiblemente en SQL o ABAP.
Nivel avanzado de inglés. 

Beneficios

Flexibilidad horaria y posibilidad de teletrabajo (50%).
Descuentos en electrodomésticos BSH y otros beneficios.
Acceso gratuito a nuestra plataforma de aprendizaje online, incluyendo idiomas.
Comida subvencionada.
Autobús de empresa.

Más información

Por favor visita bsh-group.com/career. ¡Te esperamos con los brazos abiertos!

Encuentra Un Nuevo Hogar Para Tu Futuro Profesional

BSH Electrodomésticos España, S.A es el responsable del tratamiento y procesa tus datos personales con el único fin de gestionar tu solicitud de empleo. Si deseas ejercer tus derechos de protección de datos, envía un correo electrónico a Data-Protection-ES@bshg.com.

Your application will also be forwarded to individual employees of the following company for the purpose of filling the position: BSH Ev Aletleri Sanayi ve Ticaret A.Ş. (Turkey).

4175828031.title: Product Analyst
4175828031.description:
About the job
Senior Product Analyst – Contract (Remote, Until End of 2025)

We are looking for a Senior Product Analyst to join our client's team on a contract basis until the end of 2025. This is a fully remote opportunity to work with a dynamic team focused on product development, including websites, apps, and related technologies.

As a key player in a data-driven decision-making process, you will collaborate with product managers, designers, engineers, and business leaders to lead data explorations, A/B tests, hypothesis analysis, and KPI monitoring. Your insights will directly impact strategic initiatives, helping to enhance user experience, drive growth, and optimize product performance.

Key Responsibilities:
Develop a deep analytical understanding of product growth and retention drivers.
Define key performance metrics and monitor product performance.
Partner with stakeholders to drive data-informed decisions.
Design and analyze A/B tests and other experiments to optimize features and business opportunities.
Build and automate dashboards and reports, delivering insights at scale.
Formulate research questions, hypotheses, and appropriate testing methodologies.

Skills & Experience:
6+ years in Product Analytics, Digital Analytics, or Business Intelligence, preferably in e-commerce.
Strong SQL proficiency (BigQuery, Redshift preferred).
Proficiency in Python or R for data analysis and transformation.
Experience with ETL processes and data pipeline automation.
Expertise in user behavior tracking and analytics tools (Google Analytics or similar).
Strong knowledge of A/B testing methodologies and best practices.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.

Preferred:
Experience with quasi-experimental techniques and predictive statistics.
Familiarity with dashboarding tools (Looker, DataStudio, MicroStrategy).
This is an excellent opportunity for a data-driven analyst looking to make an impact in a fast-paced environment. If you have the skills and experience, we’d love to hear from you.

4178189621.title: Data Engineer & Analyst – Digital Advertising
4178189621.description:
About the job
En } ReCodme ( aceleramos el desarrollo tecnológico de nuestros clientes y colaboradores a través de soluciones especializadas, aportando valor en su continuidad y crecimiento.

Creemos en la cercanía con nuestras personas y en el valor añadido que aportan a nuestro equipo y proyectos. ¡Un ReCoder es un aficionado de la tecnología, es [la clave de nuestro éxito], la clave de nuestra Fuerza!

Buscamos un/a Data Engineer & Analyst con experiencia en publicidad digital, modelado de datos e integración de plataformas de gestión de anuncios. El rol implica trabajar con DSPs, ETL en la nube y herramientas de visualización para optimizar estrategias de marketing basadas en datos.

📢 ¿Qué necesitas para ser parte de este proyecto?

Requisitos:
Diseñar y optimizar modelos de datos, dashboards e informes para seguimiento de KPIs publicitarios.
Realizar integraciones de datos con plataformas como Google Ads, Meta, TikTok, LinkedIn y otras herramientas de publicidad digital.
Gestionar la interacción de datos con DSPs (Demand Side Platforms) y plataformas de Big Data.
Desarrollar y mantener pipelines de datos utilizando Python, SQL y herramientas Cloud ETL como Ribery.
Asegurar la correcta integración de datos con Google BigQuery y otras herramientas de analítica.
Supervisar la migración, seguimiento del ROI y normalización de datos en grandes volúmenes de información.
Trabajar con herramientas de visualización como Power BI para mejorar la toma de decisiones basada en datos.

Requisitos:
Experiencia en modelado de datos, reporting y desarrollo de dashboards.
Conocimiento en Power BI para la visualización de datos.
Habilidad en programación con Python y SQL para el desarrollo de integraciones.
Experiencia en integraciones con DSPs y plataformas publicitarias (Meta, Google Ads, TikTok, LinkedIn, etc.).
Experiencia en ETL en la nube con herramientas como Ribery y BigQuery.
Capacidad para analizar grandes volúmenes de datos y generar insights accionables.

Modalidad de Trabajo:
Híbrido en Madrid.

¿Listo para esta fuerza? ¡Envíanos tu candidatura!

En Recodme, defendemos la igualdad y valoramos la diversidad. Creemos en un entorno seguro e inclusivo, donde todas las oportunidades son equitativas para nuestros colaboradores.
No discriminamos por edad, etnia, orientación sexual, género, discapacidad ni ningún otro factor no relacionado con el mérito.

¡Todas las candidaturas que cumplan con los requisitos son bienvenidas!

4149910491.title: Business Data Analyst & Forecasting
4149910491.description:
About the job
Buscamos un especialista en Business Intelligence y Market Excellence para el sector farmacéutico, con sólidas habilidades en análisis de datos y una visión estratégica orientada a análisis y gestión de proyectos. Además, actuará como Local Demand Planner para Iberia aportando así mucha visibilidad y responsabilidad.

FUNCIONES
Análisis de datos y generación de insights: Diseñar análisis avanzados, crear dashboards en herramientas de BI (Tableau, Power BI) y aplicar machine learning para identificar oportunidades de negocio y optimizar estrategias.
Market Excellence: Colaborar con marketing y ventas para desarrollar estrategias basadas en datos, liderar segmentación de clientes, análisis de mercado y benchmarking competitivo.
Integración y gestión de datos: Gestionar grandes volúmenes de datos de múltiples fuentes, garantizando calidad y precisión, e implementar soluciones innovadoras en entornos complejos.
Local Demand Planner: Coordinar el proceso de planificación de la demanda y rolling forecast mensual, asegurando la colaboración transversal entre los departamentos de Marketing, Ventas, Supply y Finanzas para garantizar la precisión y alineación en las proyecciones.
Apoyo estratégico: Proporcionar soporte analítico para decisiones comerciales, identificar tendencias de mercado y participar en reuniones para alinear objetivos.
Gestión de riesgos: Identificar riesgos en la cadena de suministro y proponer estrategias de mitigación ante factores externos o cambios en la demanda.
Promover y colaborar en la implementación de iniciativas vinculadas a analítica avanzada y herramientas de inteligencia artificial.

REQUISITIOS
Grado en Estadística, Matemáticas, Economía, Ingeniería, Ciencias de la Salud o similar.
Valorable Master/Postgrado en BI, Marketing Farmacéutico o Data Science.
Mínimo 4-5 años de experiencia en BI, análisis de datos o roles similares, en el sector farmacéutico.
Experiencia en Market Access, Market Intelligence o áreas comerciales en sector farmacéutico.
Experiencia en previsión o estimación de la demanda.
Inglés C1.
Excel avanzado.
Dominio de herramientas de BI (Power BI, Tableau, QlikView).
Valorable Conocimiento de Phyton, SQL, Azure, Databricks, R, Azure Machine Learning.
Buscamos un especialista en Business Intelligence y Market Excellence para el sector farmacéutico, con sólidas habilidades en análisis de datos y una visión estratégica orientada a análisis y gestión de proyectos. Además, actuará como Local Demand Planner para Iberia aportando así mucha visibilidad y responsabilidad.
FUNCIONES
Análisis de datos y generación de insights: Diseñar análisis avanzados, crear dashboards en herramientas de BI (Tableau, Power BI) y aplicar machine learning para identificar oportunidades de negocio y optimizar estrategias.
Market Excellence: Colaborar con marketing y ventas para desarrollar estrategias basadas en datos, liderar segmentación de clientes, análisis de mercado y benchmarking competitivo.
Integración y gestión de datos: Gestionar grandes volúmenes de datos de múltiples fuentes, garantizando calidad y precisión, e implementar soluciones innovadoras en entornos complejos.
Local Demand Planner: Coordinar el proceso de planificación de la demanda y rolling forecast mensual, asegurando la colaboración transversal entre los departamentos de Marketing, Ventas, Supply y Finanzas para garantizar la precisión y alineación en las proyecciones.
Apoyo estratégico: Proporcionar soporte analítico para decisiones comerciales, identificar tendencias de mercado y participar en reuniones para alinear objetivos.
Gestión de riesgos: Identificar riesgos en la cadena de suministro y proponer estrategias de mitigación ante factores externos o cambios en la demanda.
Promover y colaborar en la implementación de iniciativas vinculadas a analítica avanzada y herramientas de inteligencia artificial.

4159097774.title: Senior Data Analyst
4159097774.description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
About BLING

We are building ethical technology to break the vicious circle of everyday financial stress for 150M Europeans.

In June 2020 we launched the first free 100 cash advance (with an optional 7 instant transfer) offering an alternative to expensive overdrafts. When we ceased operations in April 2022 following a regulatory change we had gathered 1.2 million registered users to whom we had granted more than 1 million cash advances for a total of 61 million.

Last year with the trust and support of our community we returned with an even more powerful product an account a debit card tools to control your finances and no hidden fees. We recently brought back the cash advance feature with the aim to help everyone who wants to deal with their short-term financing needs and look forward with a greater peace of mind.

Tasks

We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst in Barcelona to strengthen our Data team in a product-led B2C tech startup.

You will collaborate on projects at the intersection of analytics data modeling and visualization to drive key business decisions while ensuring data is a critical asset throughout the company.

Key Responsibilities

 Advanced Data Analysis Conduct in-depth analyses to support business and product decisions including A/B tests and ad-hoc data investigations.
 Stakeholder Communication Translate complex data insights into easily digestible information for key teams including Product and Marketing.
 KPI Management Data Quality Maintain KPIs ensure data accuracy and apply best practices to safeguard the integrity of reports and dashboards.
 Data Accessibility Facilitate data access across the organization by building self-service tools and training stakeholders.

Requirements

Technical Skills

You will need to be a queen or king of SQL plus meet the following requirements

 Have 4+ years of experience in product analytics
 Experience with data warehousing or data modeling (eg. Kimball Data Vault OBT)
 Experience with at least one visualization tool (eg Metabase Tableau Power BI Looker )
 Experience with AB tests
 You have worked in technical B2C startups or scaleups with a product and user-lifecycle focus
 Demonstrate strong analytical skills and the ability to solve complex problems using data
 Be fluent in English
 Be fluent in at least one programming language (eg. Python).
 Believe in the importance of documentation as a core part of any programming discipline.
 Bonus Points
 Familiarity with Docker cloud providers (AWS) data engineering techniques and fluency in French or Spanish
 Experience with MongoDB and PostgreSQL

What Makes You a Good Fit

 Data Passion Strong interest in making data accessible for non-technical stakeholders.
 Proactivity Collaboration Enjoy working in fast-paced collaborative environments and promoting data-driven decision-making.
 Technical Expertise Expertise in SQL data modeling and problem-solving using data.

Benefits

 Competitive salary
 Employee benefits healthcare meal tickets
 Possibility of remote work
 Team events

What We Offer

 Technical Challenges Engage with diverse data streams transforming raw data into meaningful insights.
 Ownership Autonomy Take full ownership of your projects and experiment with new approaches.
 Purpose-Driven Mission Contribute to a product that has a real objective to help people in a meaningful way.
 Collaborative Startup Culture Join an open-minded and agile team where your contributions are valued.

If you are passionate about data analytics and thrive in a fast-paced environment we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

SQL, Tableau, Power BI

4104386100.title: Data Analyst (Madrid)
4104386100.description:
About the job
¿De qué va la empresa en la que trabajarás? 

Somos Slashmobility una empresa boutique especializada en transformación digital y comprometida con las personas. Nuestro propósito se centra en acompañar a nuestros clientes en su impulso a la aceleración digital tecnológica a través de las apps y el talento IT.

Con +14 años de experiencia, un equipo comprometido, +500 proyectos ejecutados con éxito, hemos acompañado a centenares de clientes líderes en su sector desde la confianza, flexibilidad y solidez a enfrentarse a los desafíos de la aceleración digital de la sociedad.

¿Y qué nos hace especiales? 

Nos basamos en cuatro valores fundamentales:

Innovación, ofreciendo soluciones innovadoras de una manera profesional y rentable con un valor diferencial: el conocimiento experto en toda la cadena de valor.
Compromiso ya que llevamos como propios los objetivos de la organización y superamos cualquier obstáculo para lograrlos.
Proactividad, proveyendo y realizando acciones para mejorar sus servicios y calidad.
Trabajo en equipo, contando con un equipo motivado y multidisciplinar que trabaja en perfecta coordinación para lograr los objetivos comunes.


Requisitos:

Para proyecto estable se requiere un perfil DATA ANALYST.

¿Cuáles son los REQUISITOS clave para este puesto?

SAS
Excel
Librerias Python, R.
BDD SQL.


IDIOMAS: Inglés intermedio o avanzado.

¿Qué podemos ofrecerte?

Contrato indefinido.
Modalidad de trabajo: Híbrida (Madrid)
Proyecto Estable.
Expectativas salariales: según la experiencia demostrada.

4143290510.title: Experienced Data Analyst - Consumer App (m/f/d)
4143290510.description:
About the job
Your Tasks

Engage in continuous requirements engineering and consulting with product teams to implement data analytics projects. 
Design and execute ETL architecture. 
Define key performance indicators, identify data sources, retrieve data via SQL, and establish dynamic reports and dashboards. 
Develop, document, and enhance web tracking concepts in collaboration with app developers and data analysts. 
Conduct proactive analyses to identify areas for improvement in apps, components, and online product areas. 
Evaluate the effectiveness of improvements through A/B/n testing. 
Implement new tracking concepts for apps and components. 

Your Profile

Master's degree in a technical, data, or mathematical-related field (e.g., statistics, physics, engineering sciences, industrial computer sciences). 
3-5 years of experience as a Data Analyst/Web/App Analyst, preferably in ecommerce companies. 
Proficiency in SQL, with practical experience in Google BigQuery or similar data warehouse/data lake systems. 
Extensive experience in defining and implementing tracking concepts within hybrid app solutions, especially Google Analytics 3 and 4. 
Familiarity with ETL services and server-side tracking implementation is advantageous. 
Expertise in standard BI reporting tools (Tableau, Google Data Studio, PowerBI, Qlik, SAP Business Object) for data visualization. 
Demonstrated knowledge of statistical methods and principles (e.g., A/B/N testing, regression analysis), experience with Firebase is a plus. 
Very good command of English; knowledge of German is a bonus. 

About Us

MediaMarktSaturn is Europe’s leading consumer electronics retailer. It sees itself as a partner, daily companion and navigator for its customers in the digital world. Its over 1,000 MediaMarkt and Saturn stores are closely integrated with their online shops. MediaMarktSaturn has a total headcount of more than 60,000.

MediaMarktSaturn Technology is working on making Europe's number one consumer electronics retailer the technology leader in its sector. To this end, several hundred developers, UX designers and system architects using state-of-the-art technology work hand in hand with business owners in agile teams to develop customer-focused technology solutions for more than 6 million customers every day in 11 countries.

Technology Hub located in Barcelona, is one of the service units of MediaMarktSaturn Technology to deliver adequate staffing and engineering skills for the agreed deliveries of the global deployment plan for the entire group.

Additional Benefits

Young environment, where not everything is written in stone, and where you are expected to contribute and co-create the culture of the Tech Hub and international collaboration model
You'll have a 10% discount on the entire MediaMarkt website, so you can treat yourself at a lower price whenever you want!
On top of your compensation package, you can request Flexible Pay “MediaFlex program” (a.e. Ticket Restaurant, Private Health Insurance with DKV, …)
Flexible working time and possibility to combine home office / presential working. Intensive workday every Friday and during summer
The possibility to choose between 2 offices: The first one is the MediaMarkt Iberia HQ with a very attractive menu at a price. You'll eat for less than €4! And the second office is located at Pier01, in Barceloneta, right in the center of Barcelona. Free coffee and free fruit once a week
If you need a VISA, don't worry, we'll assist you with the visa process and accompany you throughout the entire process!
There is a training budget so you can continue developing the skills you need most to keep growing professionally and personally!
We offer language classes: English, Spanish, and German
On your birthday, you won't work! It's a day for you to enjoy without thinking about work
You'll be working with the most cutting-edge technological stack of the moment

Job Infos

Location: Barcelona, El Prat De Llobregat

Media Markt Saturn Th Services Barcelona

Department: HQ - IT

Entrylevel: Professional Level

Type of Employement: Full Time

Working Hours: 40

Persona: Job Requisition Tech Employee

Recruiter: Joaquin Pardo

Recruiter: Joaquin Pardo Muro

4151319721.title: Online Data Analyst
4151319721.description:
About the job
Online Data Analyst - Spanish (ES)


Job Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:
In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community
Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.

Qualification Path:
No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.

Basic Requirements
Full Professional Proficiency in Spanish and English
Being a resident in Spain for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Spain
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

Assessment:
In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

Equal Opportunity
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

4151249423.title: Analytics Senior Analyst
4151249423.description:
About the job
Position Overview

Details of the role and how it fits into the team

As Analytics Senior Analyst you will be a member of our Data Analytics Center of Excellence (CoE) for Group Audit. You will pioneer and support Group Audit in implementing innovative and effective analytics processes that are critical to the success of our audit function. Based in the Madrid office, you will work embedded in audit teams around the world, applying the latest analytics technologies while connecting with the central team in Germany to leverage our core analytics solutions. You will be responsible for supporting all Group Audit functions with data analytics services and audit automation solutions.

Responsibilities

Evaluate and provide analytics solutions to auditors to identify potential risk, anomalies, detect outliers and identify weaknesses in control activities using analytical tools like SQL and Python.
Collaborate closely with auditors, data owner and subject matter experts to understand business requirement and translate them into analytical solution in an agile and iterative manner.
Communicate findings and insights to stakeholders including Senior Management that support informed decision-making process and effectively drive business strategy.
Proactively identify automation opportunities and develop solutions that simplify audit processes and make Group Audit more efficient.
Drive innovation across Group Audit, leveraging the experience gained and data collected from successful data analytics projects.


Skills

Master’s or bachelor’s degree (or equivalent – PhD appreciated) from an accredited college or university (or equivalent) in a quantitative field (Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Engineering, Computer Science, Economics, etc.) or equivalent work experience with at least 5 years of relevant experience.
Proficiency in SQL and Python for data analysis as well as in reporting and visualization with hands-on experience in ETL and datawarehouse, Hadoop, Hive/Impala as well as familiarity with GCP services and tools, OpenShift, CDSW,
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to convey complex information in clear and concise manner to Senior Management, Audit committees and other stakeholder.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skill to interpret complex data and derive actionable insights.
A creative technologist passionate about data and information with an intrinsic motivation and curious to learn new technologies and frameworks to adopt data analytics for new ways of auditing.


Well-being & Benefits

A healthy, engaged and well-supported workforce are better equipped to do their best work and, more importantly, enjoy their lives inside and outside the workplace. That’s why we are committed to providing an environment with your development and wellbeing at its center. 

Emotionally and mentally balanced: We support you in dealing with life crises, maintaining stability through illness, and maintaining good mental health. Benefit from initiatives such as counseling and support in difficult life situations and a culture where you can openly speak about mental health.
Physically thriving: We support you managing your physical health by taking appropriate preventive measures and providing a workplace that helps you thrive. For example, discount in gyms, annual medical check up's, standing desks, ...
Socially connected: We strongly believe in collaboration, inclusion and feeling connected to open up new perspectives and strengthen our self confidence and well being. Benefits vary from different types of paid and unpaid leave, hybrid model of remote working (for some positions …)
Financially secure: We support you to meet personal financial goals during your active career and for the future. Benefit from meal allowance, pension contribution plans, banking services for employees, flex compensation program...


We strive for a culture in which we are empowered to excel together every day. This includes acting responsibly, thinking commercially, taking initiative and working collaboratively.

Together we share and celebrate the successes of our people. Together we are Deutsche Bank Group.

We welcome applications from all people and promote a positive, fair and inclusive work environment.
Position Overview
Details of the role and how it fits into the team
Responsibilities
Evaluate and provide analytics solutions to auditors to identify potential risk, anomalies, detect outliers and identify weaknesses in control activities using analytical tools like SQL and Python.
Collaborate closely with auditors, data owner and subject matter experts to understand business requirement and translate them into analytical solution in an agile and iterative manner.
Communicate findings and insights to stakeholders including Senior Management that support informed decision-making process and effectively drive business strategy.
Proactively identify automation opportunities and develop solutions that simplify audit processes and make Group Audit more efficient.
Drive innovation across Group Audit, leveraging the experience gained and data collected from successful data analytics projects.

4128202410.title: Senior Marketing Data Analyst
4128202410.description:
About the job
Carry1st is Africa's leading publisher of mobile games and digital content. Operating at the intersection of games, publishing, and fintech, we scale awesome content in frontier markets by solving hard problems. Across our publishing and Pay1st business lines, we are partnered with top global game companies like Riot Games, Activision, and Stillfront. We are backed by top investors like: a16z, Bitkraft, Google, Konvoy, Riot Games, Sony and Nas.

As a Senior Marketing Data Analyst you will generate insights into our players and our acquisition campaigns, leading to strategic recommendations and operational optimisations that drive cost efficient acquisition of high-valued customers.

You will...

Insights & Optimisation: Utilise advanced analytics to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities, translating these into strategic recommendations and/or operational optimisation
Business Needs to Analytical Solutions: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to translate business questions & hypotheses into structured analysis, defining key metrics to track success
Reporting: Develop, operationalise, and maintain dashboards & automated reports - to visualise key performance indicators for senior management and to aid operational decisioning for marketing teams
Experimentation: Design and evaluate A/B tests to validate hypotheses, using deep dives and segmentations to further guide the UA roadmap
Data Management: Ensure data accuracy and integrity, establishing best practices where there is no single source of truth


Requirements

What makes you a great candidate?

Strong understanding of the mobile advertising space - networks, bidding systems, & algorithms - and fluent with the key funnel metrics - CTR, CVR, CPI, ARPU, Retention, LTV
Fluent in SQL. Proficiency in Tableau and Python pluses
Strong analytical skills backed by statistical fundamentals
Strong problem solving acumen backed by the ability to tackle ambiguity
Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work cross-functionally with Marketing, Product, and Data teams


Benefits

What will it be like to work at Carry1st?

Carry1st is a fast-paced and dynamic place to work. Our team is diverse and global as we operate fully-remotely across 25+ countries. At Carry1st, you will have the opportunity to...

Build awesome, industry-changing products, every day
Grow with a VC-backed startup at the intersection of gaming and fintech
Work from anywhere in the world with international teammates
Own shares in the Company - enabling you to benefit from the value you create 


Some Additional Perks...

Co-working excursions: Travel to meet your colleagues in cities around the world
Awesome equipment: Get everything you need to work effectively 
Remote working allowance: Put an additional $600 / year to optimise your WFH experience
Learning and development: Attend courses, conferences and training events
Social events: Participate in regular company events to relax and connect with teammates
Birthday leave: Enjoy a paid day off on your special day 

We hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just because it's the right thing to do, but because it makes our company stronger. Join us!

Learn More About Carry1st...

 Andreessen Horowitz shared why they invested in Carry1st
 VentureBeat announced that Carry1st has raised $27 million to develop and publish mobile games in Africa
 Remerge hosted Cordel on a podcast to discuss Carry1st and the African gaming market

3622215989.title: Tableau Senior Consultant
3622215989.description:
About the job
¡Hola, Data Lover! 💙

¿Quieres llevar tus habilidades en Data, Analytics & IA al siguiente nivel? 🚀.

Somos líderes globales, trabajamos con la mitad del IBEX-35 y no paramos de crecer desde 1994.

Si te apasionan los datos, ¡únete a nosotrxs! ✨📊 


 ¿Cuál será tu misión?✍

Participarás en el análisis funcional de los proyectos, lo que te permitirá entender el negocio y tener una visión global y mayor conocimiento de los clientes.
Realizarás una visualización previa del cuadro de mando para indicar los pasos a seguir de cara al diseño del mismo.
Tendrás un mayor posicionamiento de cara al cliente con constante interlocución y dando soluciones a sus necesidades.
Te encargarás de la formación de usuarios con el fin de que el cliente sepa interpretar los datos de la mejor manera posible.
Te mantendrás actualizadx en las últimas tendencias tecnológicas en el ámbito de Data & Analytics para poder ofrecer las mejores soluciones a nuestros clientes
 
¿Qué te hará triunfar en esta posición?👇

Contar de 2 a 5 años de experiencia trabajando con herramientas de visualización, ETL (modelado del dato) y BBDD SQL ya que son la base de todos los proyectos en los que estarás involucrado.
Experiencia específica en Tableau en lo que se refiere al desarrollo de cuadros de mando.
Estudios en Ingeniería Informática, Telecomunicaciones, Ciencia de datos, Industriales, o contar con un Ciclo Superior u otra salida académica que te haya dotado de capacidad de desarrollo y pensamiento crítico en este ambiente.
Valoraremos muy positivamente formación adicional en Analytics, Big Data, o alguna disciplina similar.
Buenas habilidades comunicativas ya qué, poco a poco, irás ganando peso en la parte funcional y en el trato con cliente.
Que seas capaz de trabajar con autonomía y que puedas gestionar tu propio tiempo de la manera más efectiva posible, también, que seas capaz de organizar a otros compañerxs ya que queremos que vayas ganando más responsabilidad.
Como trabajamos en un entorno global, ¡será un plus que puedas comunicarte en inglés! 


🚀 ¿Qué nos hace únicxs?

Aquí no somos una empresa más... ¡somos un equipo que va a por todas! 💡✨

🔹 La tecnología y los datos son nuestra esencia. No solo trabajamos con lo último del mercado, sino que te formaremos para que domines las herramientas más innovadoras. Contamos con un área de innovación donde exploramos nuevas alianzas con gigantes tecnológicos y centros de I+D.

🔹 Tú marcas el ritmo. Olvídate de estructuras rígidas. Cada semestre, te sentarás con tu responsable para hablar de tus logros, nuevos retos y… ¡ajustes salariales en base a resultados!

🔹 Desde el minuto 1, serás parte de nuestra familia. Aquí nadie camina solx. Siempre habrá un compañerx dispuesto a ayudarte. 🤝😃

🔹 Aprenderás de lxs mejores. Te codearás con cracks del sector (tanto técnicos como de negocio), que estarán encantadxs de compartir su conocimiento y celebrar tu crecimiento. 📈🔥

🔹 Somos una empresa con propósito. Creemos en la diversidad y la inclusión como motores de la creatividad, lo que nos permite superar cualquier desafío. 🌍💜

📌 Y, por si fuera poco…

✅ Contrato indefinido (¡queremos que te quedes mucho tiempo!)
✅ Jornada intensiva en julio y agosto 🏖️
✅ Salario competitivo según tu formación y experiencia
✅ Apoyo económico para el teletrabajo 💻🏡


Si buscas un lugar donde crecer, innovar y sentirte parte de algo grande… ¡este es tu sitio! 🚀💥

4148790569.title: Senior ML/NLP Researcher
4148790569.description:
About the job
About us
At RavenPack, we are at the forefront of developing the next generation of generative AI tools for the finance industry and beyond. With 20 years of experience as a leading big data analytics provider for financial services, we empower our clients—including some of the world's most successful hedge funds, banks, and asset managers—to enhance returns, reduce risk, and increase efficiency by integrating public information into their models and workflows. Building on this expertise, we are now launching a new suite of GenAI and SaaS services, designed specifically for financial professionals.

Join a Company that is Powering the Future of Finance with AI

RavenPack has been recognized as the Best Alternative Data Provider by WatersTechnology and has been included in this year’s Top 100 Next Unicorns by Viva Technology. You will be working on Bigdata.com, a next-generation platform aimed at transforming financial decision-making.

Only candidates with EU legal working status will be considered

We’re looking for

RavenPack is searching for a Senior ML/NLP Researcher to join our Data Solutions Research Team at our Spanish headquarters. We offer competitive compensation and a fun working environment. Please note that this role is based in Marbella. Relocation assistance is available.

As a ML/NLP Researcher you will play a key role creating innovative data products, both supporting internal processes and by engaging directly with clients as part of the product discovery process, allowing you to gather feedback and iterate on development to deliver impactful solutions.
The ability to communicate effectively in English both in writing and verbally is a must.
European legal working status is required.

Your Responsibilities:
Collaborate with a team of dedicated professionals to develop data-driven solutions that directly enhance our external products as well as the internal tools and processes that improve the efficiency and effectiveness of those.
Apply your expertise to tackle real-world challenges, demonstrating the benefits of systematic, data-driven processes. These can range from optimizing systematic processes for curating and maintaining our Knowledge Graphs, and enhancing document contextualization for improved retrieval, to fine-tuning large language models (LLMs) for specialized tasks, and coordinating various agents within LLM-driven workflows, among other possibilities.
Stay informed about industry trends and advancements in Machine Learning (ML) and Natural Language Processing (NLP) to ensure our solutions remain competitive and relevant.

What We're Looking For:
A Master’s or PhD in a relevant field, with practical, hands-on experience in Natural Language Processing (NLP) and a strong understanding of state-of-the-art language models.
5+ years of industry experience, contributing to business growth.
Exceptional quantitative, analytical, and problem-solving skills, with a proven ability to apply logical and mathematical reasoning to a variety of challenges.
Experience using deep learning frameworks (Pytorch, HuggingFace..).
Familiarity with machine learning algorithms and statistical models for time series forecasting.
A clear and precise communicator who thrives in collaborative environments, working effectively with colleagues from diverse backgrounds and areas of expertise.
Strong programming experience in Python and familiarity with SQL or other database languages.

Desired Skills:
A proven track record of contributing to original research, with a comfort level in exploring new and uncharted areas while maintaining clarity of purpose.
Experience in building and coordinating various LLM agents to enhance complex workflows.
Strong project management skills, ensuring efficient execution and timely delivery of data projects.
Ideal candidates would have some financial domain expertise.

What's in it for You?
International Culture: With its headquarters in Marbella, Spain, and presence in New York and London, RavenPack takes pride in being a truly diverse global organization.
Competitive Salary: In RavenPack, we believe that your time and experience needs to be fairly rewarded.
Continuous learning: We provide the support needed to grow within the team.
Innovation: Innovation is the key to our success, so we encourage you to speak up and tell us about your vision.
Hybrid work arrangement
Shuttle bus: From Malaga, Fuengirola, La Riviera, and Estepona is available for free from the company.
Diversity is in our DNA! You will work in an international environment (over 29 nationalities and 24 languages spoken!)


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
About us
At RavenPack, we are at the forefront of developing the next generation of generative AI tools for the finance industry and beyond. With 20 years of experience as a leading big data analytics provider for financial services, we empower our clients—including some of the world's most successful hedge funds, banks, and asset managers—to enhance returns, reduce risk, and increase efficiency by integrating public information into their models and workflows. Building on this expertise, we are now launching a new suite of GenAI and SaaS services, designed specifically for financial professionals.

Your Responsibilities:
Collaborate with a team of dedicated professionals to develop data-driven solutions that directly enhance our external products as well as the internal tools and processes that improve the efficiency and effectiveness of those.
Apply your expertise to tackle real-world challenges, demonstrating the benefits of systematic, data-driven processes. These can range from optimizing systematic processes for curating and maintaining our Knowledge Graphs, and enhancing document contextualization for improved retrieval, to fine-tuning large language models (LLMs) for specialized tasks, and coordinating various agents within LLM-driven workflows, among other possibilities.
Stay informed about industry trends and advancements in Machine Learning (ML) and Natural Language Processing (NLP) to ensure our solutions remain competitive and relevant.

Familiarity with machine learning algorithms and statistical models for time series forecasting.
A clear and precise communicator who thrives in collaborative environments, working effectively with colleagues from diverse backgrounds and areas of expertise.

4146117169.title: Product Analyst (Data team)
4146117169.description:
About the job
About us:

Planner 5D is a global hub for home design, uniting over 100+ million users in 230 territories around our planet (yes, we have 2 users connecting from Antarctica each month!). Our platform simplifies the home renovation process from concept to execution, and this process has never been more straightforward with our cutting-edge software. You don't need to be a professional designer to enhance your home or workspace. We are dedicated to streamlining the design experience, making the customization of dream homes accessible to everyone.

Our cross-platform presence spans Web, iOS, Android, Windows, and MacOS, ensuring seamless synchronization for our users. Planner 5D is more than just software; it's a vibrant community of enthusiastic and product-oriented professionals. From diverse backgrounds, our team collaborates across time zones, fueled by a shared passion to revolutionize the home design market.

We are constantly looking for like-minded talent eager to take ownership and drive innovation within our expanding suite of tools. Join us in shaping the future of home design.

The Senior Product Analyst will play a critical role in driving data-informed decision-making and product optimization.

Key responsibilities include:

Tracking Events Design and Specification: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and specify tracking events that capture user behavior and product interactions
Tracking Events Delivery and Quality Management: Ensure accurate and timely delivery of tracking events and maintain high data quality standards
Definitions of Features and Connected Tracking Events: Clearly define product features and their associated tracking events to enable comprehensive analysis
Product and Feature Usage Metrics and KPIs: Develop and monitor key metrics and KPIs to measure product and feature performance
Framework for Feature Usage Analysis and Insights: Create a framework for analyzing feature usage and generating actionable insights
Overall Product Growth Metrics and Analysis: Track and analyze overall product growth metrics to identify trends and opportunities
A/B Test Framework for Continuous Improvements: Implement and manage an A/B testing framework to facilitate data-driven experimentation and optimization
Hypothesis and Experiments Documentation, Delivery, and Analysis: Document hypotheses, design and execute experiments, and analyze results to validate assumptions and inform product decisions
Conduct Quantitative and Qualitative Product Research: Utilize both quantitative and qualitative research methods to gain a deep understanding of user needs and behaviors
Use AI Tools and Approaches for Product Analysis: Leverage AI tools and techniques to enhance product analysis and uncover valuable insights


Qualifications:

Strong Analytical Skills: Proven ability to collect, analyze, and interpret complex data sets
Product Development Knowledge: Familiarity with product development processes and methodologies
Technical Proficiency: Experience with data analysis tools such as BigQuery, Looker Data Studio, and product analytics platforms like Amplitude, Devtodev, Mixpanel, or other modern tools and frameworks
AI and Machine Learning Experience: Knowledge of AI and machine learning techniques and their application in product analysis
Communication and Collaboration: Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively across teams
Problem-Solving and Critical Thinking: Strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills, with a data-driven approach to decision-making
Education: Bachelor's or Master's degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering) or equivalent experience


Key Skills:

Data Analysis
Product Analytics
SQL
BigQuery
Looker Data Studio
A/B Testing
Experimentation
AI and Machine Learning
Communication
Collaboration
Problem-Solving


Additional Skills:

Knowledge of data visualization tools
Statistical modeling expertise


What we offer:

 Great work environment that balances freedom and responsibility
 Our team is made up of friendly and passionate enthusiasts who are eager to help and share their knowledge
 We believe in work-life balance, so you'll receive around 30+ days of paid holidays per year
 Company computer equipment by request
 Education courses for our team members, and we're willing to allocate funds toward your training expenses
 English classes on our corporate platform
 Offline company events in Lithuania and online team-building
 Unlimited free Planner5D subscriptions

4176505607.title: Online Data Analyst
4176505607.location: Pamplona, Chartered Community of Navarre, Spain
4176505607.description:
About the job
Online Data Analyst - Spanish (ES)


Job Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:
In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community
Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.

Qualification Path:
No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.

Basic Requirements
Full Professional Proficiency in Spanish and English
Being a resident in Spain for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Spain
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

Assessment:
In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

Equal Opportunity
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

4175134422.title: Senior Data Analyst - AWS Cloud
4175134422.description:
About the job
Position Summary:
We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to spearhead the development of our data analytics operations. As the first Data Analyst at our company, you will work closely with engineering, product, and leadership teams to build a data-driven culture. You will be responsible for leveraging our newly established AWS data lake to provide actionable insights, establish data governance, and help shape the future of analytics in our organization.

Key Responsibilities:
Lead the development of data analytics initiatives, focusing on creating meaningful insights for business units.
Utilize the AWS data lake to gather, process, and analyze large datasets, ensuring data is accessible, accurate, and actionable.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and develop metrics, reports, and dashboards that drive decision-making.
Define and implement data governance practices, ensuring data integrity and security.
Develop automated reporting systems and scalable analytics processes.
Serve as the subject matter expert for data analytics within the organization.
Mentor and train other employees on best practices in data analytics, visualization, and reporting.

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in a related field (Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, etc.) or equivalent work experience.
5+ years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar analytical role, preferably in a fast-growing tech environment.
Proven expertise in building and managing data lakes, with hands-on experience in AWS (S3, Athena, Redshift, Glue).
Strong proficiency in SQL, data visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI), and experience with Python or R.
Demonstrated experience in establishing data governance frameworks and ensuring data quality.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to explain complex data to non-technical stakeholders.

Preferred Skills:
Experience in designing ETL pipelines and working with big data technologies.
Familiarity with machine learning techniques and predictive analytics.

4167018459.title: Senior Marketing Data Analyst
4167018459.description:
About the job
Carry1st is Africa’s leading publisher of mobile games and digital content. Operating at the intersection of games, publishing, and fintech, we scale awesome content in frontier markets by solving hard problems.
Across our publishing and Pay1st business lines, we are partnered with top global game companies like Riot Games, Activision, and Stillfront. We are backed by top investors like: a16z, Bitkraft, Google, Konvoy, Riot Games, Sony and Nas.

As a Sr Marketing Data Analyst you will generate insights into our players and our acquisition campaigns, leading to strategic recommendations and operational optimisations that drive cost efficient acquisition of high-valued customers.

You will...
Insights & Optimisation: Utilise advanced analytics to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities, translating these into strategic recommendations and/or operational optimisation
Business Needs to Analytical Solutions: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to translate business questions & hypotheses into structured analysis, defining key metrics to track success.
Reporting: Develop, operationalise, and maintain dashboards & automated reports - to visualise key performance indicators for senior management and to aid operational decisioning for marketing teams
Experimentation: Design and evaluate A/B tests to validate hypotheses, using deep dives and segmentations to further guide the UA roadmap.
Data Management: Ensure data accuracy and integrity, establishing best practices where there is no single source of truth.

What makes you a great candidate?
Strong understanding of the mobile advertising space - networks, bidding systems, & algorithms - and fluent with the key funnel metrics - CTR, CVR, CPI, ARPU, Retention, LTV
Fluent in SQL. Proficiency in Tableau and Python pluses.
Strong analytical skills backed by statistical fundamentals
Strong problem solving acumen backed by the ability to tackle ambiguity
Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work cross-functionally with Marketing, Product, and Data teams

What will it be like to work at Carry1st?
Carry1st is a fast-paced and dynamic place to work. Our team is diverse and global as we operate fully-remotely across 25+ countries. At Carry1st, you will have the opportunity to…
Build awesome, industry-changing products, every day
Grow with a VC-backed startup at the intersection of gaming and fintech
Work from anywhere in the world with international teammates
Own shares in the Company - enabling you to benefit from the value you create

Some additional perks…
Co-working excursions: Travel to meet your colleagues in cities around the world
Awesome equipment: Get everything you need to work effectively
Remote working allowance: Put an additional $600 / year to optimise your WFH experience
Learning and development: Attend courses, conferences and training events
Social events: Participate in regular company events to relax and connect with teammates
Birthday leave: Enjoy a paid day off on your special day

We hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just because it's the right thing to do, but because it makes our company stronger. Join us!

Learn more about Carry1st…
Andreessen Horowitz shared why they invested in Carry1st
VentureBeat announced that Carry1st has raised $27 million to develop and publish mobile games in Africa
Remerge hosted Cordel on a podcast to discuss Carry1st and the African gaming market

4177770621.title: Lead Analyst - Product Analytics
4177770621.description:
About the job
Who we are:
Want to make an impact? Join our pack and come work (and play!) with us.

We believe everyone deserves the unconditional love of a pet—and at Rover, our mission is to make it easier to experience that love. Founded in 2011, the Rover app and website connect dog and cat parents with loving pet sitters and dog walkers in neighborhoods across the US, Canada, and Europe. We empower our community of trusted pet sitters and dog walkers to run their own pet care businesses on Rover with the tools and security of a global company to back them.

Headquartered in Seattle, Washington, we work closely with our teams in Barcelona, San Antonio, Spokane, and remote locations. We’ve got a reputation for being a great place to work, having been named among the 100 Best Companies to Work For in Seattle Business Magazine and Washington’s Best Workplaces in the Puget Sound Business Journal. We're an agile, fast-growing company, and our leadership comes from some of the world's most respected tech companies.

At Rover, our furry coworkers are just as important as our human ones—and we wouldn’t have it any other way. Along with making the joys of pet parenthood more accessible, we’re committed to fostering a diverse, inclusive, and welcoming community of pet people—and that starts with our employees.

Who we're looking for:
As a Lead Data Analyst you will help to ensure that the business is making data-driven decisions during all aspects of the product life cycle—from early-stage return on investment modeling all the way to designing, executing and analysing product feature experiments that drive value in Rover's marketplace. Product analytics has team members based in the US and Barcelona and Rover is looking to hire a seasoned or aspiring leader to conduct independent analyses, and in the medium-long term, manage a small team of analysts based in Barcelona.

You will be tasked with analyzing metrics that drive business performance on the demand and supply side of the marketplace. You will be encouraged to identify positive and negative changes in our marketplace while also working with the team to hypothesize and identify the underlying root causes of fluctuations in our metrics. You will be empowered to present the trends and the overarching narratives of marketplace performance to the broader organization. If there are clear actions that need to be taken to improve marketplace performance an analyst is expected to bring together both the evidence and the right people to find the right solution collaboratively. At the end of the day they are passionate about metrics and the performance of the business.

Your Responsibilities:
Serve as an essential thought partner with product and design teams to own end-to-end analyses, including scoping, executing, and interpreting product feature experiments.
Present trends, insights, and drivers of marketplace performance to senior leadership, providing clear, actionable recommendations to guide strategic decisions.
Lead and enhance Rover’s A/B testing processes, ensuring experiments are well-designed and effectively inform product ROI frameworks and customer success metrics.
Collaborate with engineering and data infrastructure teams to ensure seamless access to actionable, high-quality data.
Improve the analytics organization's capabilities by advancing statistical rigor, increasing experimentation throughput, and expanding modeling expertise.
In the medium-long term, support the growth of the product analytics team by managing and mentoring a small group of analysts.
Proactively explore new data sources and partner with the data platform team to unlock and maximize their value.

Your Qualifications:
6+ years of experience using data to drive business impact, including identifying actionable insights, crafting compelling narratives, and partnering with cross-functional teams to define and implement solutions.
Demonstrated experience mentoring and developing junior team members, analysts, and non-technical stakeholders.
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to influence senior leadership and cross-functional teams through concise, actionable insights.
Proven expertise in A/B testing, statistical analysis, and experimental design.
Advanced proficiency in SQL, with the ability to review and optimize code from analysts and collaborate with engineering on data models.
Hands-on experience with data visualization tools (we use Mode) and a track record of turning complex data into intuitive visuals.
Familiarity with modern data tools and concepts, such as event-based datasets, Amazon Redshift, and DBT.

Nice to Have:
1+ years of people management experience, with demonstrated ability to grow and support high-performing teams.
Experience in a two-sided marketplace.
Familiarity with Python, R, or a similar computational language.
Knowledge of product analytics tools (we use Amplitude) and event-based data.

Benefits of working at Rover:
Competitive compensation
Long-term incentive plan with a company performance-based cash payout
Permanent contract
Pension Plan
Meal tickets through Cobee
Generous PTO Allowance
Hybrid schedule
Private health insurance
Discounted Gym Membership
Bring your dog to work (and unlimited puppy time)
Monetary help for adopting a dog plus yearly credit to use on our platform
Flexible work hours, sometimes you’ll need to be in at certain times, but on the whole, we’re pretty flexible when it comes to managing workload and time
Grab snacks, fresh fruit, in our kitchen to keep yourself going
Regular team activities, including happy hours, game nights, and more

Rover is an equal-opportunity employer committed to promoting a diverse, inclusive, and inventive environment with the best employees. We’re driven by seeing our people succeed and grow, and we work to ensure everyone contributes to their fullest potential. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, protected veteran status, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable laws, regulations, and ordinances.

4120409112.title: Data Analyst Intern
4120409112.description:
About the job
NUDE means Freedom

No tener que seguir el camino tradicional y poder crear por ti mismo la vida que deseas. Siempre siguiendo tu pasión.

PROJECT means Process

Algo que está en proceso, que nunca se va a acabar y sigue creándose cada día. Un lienzo en blanco infinito donde siempre hay lugar para crear más.

NUDE PROJECT va mucho más allá. Nuestras prendas tienen como objetivo inspirar a las nuevas generaciones a perseguir su pasión. A raíz de un proyecto universitario que comenzó hace tan solo 5 años, hemos pasado de preparar los primeros pedidos en nuestra habitación de la residencia a vender más de 10 millones de euros.

Nuestra misión es inspirar a las personas a perseguir su pasión.

Para lograr nuestra misión, estamos buscando a un/una Data Analyst Intern para que se una a nuestro equipo de Finance 🚀

En este rol, ofrecerás soporte en la creación, diseño y optimización de dashboards en Superset, ayudando a garantizar que las visualizaciones de datos sean claras, funcionales y alineadas con las necesidades del negocio. Trabajarás directamente con nuestro Data Analyst, quien te brindará guía y apoyo en el proceso.

¿Cuáles serán tus responsabilidades?

Ofrecer soporte en la creación y desarrollo de dashboards interactivos en Superset. 
Ayudar en la mejora y optimización de dashboards existentes para que sean más funcionales y visualmente atractivos. 
Colaborar con el Data Analyst para implementar métricas clave y transformar datos en visualizaciones comprensibles. 
Documentar los dashboards desarrollados y realizar ajustes según las necesidades del negocio.

¿Qué te hará triunfar con nosotros?

Ser real y auténtico/auténtica.
Ir siempre más allá buscando la magia. Think outside the box 💡
Afrontar nuevos retos con ganas y de manera optimista. ¡Sin miedo al éxito!
Posibilidad de realizar un convenio de prácticas a jornada completa. 
Formación en Ciencia de Datos, Matemáticas, Estadística, Ciencias de la Computación o áreas afines (en curso o finalizada).
Familiaridad con herramientas de visualización de datos (Superset, Tableau, Power BI, etc.).
Conocimientos de SQL para trabajar con bases de datos.
Dominio de herramientas como Excel o Google Sheets para organización de datos.
Deseable experiencia previa con dashboards o visualización de datos, aunque no es indispensable.

Y… ¿Qué te ofrecemos?

Formar parte de un equipo joven y dinámico, con ganas de inspirar a las nuevas generaciones.
Flexibilidad horaria.
Descuentos exclusivos para nuestro equipo. 
Oficinas nuevas en el 22@, en Barcelona. 
Gympass
¡Somos pet friendly! 
Clases de inglés según el nivel
Afterworks & actividades de Teambuilding para fomentar el trabajo en equipo. 

Si te consideras una persona proactiva, sin zonas de confort y te apasiona el mundo del streetwear... ¡Te estamos esperando!🤎

¿No nos conocías antes? Te animamos a echarle un vistazo a nuestro canal de youtube.

NUDE PROJECT TEAM
NUDE means Freedom
PROJECT means Process
NUDE PROJECT
Nuestra misión es inspirar a las personas a perseguir su pasión.

4167008271.title: Analista Programador BI/Power BI (100% remoto)
4167008271.description:
About the job
¡Hola! Somos Procesia un grupo innovador en tecnología y asesoría. Nos especializamos en Ciberseguridad, Big Data y Transformación Digital. Trabajamos con personas unidas por una misma pasión: liderar la evolución hacia un futuro a través de la Tecnología.

¿Qué necesitamos?

Actualmente buscamos incorporar a 2 profesionales Analista Programador BI con experiencia contrastada en MS Power BI,para realizar la ejecución de un servicio de análisis y explotación del dato corporativo y de la elaboración de informes en Power BI.

-Las tareas/funciones a realizar serán las siguientes:
•Análisis, desarrollo e implementación de cuadros de mando en PowerBI
•Análisis de Datos para la identificación de KPIs.
•Modelado de datos para su posterior análisis.
•Explotación de herramientas de business intelligence (BI) y Data Warehousing

-Experiencia obligatoria:
*Experiencia de al menos 3 años en elaboración de informes genéricos con MS Power BI.
*Experiencia de al menos 2 años en el diseño de ETL con SSISo
*Experiencia de al menos 2 años en MS SQL avanzado (programación de funciones, procedimientos almacenados, vistas, etc.).
*Experiencia de al menos 1 año en programación con MS Sharepoint.
*Experiencia de al menos 1 año en otros productos de Microsoft Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate, Forms, etc.).


¿Qué ofrecemos?

👨‍👩‍👧‍👦 Integración en un equipo de profesionales motivados, en un ambiente de trabajo dinámico.
🍻 Un modelo de gestión sostenible y políticas de igualdad efectiva que fomenten ambientes de trabajo abiertos e inclusivos.
🏢 Modelo 100% teletrabajo. Aunque deberá tener disponibilidad para acudir puntualmente a reuniones presenciales en el centro ubicado en Paseo de la Habana 138, Madrid.
⏰ Horarios flexibles que se adaptan a tus circunstancias
 •Horario de invierno (15 de septiembre a 15 de junio): En horario flexible dentro de la franja horaria de lunes a jueves entre las 7h a 19h y los viernes entre las 7h hasta las 15h.
 •Horario de verano (16 de junio a 14 de septiembre): En horario flexible dentro de la franja horaria de lunes a viernes entre las 7h hasta las 15h.
🔝 Incorporación Inmediata proyecto Sector Público.
✍️ Contrato indefinido desde el primer día, porque nos encanta convivir con las mismas caras, nos apasiona la estabilidad y nos encanta trabajar en confianza...
💰 Salario Negociable, en función de experiencia
🎉 23 días (laborables) de vacaciones y, adicionalmente, 24 y 31 de diciembre festivos para estar con los tuyos
🌞 4 meses de jornada intensiva en verano, porque nos gusta el sol, la playa, la familia....
🥳Todos los viernes hacemos jornada intensiva para empezar los lunes ¡con más energía!

4124674341.title: Global Media Data Analyst
4124674341.description:
About the job
Job Summary

The Global Measure team is looking for a candidate for the position of Global Media Data Analyst. His/her knowledge of online media combined with his/her analytical skills will shape the core of his/her responsibilities.

The Global Media Data Analyst will play a pivotal role in ensuring the technical feasibility of product enhancements and new developments for Reporting and Measurement projects and tools, as well as being a tech liaison between the Product Owner and IT teams. Reporting directly to the Product Owner, this role will bridge the gap between strategic product vision and technical implementation, collaborating with IT teams while providing in-depth technical guidance within the Product team.

S/He will work with the Global Product Owner, and Global IT in the business and technical definition of Reporting and Measurement tools and projects.
S/He will support the Product team to align business requirements with functional and technical specification and architecture.
S/He provides data expertise and works closely with the Product Owner, and other HAVAS technical teams.
S/He contributes to the continuous improvement of working practices, application quality, tooling and agile processes.

Functional

Mission & Responsibilities

Technical Feasibility Analysis:
Assess and validate technical viability of Reporting and Measurement tools and projects.
Identify risks and suggest efficiency improvements and scalability for Reporting and Measurement tools and projects, and their technical frameworks.
Provide technical recommendations for enhancements and new developments within the existing tech stack, as well as potential integrations with other tools to optimize performance
Liaise between Product team and IT for seamless handoffs, and support IT implementation.
Media Expertise in Measurement and Reporting:
Leverage an in-depth understanding of media and campaign reporting processes to translate a business brief into a tech brief and guide data integration, visualization, and reporting requirements for market and client implementation.
Understand and collaborate on definition of KPI frameworks, naming conventions, data mapping, and schema design.
Data Governance and Best Practices:
Work with the Product Owner in defining and developing best practices for data governance, including mapping and transformation. 
Technical & Data Expertise

Experience:
4 to 6 years in a technical role within media, marketing, or campaign reporting domains, demonstrating a strong understanding of omnichannel planning and measurement frameworks.
Demonstrated experience in defining projects using reporting tools such as Power BI and Tableau, as well as working with cloud-based platforms like Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and Microsoft Azure.
Experience with Data Extraction and Aggregation Tools: Proven familiarity and hands-on experience with platforms like Funnel, Supermetrics, Datorama, or similar tools for extracting, aggregating, and integrating data from multiple sources to support reporting and analytics.
Familiarity with key Digital Marketing data sources such as:
Google Marketing Platform (Google Ads, CM360, DV360, SA360).
Social Platforms (Facebook Ads, Business Manager, Sprinklr, Paragone, TikTok, Twitter, Snapchat).
Other DSPs (Xandr, Adobe Advertising Cloud, Teads, The Trade Desk, Sizmek).
Verification Tools (DoubleVerify, IAS).
Technical Skills:
Expertise in Power BI, Excel, Power Query, SQL, GCP (BigQuery).
Strong understanding of data mapping, ETL processes, and naming conventions.
Soft Skills & Competencies

Excellent English – written and spoken -.
Problem-solving mindset focused on scalable solutions.
Good interpersonal and written/oral communication skills.
Proactive and ability to initiate.
Good analytical problem-solving skills.
Positive, persistent, and can-do attitude.

4151326084.title: Online Data Analyst
4151326084.description:
About the job
Online Data Analyst - Spanish (ES)


Job Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:
In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community
Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.

Qualification Path:
No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.

Basic Requirements
Full Professional Proficiency in Spanish and English
Being a resident in Spain for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Spain
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

Assessment:
In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

Equal Opportunity
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.
